Contains 8 landmarks, 4 flying carpets, spinner, rules for different ways to play and Madeline’s Guide to Washington! For ages 4 and up; 2 – 4 players

The game was released to celebrate the arrival of the newest Madeline book of the same name, Madeline at the White House.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Pulverheksa trår til: Det magiske pulveret
description:
You are walking around in the world of the Witch Pulverheksa. (Can be translated into the Powder Witch). Your mission is to find powder that Pulverheksa need to make good things like cake, sweet bread (Called "bolle" in norwegian) and soda water. But look out for the thief who want to stead your powder.

The game is played by rolling the die and moving in the ring around the edge. When you land on a Pulverheksa space, you draw a Pulverheksa card. If you get a powder card, you add it on the hand, but if you draw the thief you must put one powder card on the thief house. There are other space as well, such as the dream prince (Nothing happens) and small trolls (Miss a turn).

On the Soup Cockoo space (All the names make perfect sence in Norwegian and cannot be translated) you can move to the Pulver house. There you can roll the spesial visit die to see if Pulverheksa is home. Here you can meet the police aswell. The police give you all the cards placed on the thief house.

If Pulverheksa is home you can trade 3 powder for soda water, sweet bread or cake. When you got all of these you win the game.

Based on the childrens books by Ingunn Aamodt
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: CUBE: The Print and Play Game
description:
This game is based on the "CUBE" movies. Players wake up to find themselves in a cube. They have to find the goal and get out of the cube alive. To escape from the CUBE, you need memory and great luck. Sometimes the goal is right next to you, but sometimes it is too far to find.

This is a print and play game. The pdf includes the following components:
- 36 cube cards
- 6 character cards
- 12 item cards

To set up this game, the cube cards are shuffled and arranged upside down in a 6x6 grid. Players choose a character and place the token in the start position. On a turn, a player chooses a direction in which to move and turns over the card of the entered room. If nothing happens, the player can move safely into that room. If the card shows a trap, the player must roll a specific number on a 6 sided dice to determine if the trap could be avoided. If the trap could not be avoided, damage is taken and the room is entered. At the end of each round, the dice is rolled and the grid of cards is moved according to the dice roll. The entire grid is always changing. Characters have special powers and actions.

The game ends when all of the players die or if one of the players finds the goal and gets out of the cube alive.
categories: Dice, Maze, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Tomb Raider Treasure Battle: The Print and Play Game
description:
This game is based on the film "Tomb Raider." In this game, players collect treasures and rob them from rivals! When you battle, you need to anticipate your rival's action. You can't win with just good luck. It is important to choose what you do next.

This is a print and play game. The pdf includes the following components:
- battle cards
- player tokens
- treasure points and battle point tokens
- event cards
- game board

In each round, the active player rolls a dice and chooses how many spaces to move. Movement points can be converted to battle points. Event spaces on the board require specific actions. If players are within 5 spaces of each other, they can battle and attempt to rob treasures from each other. Players can choose attack and defense strategies or even try to avoid battle altogether.

The game ends when a player gathers 10 treasure points.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Gintama Red Cherry Blossom: The Print and Play Game
description:
This game is based on the film "Gintama Red Cherry Blossom." In this game, characters fight for their government or for their beliefs using weapons.

This is a print and play game. The pdf includes the following components:
- weapon cards
- player tokens
- life points
- surprise cards
- game board with track and card space

In each round, the active player flips a coin and moves his character according to the number. The player then needs to follow the command on the box stopped on. Players can fight each other by subtracting weapon abilities from the opponents'. There are also special bonus points for matching characters with weapons.

Each player has 5 lives and the player who has the most lives after two times around the board wins the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Sum Word Game
description: The party will be roaring as players sum up the 1-2-3 or 4 part(s) of a word by sketching, speaking or acting them out! It’s the best part of all three communication worlds. For example: honesty = on, nest, tea and hilarious = hill, air, e, us. Be the first team to SUM up 21 points and you win!
categories: Deduction, Educational, Party Game, Word Game

name: Measure Up!
description:
A trick-taking game with a music theme. Each card shows either a time signatures, a note, or a rest.

Players collect cards to create complete bars (including the relevant time signature), each of which score points.

On their turn, a player picks up a card (or cards) from the face-down draw pile or the face-up discard pile, places any complete bar they can create face-up in front of them, and then discards a card onto the discard pile.

The game ends once one player has used all their cards. Players score one positive point for each card they have on the table, and one negative point for each card in their hands. The player with the most points wins.

Contents:
56 playing cards (16 time signature cards, 40 note/rest cards)
rules

name: Bright
description:
The object of the game is to call "Snatch" when you see that a match between two cards has been made. Matches are made when the same shape or the same colour are shown on both cards. It does not matter how many objects are on the cards. For example, 1 Blue Rectangle matches 6 Blue Ovals, and 1 Red Star matches 3 Purple Stars.

The winner is the player who has the most cards after 15 minutes or the first player to collect all 54 cards.

name: Bus Stop
description: The goal of Bus Stop is to be the first player to bring all of your passengers to the bus station. Buses move around the board picking up passengers and carrying them from stop to stop, with the bus' movement determined by rolling a die. To reach the bus station your passenger must be on the front seat of the bus as it passes the station. If a bus reaches a terminus space, all passengers must alight.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Die Spieltruhe, Egel-Spelen, Morton Productions Ltd

name: Forgotten Counters of World War II
description:
This is an early ASL scenario pack by Critical hit used for tournament competition at ASL Oktoberfest. It is only 2 scenarios + 6 unmounted vehicle counters + blank cardboard counters for mounting 2 of the units. Both scenarios are on the Eastern Front in summer/fall 1941.


XK1: Encounter at Checkpoint Chapkevskoy, The Lithuanian Border, 22 June 1941



XK2: Katukov Turns the Tables, SouthEast of Mtsenks, 11 October 1941.


The first scenario is a smaller one mapper, with off board artillery.

The second scenario is a much larger 4 board map which pits German armor against Russian KV-1s and T34s.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Quark Matter Card Game
description:
The Quark Matter Card Game is a deck of cards consisting of representations of elementary particles: quarks and antiquarks as well as leptons and antileptons. The standard pack comes with a collection of four card games. The four games are funny as well as educational, as the game rules abide by the laws of physics. The four games included are:


Anti (2 players): Players try to get rid of their hands of cards playing them on the table and recognizing pairs of particle-antiparticle on the table, which annihilate themselves.
Quark Matter (any # of players): All cards are placed randomly on the table, face up, representing the primordial quark-gluon plasma. Players must be quick to grab the particles according to the correct sequence in the first moments of the universe after the Big Bang: first neutrinos, then lepton-antilepton pairs and lastly quarks and antiquarks to form baryons and mesons (which must be correctly formed). The player with most lepton-antilepton pairs and mesons and baryons is the winner.
Quark Matter Memory (any # of players): Memory-type game in which players have to find hadrons and lepton-antilepton pairs.
Find Your Higgs (any # of players): Memory-type game in which players could also search for Higgs decays.


Rules of other games that can be played with the deck are at https://getyourhiggs.com.

The game is available to buy at https://getyourhiggs.com.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Stackability
description:
Has the tagline "The funnest stacking game ever".

From the back of the box:

A great action packed game! Stack pieces 1 or 2 at a time, or by color!

Players race against the clock trying to stack unique pieces because nobody knows when Stackability will pop and shoot the pieces into the air.

Watch out! The direction of play can reverse on a roll of the die.

Don't let the stack pop or fall on your turn or you get a 'Stackability chip'.

Break a tie in an exciting "STACK OFF" challenge.

After five rounds, the best stacking player wins.

//end of box description.

The game has a battery operated base that you prime by pushing down. When the music ends the base is activated and launches the pieces into the air.

name: Zama: Scipio Against Hannibal 202 BC
description:
Zama, Scipio Against Hannibal, 202 BC, is designed as a fast-play simulation of the battle in North Africa. The battle ended the Second Punic War and the fabled career of Hannibal as a battlefield commander, arguably the greatest military commander who ever lived. (Okay, three cheers for Scipio Africanus, too.) The game comes in print-and-play format as well as a Vassal game module.
One player commands the Roman forces under Scipio, the other player commands the Carthaginian army under Hannibal. After determining the initiative at the start of a turn, the sequence of play is classic "I go - you go". Special rules for War Elephants and cavalry add to the historical flavor. Your goal is to rout the other army.
The game is designed by Michael W. Kennedy. It includes 89 game counters representing Roman, Numidian, Carthaginian and War Elephant units.There are six pages of rules

name: Kibamusha
description:
Kibamusha is an ancestral chess-like boardgame, from the feudal japan. There are only 2 pages of rules : it is not a complicated game. So a 9-year-old child can play Kibamusha, and even wins against an adult.

Kibamusha uses a gameboard of 9 rows by 10 files. Each player has 20 pieces (Ashigaru, Bowman, banner, Horse archer, etc..).
There is no dice in this game.

Some questions :

I) HOW TO WIN ?
In order to win, you must be the first player to place your own Bana (banner)on the opponent's first row (row 1 or 9, depending on the opponent's side).

II) It is my turn : what do I make ?
In your turn, you have 3 options.
a) Moving only 1 piece (useful if you want a fast advance for your Bana).
b) Moving 2 pieces.
c) Moving 3 pieces (including at least 2 Ashigarus).

III)CAN I TAKE (CAPTURE) OPPONENT'S PIECES ?
Yes ! Except the opponent's Bana.
The Bana is the most important piece : the Bana cannot be captured, and the Bana cannot capture pieces.
Your goal is to threaten spaces where the bana could advance : in this way, you can prevent the opponent's bana from moving towards your own line.

name: Richie Rich Big Money Game
description:
The Richie Rich Big Money Game was created in 1977 by Pressman and sold exclusively through ads in the back of Richie Rich Comics.

The game is roll-and-move, with players taking turns at dollar bill shaped spinner. Space include positive and negative dollar amounts, making this a watered down children's version of Monopoly, though there is no buying or selling involved. Occasionally cards are drawn which will augment or deplete a player's cash reserves.

When players amass a million dollars, they may enter the winner's circle by exact count. The first person to get there wins.

Based on the original comics (as opposed to the 80's cartoon) the game is extremely rare and, outside of the first few comic book issues, has become one of the most sought-after Richie Rich collectibles.

name: This or That?
description:
This or That? is a get-to-know-you game, so be honest with your answers! Player 1 draws a stick from the box and reads the question out loud. He decides which of the two options is his favorite and keeps his answer a secret until all players have guessed. After all players guess Player 1’s answer, he tells them what his answer is. If playing with points, each player to guess Player 1’s answer gets a point. Now it is Player 2’s turn to draw a stick and for the other players to guess. See how well you know your friends!

Components:

80 sticks with 160 questions

name: Monopoly: Emergency Medical Services Edition
description: Edition of Monopoly with a theme of the Emergency Medical Services. The traditional properties are replaced with locations such as Hemorrhage Highway and Intubation Intersection.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The King of the Garden
description:
This game, designed for children ages 3 and up, is set in the Kingdom of the Funny Little Bugs. The bugs are about to choose their king, and you "have to remember the characteristics of each insect to be the one to win the crown." Players move forward if they identify insect characteristics correctly. Players may also choose to play cooperatively.

The game includes a game board, 25 chips (including 24 insect chips, and one "magic bean" chip allowing players to move ahead), 4 character pawns, 1 crown, 1 fabric storage bag for chips, and the game rules.

name: Sport Dice Golf
description:
A golf dice game played on a felt mat. Dice are rolled and used for driving and putting, as well as for hazards. The map shows an 18 hole parcours.

To play a hole, you have to select one of the club dice. The dice rolled tells you how many spaces your ball will fly (or roll) and which direction (if any) it strays off course. Dice are available for wood clubs, irons, wedges and putters, all showing different ranges and trajectories. Choosing the right dice (and taking the right amount of risk) will maneuver the ball nearer or onto the space with the hole and the number of dice you rolled is the score for that hole.

name: Rules for the Great War (1914-1915)
description:
A booklet with tabletop rules. It contains all necessary rules and tables to simulate actions from early World War I with 15mm miniatures.

The various chapters of the booklet contain:

Game scale: 1 figure represents 50 infantry men; 1 MG with crew equals 1 MG with crew, and 2 ordnance pieces equal 1 battery consisting of 12 men and 4 horses.

Movement rules cover all kinds of hindrances, chances of mechanical failure when moving motorized units, and unit formations.

Morale rules cover all kinds of movement under fire, behaviour under fire and regrouping; every possible situation is handled by employing various dice roll modifiers.

Combat covers basically two situations: fire combat for rifles and MGs and artillery. Both types of combat are handled by rolling 2 dice and employing various modifiers for movement, cover, unit quality, etc. Damage is then determined by a dice roll on a table using the result calculated above.

Melee combat covers special actions between infantry vs. infantry as well as infantry vs. cavalry and cavalry vs. cavalry. Retreats and advances are possible in melee.

The last pages of the book show the organisation of the British Expeditionary Force and the Imperial German Army.

The center of the book contains a removable sheet with all necessary tables and modifiers for easy reference during play.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: When The Navy Walked
description:
When the Navy Walked is a miniature rules set that covers an alternate history from the 1872 Victorian era to the 1909 Edwardian Industrial Age. It is a springboard for imagination and a high-level game of tactics and battles set amongst a 'what if' world inspired by the classic authors of Victorian Science Fiction and Retro Science Fiction. In WTNW players take the reins of generals and command massive armies of steam driven behemoths. In the end, the thunder that cascades across the battlefield to settle in the souls of the fighting men will only be assuaged with the assistance of the landship.

When the Navy Walked is the first in a series of books that will outline the story and history behind this alternate Earth, its culture and the rules for fighting massive battles. In future supplements players will have the opportunity to play through various alternate historical scenarios, including the colonization of Africa and the deep, dark folds of the Aether. So grab your goggles and your Aethertech and get ready for a good time filled with steam and adventure!

name: Tricki
description:
Goal: Become the most dexterous one moving 11 small wooden dowels, separating one thing at a time


Select one out of 4 different games:
Grab all of them, form a fist and try to drop one thing at a time
Place all of them in your open hand and let them roll down, one dowel at a time
Put all of them between your 'Praying Hands' and drop one thing at a time, keeping your thumbs together
Fix all of them horizontally between your hands and drop one dowel at a time



Scoring: 1st dowel +1, 2nd dowel +3, 3rd dowel + 5 etc.


Fix 2 dowels with one hand in parallel and use the others to build up a pile - the higher the more you score



Combine the four blue plastic rings with the dowels, creating a higher challenge for the dexterity of the participants

name: War Kings
description:
Card game that can be played in 3 versions.

From the creators:

"War Kings is a card game modeled after the ancient warring times by which the rules and principles of the game are adopted from thirteen chapters of Sun Tzu's Art of War. In War Kings, the crux of the thirteen chapters are gathered and fully utilized, the function of each card is designed based on these principles."

There are 3 ways to play War Kings:

1) War Kings - The Battle!
Involves playing cards to attack/defend. You have 4 lives. Every time you win a battle you win terrain. Win 4 terrain you win the game, or if all other players run out of lives before you, you win the game. People can team up on attacks/defense
2) War Kings - The Duel!
Kind of like a complex version of war; cards battle with various cards having different effects on the battle.
3) War Kings - Enemy Attacks!
Rummy variant; want to run out of cards first and score points for cards played.

The first game can be played by 3 to 6 players utilizing the one game deck. The second game can be played by two using two separately purchased decks. The third game is a simpler game that can be played by 2 to 6 players.

The cards feature artwork, Chinese characters, and English text.

name: In bocca al lupo
description:
From the back of the box:

"What do you waitin' for? With "In bocca al lupo" (Good luck in Italian) you can live with your friends all the fun of the TV program that entertains millions of TV viewers! Playing with "In bocca al lupo" it's easy and fun. The game is divided in a series of trials, each giving a prize in "Golden Tokens". To win you have to uncover the "Black Sheep", to guess the "Mysterious Word", to be "Beware of the Wolf" meanwhile you have to remember a sequence of names, to solve the "Gipsy"'s riddles without draw the black moon, to have star's lucky in the "Game of zodiac", and to find the winning ace in the final showdown "Two Versus All"".

It have cards, a wheel with an arrow, a wheel for the zodiac (it's static: 12 cards are drawn and put down around the wheel), block of papers and two book of riddles, good for ten plays.

name: Huggermugger Mystery Wheel Sports Edition
description:
This is an expansion of the original Huggermugger game of 1989

The wheel in this game is intended to be used as an accessory when playing HUGGERMUGGER, the 'Mystery Word' Game.

name: Monopoly: Seine-Saint-Denis
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Seine-Saint-Denis, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Tower of London
description:
Goal: Be the first to reach your inner circled areas with all of your tokens (alike Pachisi)


You start within your coloured area at the outer range with 4 tokens (each of the tribes are named - from dark to bright: Normans, Anglo-Saxons, Britons and Picts & Scotti).
Roll the three dices and allocate numbers to appropriate tokens - you may add up, too. Rolling doubles enables you to roll the dice again.
Follow up the arrows

name: Isles of Glory
description:
The Story: The year is 1702. As a humble bean farmer, you have grown restless and yearn for adventure. You gather your belongings, sell your farm and purchase a small sloop from the local shipyard. With entrepreneurial vigor, you set sail for the nearest island, hoping to turn a meager profit on your final barrel of beans. The leaders of your nation soon hear of your courage and petition your service. They provide you with a small satchel of gold, a crew, and Letters of Marque. As a newly commissioned privateer, you must navigate the treacherous seas, and bring home great riches and glory to your country of origin.

Gameplay: A player’s turn begins by drawing one adventure card and selecting one action card. Depending on the type of adventure, the card may be resolved immediately (e.g. a group activity), or the card may be placed on the ocean map by the player. The player then sails to an island or ocean space, choosing to either experience an adventure, or trade in the market. The market is the heart of this game. Players aim to buy low, sell high, carefully watching future prices, hoping to turn a profit. The action cards provide one-time bonuses to fight pirates, escape disasters, trade in the market, etc. Gold is used to upgrade ships, explore shipwrecks, gamble, etc. The game ends when a player’s ship is upgraded to level 10, and victory goes to the player with the most gold.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Nimbi
description:
Goal: Force your opponent to take the last peg

Two players take turns making a move; a move consists of depressing as many or as few pegs as one wishes from a row in one of the three directions. That is at least one peg and at most the whole row.
After game ends turn the board and start a new one.
for detailed rules see ==> http://www.jstor.org/pss/2690025

name: Katani  pankur
description:
In Katani pankur (Banker of Catan) is exclusive expansion for CATAN, which was shared to participants of first Catan Championship in Estonia.

The Banker moves on different hexes allowing save the players's resources or collecting some profit from saved resources.

Components:

1 wooden Banker piece
4 plastic credit cards in 4 color
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Wrath of the Volcano God!
description:
INTRODUCTION
The timeless distant mist-shrouded isle of Aya-ooya! is marked on no maps, and its location is known to but a few neighbouring island peoples. To them it is simply known as ‘The Isle of the Volcano God’ .

On Aya-ooya! The people live, as they have done since time began, in perfect (if somewhat perilous) harmony with their environment. There are six main tribes on the island, each with their own land and traditions, and all competing for the resources and the respect of the Volcano God.

Players on their turn must tend to their needs of their tribe, as well as paying appropriate homage to the Volcano God. The winner shall be the player who’s tribe escapes most unscathed from the apocalyptic ‘Wrath of the Volcano God!’

THE ISLE OF THE VOLCANO GOD
The board represents Aya-ooya! also known as The Isle of the Volcano God which is separated into six numbered segments, know as lands.

Each land (from edge to centre) consists of shore, light forest, deep forest, lower, mid and upper mountain slopes and terminates at the Mouth of the Volcano God. The borderlands, exist in two lands simultaneously.

Also printed on the board is the Heart of the Volcano God where unclaimed lava tokens accumulate and the wheel of sacrifice, where sacrifices are recorded for each tribe.

name: Museum Jackpot
description:
Published by Pirston Promotions in 2010, the "Museum Jackpot" is a non-elimination type board game. The game comprises of artifacts in the form of 'dinosaur bone sets' or 'relics'. There is no limits of appraisal attached with these artifacts although hold minimum of one appraisal. The player can bid for these throughout the game.

However, the dinosaur bones have one distinct feature that each type of dinosaur, there are three bone set in the form of head, tail and torso, which are gained by players separately and if a player able to acquire all three parts of the same dinosaur, than it comprises one artifact and its value doubled.

The main objective of the game is to collect as many artifacts as possible along with searching for the jackpot while moving through the board. The player can gain extra appraisals and can trade, buy or auction the relics during the game. The appraisals have three level; red, blue and white. When the white appraisal exhausted, the game concludes.

The main strategy includes the removal of 'Fake' appraisal while comprising 'dinosaur bone artifact' as it the only time the 'fake' can be removed. At the end of the game playing having the jackpot appraisal won the cash from the jackpot box along with 'scratch off value card' as well as pre-game ante. The player having the most value of artifacts declared winner, however the player can not win ante, without possessing jackpot.

name: Numbers Up
description:
From their own description:

OBJECT OF THE GAME: The object of the game is to build high scoring number sequences cross-cube fashion with as many cubes as possible before the timer runs out. The player who exercises the greatest skill and strategy in forming and locating number combinations on the playing board to best advantage will attain the highest score.

This is the "Original Version"-(until such time yet another is discovered to refute such), that later kinds were based upon. It includes 15 six-sided dice with six-(6) varying numerals configurations upon those, to include some combination derived from the numbers between 1 to 15 upon their facile sides. There is also a "Sandtimer" attachment piece, to affix it onto a corner of the plastic GAME board/dice tray. Their "playing area" is comprised of an inset, plastic 9 X 9 grid in a "Scrabble-ish" demeanor, with *Special* placement spots denoting Double or Triple *Score*, as well with numbered sort from #4 to #15 arranged sequentially into an arrayed 'diamond pattern' 2-spots away from the center, as the middle one is their black START spot. The instructions are contained within their 'box-top', to include ample displays of numbers arrangements examples.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition
publishers: E. S. Lowe Company Inc., Waddingtons

name: Castelo do Terror
description:
From the box, in portuguese:
"È um castelo assustador, tem 2 andares, inúmeras dependencias horripilantes, onde vivem fantasmas, vampiros, mumias e lobisomens, todos tentando impedir que a princesa seja salva, Mas você pode salvá-la e ser o vencedor do jogo. Basta ter muita coragem"

"It´s a haunted castle, two floors and countless grim rooms where ghosts, vampires, mummies and werewoves lives. The monsters are trying to keep the princess captive, but you can save her and be the winner of the game. It´s only a courage matter."

The game is quite simple. Explore the castle and be aware of the monsters. Each monster have some weakness. Vampires are killed by wooden stake , werewolves by silver bullets, ghosts by the light of a lantern and mummies by knives.

name: Just William Card Game
description:
Game based on characters and incidents from the books written by Richmal Crompton.
44 cards, in 10 sets of four and 4 special cards featuring William himself and his 'sworn enemy' Violet Elizabeth. Players try to be the first to collect 2 sets.
Each player in their turn draws a card into their hand and then passes a card from their hand to the player on their left. You try to keep card sets where you have more than one card in the set (s), and have to hope you draw a matching card from the deck or you need a player on your right to pass such a card to you.

name: Brouhaha
description:
Brouhaha is a chess variant played on on a slightly expanded 8X8 board with pairs of two additional pieces added to a standard array.

The extra squares 'hang' off the edges of the board, with one on each corner and two in the middle files behind the king and queen. The extra squares which 'hang' off the corners of the standard 8x8 board are special; once the piece that occupies them moves off, they may never be entered again

The Clerics, which should be very close in value to Rooks, start in the corner squares. The basic move is that of an ordinary Bishop, but with the additional ability to leap exactly two squares horizontally or vertically.

The two Scouts start behind the king and queen and are very close in value to Knights and Bishops. The scout may step one square horizontally or vertically, or leap exactly three squares horizontally or vertically. Also, a Scout that has not moved yet this game has the added ability to move (once) like a Knight

name: Jungle Thrills
description:
Politically incorrect these days, in the fifties it was quite acceptable to make a game about Big Game Hunting on Safari. The animal cards are very nice though.
44 cards. Players aim to collect sets of three of the same animal. There are 6 cards of each animal per set and seven sets in all. So two sets of each animal can be 'bagged'.
There are also two 'Hunter' cards which allow a player to possibly take a set of another player that has already been 'bagged'.

name: The Game of Science
description:
From the publisher's website:

Want to be a marine biologist, an astrophysicist, and a mathematician all at the same time? No prior knowledge necessary! Want to play with microscopes, chemicals, and heavy machinery? No training required! Want to make exciting new discoveries and propose revolutionary scientific theories? Welcome to The Game of Science, where you can do all this and more--in an hour or less.

The game moves forward as you hire new scientists and outfit them with the tools of their trade. You'll use your scientists and equipment to make discoveries, which give you science credits (credibility and prestige, the currency of the trade). Your scientists can also mess with the research of other players as you compete with them to accumulate the most scientific credibility. And finally, you'll use your accumulated credibility to propose theories, the key to winning the game.

But the fun isn't over yet. Now the challenge is to convince your fellow players that you can use your theories to explain something new about the world. If they believe you, they'll let you win--but if they're not convinced, one of them might steal the show!

Every game will be different, as you explore new ways to combine scientists and decide on your favorite theories. No two games will play out the same!

The Game of Science is educational as well as fun. It was developed by scientists using real scientific concepts and experiences. We wanted to share the excitement, adventure, and humor of the day-to-day life of a modern scientist.

The game developers are also active in science outreach and education. If you are a teacher interested in using this game in your classroom, we would love to hear from you to share ideas and experiences.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: March Madness 2011 Texel Pack
description:
This scenario pack focuses on the rebellion of the Georgian 822nd Battalion against the German Army on the island of Texel in Holland during the last days of the war.

Texel Island was part of the Atlantic wall, and the key battles of this rebellion involve fighting for control of these strongpoints.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Santa Claus: The Game
description:
What child hasn't dreamed about being Santa Claus? Now they can with Santa Claus the Game! Open the Game box and immediately be transported into the Fantasy, excitement, and joy of Christmas.

In this delightful game players choose a sleigh and start at the North Pole. They race around Santa's Workshop trying to load their sleigh with 5 toys. Once a Santa has 5 toys, they fly off to the town to deliver the toys. Along the way, Santas encounter fun activities like belting out their best "HO HO HO" or Singing their favorite Christmas carol. The first Santa to deliver all their toys wins the game.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Pirates' Gold
description:
"A Game of Adventure on the High Seas". The box is nice, shaped like a treasure chest, and the map comes rolled up with a ribbon round it.
The board is map of the sea between Sail Point Bay and Treasure Bay, superimposed with squares. The game uses dice but in a novel way. Turn order is decided by chance and that order of play continues for the whole game. We will call the first player 'the Leader'. He throws a red die and consults the compass at the top of the board. There are 6 compass points and each points in a different direction. The number rolled dictates the direction of movement, for all players, this round. Then the Leader throws a black die and moves his ship that many spaces in the correct direction. Each player after that does the same, throw the black die and move, but not the red die as that is only thrown at the start of the round. There is a little choice in movement. You can decide to 'tack' and move in the direct opposite direction of the compass throw, but you don't move so far, in fact, you might not move at all.
There are perils to be avoided, like rocks or the dreaded Seaweed Sea where you just float randomly until clear of it.
The first player to sail into Treasure Bay wins.

name: Battaglia Aeronavale
description: Typical game of Battleship that adds 3 planes, which have no particular special skills. Each player places two grids side by side. In the first grid, hidden by a screenplay depicting the world, he has to place his units, while in the second one he will place some chips showing the coordinates of the shots fired. The player who first hits all the enemy units wins.

name: Topwords Kartenspiel
description:
A card game where have to build a crossword puzzle.

The game contains 100 cards, each one as one or two letters printed on it. 4 cards are drawn and put on the table in a row. The rest of the cards are shuffled, divided by the players and put in front of them as individual stacks.

On your turn, you draw cards from your stack until you have 7 in your hand and try to add them to the existing words already on the table in a crossword puzzle style. You may cover existing cards (therefore the name of the game); only rows are required to be meaningful words, columns can be any letters you like.

If you manage to create a new word, you score the points according to its length and the next player takes his turn. The game ends when one player has only one or no more cards to play.

name: Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe
description: Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe is a game that is about investing in combinations of the most profitable companies to earn the most money. The game models the westward expansion of railroads from the East Coast all the way to the Pacific. Players begin with a set number of cubes which they can choose to invest as shares, expand railroad networks, add to the value of resources or add resources to railroads. Like colors for railroads doubles income at railroad stops. Each railroad has a varied amount of stops and resource combinations to ensure that every game is different. When two adjacent starting railroads have fully developed their routes, the second stage of railroads opens up and dividends are issued to the first and second majority owners matching that company color. The game progresses until all players pass or there are no more valid moves to be made. A final dividend is triggered and the player with the most money wins.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Clover Leap
description:
Players herd their sheep around the board to collect Clover Tiles and also score bonus points for completing sentences. This game teaches children educational skills such as forming basic sentences and completing sets. The game play involves light strategy and also allows children to practice early reading and simple math.

Publisher's Description:
A Grammar Game Your Family will Flock To

Collect the clovers with your sheep to form sentences. Score with each subject, verb, adjective, and object. You’ll laugh at the wacky sentences you create!

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Early Vocabulary, Strategy, Basic Sentence Structure
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Wizkids DVD board game
description:
From the publisher:
Wizkids is the DVD board game that teases your brain. Wizkids is about science and technology with bizarre trivia and experiments. Wizkids is fast, explosive, varied and enormously interesting.

Challenge each other in five different categories and train your brain. The DVD gives you and your fellow players directions in the form of films, photos and animations about the most unusual subjects. With more than 800 extraordinary trivia!

Do you have the brains of a prawn or are you much smarter that the rest? Do you know more? Can you calculate faster, draw better and remember or recognize more? than you will certainly win the game!
publishers: Identity Games International B.V., Zapak Games

name: Zuniq
description:
Zuniq is an abstract game for two players, played in an 8x8 grid of evenly spaced dots.
Players take turns joining two horizontally or vertically adjacent dots by a segment. Eventually, closed zones will form. It’s irrelevant which player closes which zone; zones do not belong to any player.

There are only two restrictions:
- Once closed, zones are out of bounds for the players. They cannot move in its interior anymore.
- There can never be zones of the same size.
Zuniq’s goal is simple: to be the last player able to move. The player who cannot make a move (either because there are none possible or because it would make a zone with repeated size) is the loser. Draws are impossible.

name: Advance the Colors
description:
User summary:
Advance The Colors is the first widely-published set of 1:1 ratio rules to cover the American Civil War. The rules focus on simulating tactical and skirmish-level engagements between company or regimental-sized units with an ideal size limit of between 200-300 figures per side. Each miniature represents a single soldier or artillery piece and the rules provide for officer ranks, command and control, and campaign development of individual soldiers through heroic actions. The rules we're written primarly for 15mm miniatures but can easily be used with 5mm-25mm.

name: Rolling Ramparts
description:
In a world of Nomadic Hamlets, Temporary Towns and Moving Castles, you are the Captain King of a Rolling Rampart who has come up against an enemy Fortress in a battle of siege engines and fortifications.
Who will siege the day?

In Rolling Ramparts, players decide whether they will attack, defend or deploy the white flag for each of the six sections of their moving castle. Each choice has both benefits and drawbacks. Battle Dice are rolled and combined with their section's strength and damage is applied. Captain Kings continue the siege until one of the castles has three sections reduced to zero strength.

Rolling Ramparts was designed specifically to be included in the "36-Dice" family introduced by Asmadi Games.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Fighting, Medieval, Wargame

name: Ting Tong
description:
The far East, which has given us so many of the classic games, is the home of this new game Ting Tong.
Reminiscences of this origin have contributed to the charm of this edition with its 12 little bells and its unusual artwork.

Ting Tong is a game for people with a good memory. This you will find especially in children an they, therefore, have a good chance of beating adults. For this reason Ting Tong is an ideal game for the whole family and will give hours of fun to all.

10 tokens are hidden under the 12 little bells, for example the tokens with the numbers from 1-10, or those with the flowers, where the number of petals increases. The object is to uncover the tokens in the proper sequence. Tokens which have been uncovered in the proper order are kept. The player with the highest number of tokens at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Word for Word Junior
description:
Enter the world of word strategy with Word for Word Junior Edition. Players embark on a race of wits from one side of the board to the other with their pawns by correctly answering the designated, category questions. Armed with an arsenal of 1,500 razor-sharp questions, Word for Word Junior Edition challenges players to spell words, provide definitions, identify antonyms and synonyms and solve word puzzles hidden in rhymes and scrambled letters. Word for Word Junior Edition is simple to learn and fun to play. Word for Word Junior Edition is truly a thought-provoking game for those who dare to play it.

Components:

game board,
playing pawns
cards

name: Das kleine Metropolenquiz
description: A small trivia game about capital cities all over the world; with 100 questions and answers. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 possible answers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.

name: The Rapture Game
description:
Summary from the rulebook:

The object of RAPTURE is to have the most spiritual church with the RAPTURE occurs.

Each player, like yourself, represents a church. Fortunately, as you EVANGELIZE, you church's membership will grow numerically. But, unfortunately you will soon discover that your church is composed not only of SPIRITUAL and CARNAL members, but also of HYPOCRITES. On the other hand, your church can grow spiritually as you DISCIPLE these same members from HYPOCRITES to CARNAL and also from CARNAL to SPIRITUAL.

Along the way you will encounter CIRCUMSTANCES which, depending upon the presence or absence of SPIRITUAL GIFTS in your church, will either help or hinder your overall growth.

But sooner or later on one of the CIRCUMSTANCE cards, the RAPTURE will appear. (Guaranteed to get a rise out of everybody). Suddenly the game ends; and the SPIRITUALITY of your church is weighed in the balance (in this game, by a point system. Will your church be found wanting... more points?) The church with the highest score wins.

Definitions: Whats the RAPTURE? Something to get all up in the air about, and the point at which the game ends.

Whats the Church? Another good question. We've been debating it for years. For our purposes, in RAPTURE there are no buildings -- just people.

What are SPIRITUAL GIFTS? A part of this game and the REAL one. There are over 20 listed in the Bible, we've selected 7 for this game.

Whats the difference between a CARNAL and SPIRITUAL member? See 1 Corinthians 3:1-3.
---

The game is a roll and move type game with different things happening based on the different spaces the player lands on.

name: Kindergarten Spiel & Puzzle
description:
An extraordinary puzzle to play, learn and observe - a game idea that grows with the child. For 1 child (aged 2 and up) and 1 adult.

This Game&Puzzle contains three variations for playing and educating your child as he/she matures. The variations are:
· A sorting game for your child to learn to distinguish colors and forms (2+)
· A simple dice game for children ages 3+.
· A jigsaw and guessing game requiring careful observation, for platers 4+.

Aim of the games:
· Which piece belong to which dip? Sort everything correctly (2+)

· Who will be the first to reach the locomotive with their game piece? (3+)
· Who will be able to assemble the jigsaw and find the 10 differences? (4+)

How to play:

· Your child takes the kindergarten child as their game piece. Then yhey walk the figure up to the different wooden pieces and to the bear reflector. Each time the game piece reaches a wooden piece it should be inserted into the corresponding dip. All wooden pieces are inserted? Then you can try the dice game with your child.(2+)

· You take turns to roll the dice. The child starts. Depending on the colored symbol that appears on the dice the players takes the corresponding game piece and lines it up next to their own game piece in the direction of the locomotive. Then the child puts their game piece past the figure just placed and returns this game piece back into its dip in the game board. Then it´s theturn of the next player. The game ends as soon as the game piece of a player has reached or passed the locomotive thus winning the game (3+)

The child assembles the jigsaw on the picture base. Then they compare the finished jigsaw with the picture on the game board and search for the 10 differences. The 10 solutions are also hidden in the story to be read and loud (in the instructions) (4+)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: ALBUERA!
description:
ALBUERA! is a study and simulation of the Battle of Albuera (16 May 1811) opposing a mixed British, Spanish and Portuguese corps elements (led by general William Beresford and Lieutenant General Joaquin Blake) to the French Armée du Midi (Army of the South led by Marechel Soult) at the small Spanish village of Albuera, Spain.

-Game components :
1 mounted 50X34cm map (in 2 parts)
130 counters
1 rules booklet including historical study of the battle

-Scale :
1 counter = 1 regiment
1 hex = 200m
1 turn = 20 mn

Each player earn victory points for : destroying ennemy units, controling Albuera hexes, controling crest hexes between 1110 and 2712.

Turn sequence:
A French cavalry moves
B Allies form squares
C Allied artillery defensive fire
D French cavalry combat phase
E French artillery and infantry move
F French artillery and infantry combat phase
G French square markers may be removed
H Allied cavalry moves
I French form squares
J French artillery defensive fire
K Allied cavalry combat phase
L Allied artillery and infantry move
M Allied artillery and infantry combat phase
N Allied square markers may be removed
O All fire markers are removed
P Advance game turn marker

name: Orðaspilið: stafaspil
description: From the rules: A deck of 72 cards plus 3 scoring cards and 1 title card. Each card has a letter printed on it (each letter of the alphabet on two cards). The game plays similar to rummy; draw a card from the deck or discarded cards, lay down cards to form a word and discard one card. Each round finishes when the first player plays his last card and then the scores are added up. Game ends when someone has 1000 points (or 100 in the children's variant).

name: Gute Nacht
description:
A beautiful game dealing with a good night theme for kids 2 and up.
Roll the die, take a star from the bed matching the same color and the one with the most star win the game.

name: Quarter Bouncers
description:
Originally designed to be the ultimate "Quarters" game played on a basketball court, Quarter Bouncers requires some coin-bouncing skills and is especially challenging to teens and adults who are are competitive and enjoy party games. Now, it's also the ultimate "Hoops" game for kids of all ages and is played with a miniature basketball. It comes with mini basketballs to practice bouncing and then you use your own coin to bounce.
Who shoots better is the winner.

name: Anima Tactics: Kairos
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The duk/zarist Kairos is the younger brother of the 9 Fallen Angel, Ophiel, one of the lords of Samael. Even though he opposes his brothers radical view of humankind, he works under his command hoping that in this way he can mitigate his brother’s most extreme actions.

Warrior - Dark Samael - Level 45

Dark Valestis (Ki, Charge) - +4 Damage. Kairos may charge up to 16 inches.

Soul Spiral (Ki, Ranged Attack) - Distance (16 inches). +2 Damage.

Final Burst (Ki, Attack) - Final Burst affects all enemy units within 3 inches of Kairos. Kairos may spend an additional action point to gain +2 Attack.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Convoy
description: A roll and move game where the object is to have the most money after all trucks have circled the highway (ie: game board) three times. Players roll a die and move that many spaces on the game board and follow the instructions of the space they landed on. There are two types of cards which a space may say to draw one of them, Smokey Bear and Chicken Coop (weigh station). Again, the player follows the directions on the card. Players will gain and lose money both from the spaces on the game board and the cards mentioned previously.

name: Baby Jim
description: A dexterity Hoop-La game for children. Players must throw their 'hoops' over the Baby Jim figure (pictured on the box).

name: Eat It!: The Card Game – Music Edition
description:
In Eat It! players try to be the first to play all cards from their hand and their reserve piles. The deck consists of the standard 52 cards (featuring illustrations of political and cultural figures) along with eight special cards that alter game play.

Players take turns playing cards from their hand to a central pile following the rules of allowed play. Initially, cards must be played up from 3 to Ace; if a Joker is played, cards must be played down instead; a Martial Law reverses the order of play again. If a player cannot play or chooses not to play, he must "eat it" – that is, take the cards in the central pile, adding them to his hand.

If a player voids his hand, he draws the top cards (which are face-up) in his reserve piles. If he voids his hand again, he draws the face-down cards that remain in his reserve piles.

name: Castle
description:
Abstract strategy game in which 2 players try to reach their opponent's throne with one of their 8 soldiers. The throne is defended by walls on which soldiers can walk freely, but moving from the ground to a wall (or vice versa) is only possible on two orthogonally adjacent cells.

The game can be played on a go board, with 8 stones in each color.

This game is playable online at Super Duper Games.

name: Anima Tactics: Damien
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Like a shadow that crawls through the darkness unseen and unheard, like a dark angel bringing absolute silence, the Inquisitor Damien is an enigma even to the Church. To contain his abilities he has restrained his body in rune covered bindings and sealed his senses. Nevertheless, although blind, his eyes perceive more than any mortal sight has seen, illuminated by the clearness of eternal darkness...

Warrior/Prowler - Neutral Church - Level 45

Innate Abilities: Initiative, Immunity (Blind).
Lightning Slash: All of Damien's attacks ignore the target's Armor.
Phase: When using Bodyless or Lifeless Damien is considered Intangible. He ignores all movement penalties due to difficult terrain, and may withdraw from Hand-to-hand combat without needing to Escape.

Breathless (Ki, Attack) - +3 Attack. Damien gains a Damage bonus on this attack equal to the target's Armor.

Bodyless (Magic, Movement) - Damien may move up to 16 inches in a straight line.

Lifeless (Ki, Charge) - +4 Damage.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Das kleine Grillquiz
description: A small trivia game about barbecuing; with 100 questions and answers. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 possible answers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.

name: Pickup
description:
A game of frantic energy as you grow a small startup courier business to become the best in the city.

The game is for 2-4 players aged 10+.

Players assume the role of CEO of a small courier company, each company can be setup in different ways so that players can maximize the differences they have with other players and exploit different business styles.

Players must quickly collect parcels in a turn that uses simultaneous play, a game for the quick of mind and quick of hand. The more successful you become the quicker you will need to become in seeing opportunity and taking it.

Balance this out with a few moments to plan and purchase ways to grow your business with improvements or expansions, building you business through various growth stages, each stage offering more choices and options to make you business more efficient and profitable.

To be released mid-2011.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Economic, Maze, Print & Play, Transportation

name: Stackschach
description:
Stackschach (Stacks Chess) is a Chess-like game that provides “morphing” ability to change pieces and increase or decrease the stack sizes, in order to change their ability.

This game is one in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series. Rules to the game will be available in this entry for download.

name: Kleine Froschmusik
description:
Kleine Froschmusik is an educational game of memory and singing.

All frog-cards (with frogs in different colours or water lilies) are arranged in a circle face down. Players by turn roll a dice and according to the roll either exchange positions of frog-cards or try to turn up a card with a water lily or a frog in the corresponding colour. If the players turns up the correct card, he gets another turn.

As soon as a player reveals the third frog, he draws a concert-card. This cards show frogs in different posture / height. Players than sing a melody according to the sequence of the frogs (for example arms up = high-pitched, squatting = low-pitched). Then the player who turned up the third frog gets the concert-card as his score.

The first player to have 3 concert-cards is the winner.

name: NUTS!: Fire In Korea
description:
The men of my squad are cold, worn out, and short on sleep. We've been fighting for days and our advance seems to be challenged at every step. Just when we think we can take a breather, we're at it again.

Thwack!! Mortar fire and we all take cover. We have to keep moving.

We advance, running as fast as we can covered in layers of clothes against the cold, trying to keep as low as possible as the mortar bombs burst on the frozen ground. Thump, thump, thump. The slow burst of a Chinese heavy machine gun breaks the silence when the mortars stop firing. Another ambush!

It's simple really. In Fire In Korea you are a Platoon Leader and your job is to complete all your missions while keeping your men alive. But that's a tough job as the war was constantly changing. Fire In Korea takes you through the Forgotten War. From the opening period of the NKPA offensive through the other four phases of the war ending with the last phase, the Static War. All are covered and all bring their unique challenges.

Using NUTS!Second Edition as the base, this book gives you three ways to play:

1. You can play one of the six provided scenarios. These can be played solo, same side, or even head-to-head against your friends.

2.You can generate a game from scratch using the included tables and play either solo or same-side or head-to-head.

3.You can generate and play a series of connected games that span a campaign.

Fire In Korea includes lists for the US Army, USMC, ROK, KATUSA, British, Australians, Canadians, Chinese and North Koreans. Vehicle statistics and rules are compatible with NUTS! 2nd Edition and we've added some new ones. Follow the link below to the Table of Contents for more information. And the nice thing is you can take these new rules and use them in your normal NUTS! games as well.

In Fire In Korea you'll experience the Korean War in a way that no other rules has ever done before. In any case, all we can say is...
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Crown Duels
description:
Crown Duels is a 2-player card game that uses a standard deck of playing cards and an optional, self-printable playing mat.

The aim of the game is to destroy your opponent’s Nobility (picture cards) before they destroy yours.

Play requires hand management and a variety of simple rock, paper, scissors type comparisons using suits that play-out as a series of skirmishes between foot soldiers, trying to defend their Nobility from attack.

name: Revolver
description: Revolver is a betting game based on Poker. Players are each dealt two face down cards and then select face up cards from two rows in the table to build their hands. Players bet and then following this, another two rows are dealt which players select cards from. Players bet and the receive one more card dealt face down. The winner is determined using the regular rules of poker.

name: Auction Poker
description: Auction Poker is a card game based loosely on Poker. Eight cards are dealt face up and players use special bidding cards (1-5 per player) to win the cards to build their hands. Directional cards (1-3, "across" and "down") indicate the position of the cards being bid on that round. Players reveal their bids and the lowest bidder gets first selection of three identified cards or one face down card from the deck. After all players have built their hands, the winner is determined using the regular rules of poker.

name: 2, 3, 4 Play Air Hockey
description:
Hit the ice with 2-3-4 Play Air Hockey! This multi-player arcade
style game captures all the action of real air hockey - right on your tabletop! Listen as real air flows through its playing surface, gliding the puck on a cushion of speed! Using the included custom dividers, you can instantly convert the playing surface for 2, 3, or 4-player gaming! Push button flippers and built-in arcade sound effects help keep the action fast and fun.

Components:

1 Plastic game board (with 4 scorekeepers)
3 Playing field dividers
1 Angled divider
2 Straight dividers
12 Plastic pucks

name: Fun Meal Caper
description: Fun Meal Caper, invented by a veteran elementary school teacher, provides multiple levels of strategy to entertain the whole family. Filled with amusing twists and turns, Fun Meal Caper keeps every player in the game until the very end. The goal of the game is to collect all the items needed in a "fun meal": sandwich, fries, veggies, drink, dessert, and a toy. Using higher-order thinking skills, kids learn to look ahead and plan their best move. The players also experience moral dilemmas within the game, which gives them the choice of being fair or taking advantage of their opponents. Wet floors, good deeds, trades, and taking care of Nana who left her glasses in the car makes it a unique and delightful caper each time you play!

name: Musketry Like Thunder: The Greatest Civil War Battles Never Fought
description: Musketry Like Thunder is an ACW miniatures game featuring 11 what-if scenarios on the regimental level (although the system can be modified for brigade level). The scenarios range from small battles in an orchard to large corps level battles. Terrain and weather rules factor heavily into game play.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Dark Dungeon 5: Character Builder
description: Dark Dungeon 5: Character Builder is the fourth expansion in the Dark Dungeon series. This expansion comes with three new characters for use in the Dark Dungeon Games as well as instructions for building your own characters. Tools for developing character stats, abilities, race, and skills are all included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Dark Dungeon 6: Lair Builder
description: Dark Dungeon 6: Lair Builder is the fifth expansion in the Dark Dungeon series. This expansion comes with new monster cards, room arrangements, and floor tiles. There are five dungeon types provided (Goblin Lair, Crypt, Bandit Hideout, Forgotten Complex, and Lost Temple) all with varying degrees of difficulty.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Storm the Keep
description:
Storm the Keep! is a fast paced solo card game of medieval conquest.

Attacker and Keep Defender decks consist of four ranks in five suits. Match your attackers to the Keep's defenders removes them from the game. Attacker cards can be swapped out for the same rank or suit to help make a match. Defeat the defenders as quickly as possible to overrun the Keep and win the game!

Storm the Keep is a unique diversion that will keep you coming back to over and over.

Game Features:
- Uniquely designed cards
- Quick to learn
- Simple enough for young players but fun enough for even the most seasoned veterans

With victory only a few cards away... the Keep awaits you!

Includes:

- Keep Deck (18 cards)
- Player Deck (45 cards)
- Rules of Engagement Document

name: Circle Search
description:
A Decktet memory game for two children.

From the Decktet wiki:

On your turn, declare "I am searching for ..." and name the suit from one of the unclaimed aces. Then move your token one card clockwise and turn over the card your token lands on, revealing it for everyone to see. If that card has the suit you were searching for, claim the ace of that suit - unless it was a Crown, which causes you to put back in the middle of the table the claimed ace of the Crown's suit if you have currently claimed it. The excuse does nothing when one of the face-down cards.

The younger player goes first, unless the game was just played and someone one, in which case the previous game's loser goes first. Players take turns until all six aces are claimed. The player who claims the most aces wins. If both players claim three aces the game is a draw.

name: Coin Rail Yard
description:
Coin Rail Yard is a Solitaire game (1 player) where the player will take on the duties of the yardmaster for the game's Rail Yard. The player will operate the Locomotives which will break-down arriving Trains and build-up departing Trains.
The player will run through one of the sixteen scenarios, keeping track of how many turns that it took to complete the day's work. The final score will be determined by the number of turns plus any penalty occurred for mistakes.
There is a small amount of randomness in the game. There is also some flexibility in how the rail cars are arranged in the yard before the first Train arrives. This randomness and flexibility means that a scenario need not play out the same way the second time through. The game also comes with the guidelines for how to generate your own scenarios.
Several expansion maps are planned.

name: Big Boss
description:
Played similar with UNO.
The aim is to empty your hand of all cards. When playing with 2 players deal 7 cards each. When with 3 or more deal 6 cards each. The remaining stack of cards are placed in front of the players face down and the top card is them turned over and placed next to the stack.
There are plenty of special cards in this game:
When a "Pick 2"or "Pick 5" card is played, the next player must draw 2or 5 cards or play another 2 card,
"Skip Turn" skips turn.
"Bullet Proof" card blocks any skip or pick card.

Contents:

52 cards

name: Academe
description:
Academe is a quick, cooperative, filler card game for 3 players: one Thinker, one Teacher and one Builder. The players must expend and earn Ideas, Knowledge and Material by building inventions. Possible inventions are determined by turning over cards in rounds, and the player must choose which invention to build in each turn. If, by the end of the three rounds of the game, the team has earned enough of these three commodities to build a University, they win the game.

Because it is non-competitive, it can also be easily played by fewer than 3 people, if one player wants to play more than one character. In addition, the commodity targets can be lowered to make the game easy to win, for young children.

name: NHL Breakaway
description:
NHL Breakaway is a new and exciting action packed 2 player strategy card game. You and your opponent draw from the deck of cards placed between you. When you go to draw cards from the pile, you will draw Player Cards (they represent the players on your team), Instant Replay Cards (intangibles which
may momentarily affect a player or team’s performance) or Slapshot Cards (cards that have a more permanent effect on your team and the overall game).
With the help of your Player Cards and your other cards, try to win Possession of the puck during the face-off and then to go on the Attack to score more goals than your opponent over the course of 3 periods of play.

name: Pepper. Corn!
description:
A feeding frenzy for two bunnies.

This is a simple fishing game of capturing cards off the tableau. The game starts with an 8x3 grid of cards face up on the table. After splitting the undealt cards (using a split the pie mechanism) the players capture cards by playing one or more cards whose rank adds up equal or higher than the card being captured. Each of the capturing cards must share a suit with the card being taken. After the tableau is cleared, the players add up the values of their captured cards to determine the winner.

Even though the game was designed as a light game, it is almost completely a perfect information game. The only moment where there is not perfect information is when the players determine the split of the hand -- and even then they can figure out which cards the opponent is splitting. As such it could be played as a very memory heavy, intense, spatial game.

The game was inspired by the designer's pet rabbit who is by far the most enthusiastic and fastest eating bunny the designer has ever seen. The girl has no problems yanking food right out of her partner's mouth, but is readily aggrieved if she does not get her fair share of the produce.

name: Witty Zibi
description:
before each round, players take a team token and keep it hidden.
players can be distributed randomly in 2 or 3 teams, without knowing who are their team mates

During the rounds players fight each other using bananas cards to inflict damages. some other cards have special power like "healing", "counter" or "identification" (reveal the team token of the taget player).
When a player takes 110 damages, he is dead for the round and reveal his team token.
The round ends when the last player of a team is eliminated.
Players earns points depending of their teams and if they are alive or not.
Then another round begin...

The player with the highest score at the end win the game.

name: Alberta-opoly
description:
Alberta-opoly was created with the help of Albertans.

Alberta-Opoly hits the highlights with some of the province’s most interesting landmarks. Full of buffalo, crops, and parks, this game is truly about Alberta. So choose your token and roll the dice.
You may be the new owner of Dinosaur Provincial Park or meet aliens at the province’s UFO landing pad.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Pond Hockey-opoly
description:
Pond Hockey-Opoly is a game that brings back the memories of frozen feet, runny noses, fresh air and the way hockey is meant to be played.

It has all the action of a traditional property trading game... along with some nifty stick-handling fun! Buy your favorite ponds and rinks, then collect «warm-up shacks» and trade them in for «arenas». As you play, turn over the deeds to learn interesting facts about each pond or rink.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Marto
description:
A set collecting game. One player is assignated to be the Auctioneer. He takes no part in the actual play but he sells cards, checks sets and settles any questions from the players (The rules say his word is binding.)

Each player has an equal number of counters (not provided) and will gain some and forfeit some during the game. New cards are auctioned each round but players must bid 'blind' so they don't know what they are bidding for. If a player gets a set of two, they may 'cash it in' or they may keep it to try to get the third card of each set as this will increase the award from the counter pool.

The Magistrates set is a penalty set so you need to avoid collecting them.

The player with the most counters after all cards have been matched, wins.

name: Snowman Meltdown
description:
From the rules:
Players move "snowmen" (stacks of Icehouse), around a 4x4 board made of Piecepack tiles. The tiles specify the directions and distances the snowmen may travel. When players land on a tile containing opposing snowmen, they must melt one down or mug one. If the mugger’s victim capitulates, the mugger receives a coin that he can use to alter his movement or defend himself with a force field; otherwise, the victim is melted down one piece. Some tiles act as traps; if all your pieces are trapped, they melt, one by one. The winner is the last player with any snowmen left on the board.

name: Volcano Island
description:
Played with both Icehouse pyramids and a Piecepack set, players develop settlements on a 5x5 board according to a luck-free set of rules for building. (Neighboring settlements support or limit what can be built.)

Dice are rolled to determine in what round lava will begin to flow from a volcano in the center of the board. In each round after the eruption, one player extends the path of the lava in an orthogonal direction of his/her choosing -- destroying any settlement in that space. The game ends when a player is unable to move or when all lava tiles are placed. Players score remaining settlements by size.

name: Contiguous Collapse
description:
This is game #18 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

In this game, players alternate turns moving and capturing an enemy piece, while avoiding a cascade effect that could result in a number of their own contiguously connected pieces being eliminated during their turn.

Play starts out with players alternating turns placing one of their pieces on the board. Once each player has placed their 12 pieces on the board, play begins, with each player attempting to capture an enemy piece while avoiding removal of their own pieces in the same turn.

The flow of the game is one that starts out very strategic in nature, then shifts to a very tactical one in the second half.

name: Top 13
description:
A game of imagination and insight in which you make up words from the letters that chance brings your way. The multitude of variations that crop up as you play the game make every game go different and exciting.

containing:
13 letter dice (d6)
1 cup
1 timer (1 minute)

One of the players controls the game:
He or she takes charge of throwing the dice and making sure, with the aid of a sand-glass timer, that the players do not overrun the time. To begin the game he puts the timer on the table and throws the thirteen dice. each player, using the letters that turn up on the letter face of the dice, then tries to make a word. each letter has a value which is indicated beside it. The player who, within the allotted time, manages to make the word with the highest score (the sum of all letters used) is the winner.

name: ARAM
description:
Released in magazine Spielerei No. 8.

Both players receive 12 playing pieces and places them on his base line.

Players take turns and move a single piece when it is their turn. The playing spaces both determine the distance and the direction of the moving pieces. White - one space, yellow - two spaces, red - three spaces. Spaces with own playing pieces are ignored during the move, opposite playing pieces are removed.

Last player with playing pieces wins the game.

name: CampAntics
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Welcome to CampAntics, the board game of summer camp adventures, mischief, activities, and lots of social interaction. If you’re curious about summer camps, or have already been to one, you’ll love this game!

CampAntics is primarily for children from 7 to 14 years of age. The summer camp theme is also very attractive to older children, parents, and grandparents. Each trip around the board is one, very realistic day at camp. Campers decide how many days to play, and enjoy a social experience like no other. During a camper’s stay at CampAntics, points are won and lost with the ups and downs of daily life at a great summer camp. Each space on the board relates to an activity that you would do at camp. Some spaces will reward you for an activity and others will penalize you for let’s say... throwing a water balloon. You roll dice to move and each trip around the board is a day at camp. You choose the number of days based on level of play. The winner is the camper with the most points (acorns) at the end of the game.

name: Pyjamaparty
description:
In Pyjamaparty players are little vampires who are flitting from bed to bed at night instead of sleeping. Yes, you might think that vampires should be roaming the halls late at night, but junior vampires need their sleep as much as non-vampiric youngsters.

To set up the game, each player places her bed tile next to the rug on the game board of the same color, then places her pawn on a rug that is not her own color. Someone shuffles the six garlic cards and places them face-down on the game board, then players mix the spider and orange juice drink tokens face-down, place them on the game board, then draw one at random and place them on their bed.

On a turn, a player rolls the die. If she rolls a number, she moves that many spaces clockwise or counter-clockwise on the rugs on the edge of the game board. If she lands on an empty space, her turn ends. If one or more players are already on that rug, she chooses one of them, then draws a face-down token and places it before her without looking at it. The chosen player draws and reveals another token. Each player then makes what they think is the appropriate noise for these two items hitting one another: "clink" if two glasses, "oomph" if two spiders, and "splash" if one of each. The active player reveals the hidden token: If both players were correct, they each claim one token and place it on their bed; if only one player was correct, she claims both tokens; and if no one was right, the tokens are placed face-down on the board again.

If the player rolls a garlic bulb, everyone screams "Garlic!" then tries to get in bed because their screaming probably roused Dad, who will be annoyed to find them out of bed. Here's how this works: The active player reveals the top garlic card. If it shows a closed trap door, then each player moves one rug toward their bed (or onto their bed if they are already on their rug). If all vampires are in bed, stop turning over cards; if not, turn another card. If Dad shows up on one of the cards, every vampire out of bed loses an item while vampires in bed may take an item as a reward.

When a player has eight items on bed, players hold a garlic round. If this player reaches bed before Dad arrives, she wins; if not, she loses an item and the game continues. Note that one or more players can receive their eighth item as a bonus at the end of a garlic round. In this case, these players immediately win as they're already in bed!

name: Marble Shooter
description:
Dexterity game for two (or more) players. The board is a kind of "uneven hexagon", with goal zones at two ends. Each player holds a "shooter", a small wooden device that holds marbles with a magnet. The marbles can be shot out to hit a wooden disk - the goal of the game is to edge the disk into the opponent's goal zone. Play proceeds simultaneously, there is no turn order. The first player to score an agreed number of goals is the winner.

(user summary by HilkMAN)

name: Flummox
description:
Flummox is a tug of war fought with cards and brains. Each player has an exposed hand of cards they use to move and shift the Flummox token around the table. Sometimes players want to get the Flummox to land in their own hand, and sometimes it's best to send the Flummox to another player. Special cards can Stop, Bounce, Slide, and Bump the Flummox as it travels around the ring...sometimes with surprising results.

Flummox is a card game for 2 to 5 players and is suitable for families, parties, and gamers alike. The box includes 108 cards, a rule book, and an oh-so-cute Flummox figurine.

name: Animal Safari
description:
Go on safari to find the most animals in this fun, tactical, maths game.
How many animals will you see? Roll the dice and choose how to move, collecting animals as you go. Be careful, other players may take your animals before you reach the safety of the camp!

- Develops counting and addition skills
- Encourages strategic thinking
- Links with Early Learning Goals and National Curriculum Maths
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: "Mother Hubbard"  Mystery Game
description:
Card Game that features the box as part of the game-play. In fact, half the rules are devoted to using the box, much as a conjuror might use it. The game-play is Old Maid with the added variant of the box.
The box has two end flaps, one showing Mother Hubbard's dog's tail with his tail up. The other flap shows the tail as being down. How to make use of the box is in the rules that are presented inside a bag.
