This way, the boy or girl who received the game could open the secret bag and read the instructions, making sure no-one else sees them.
To add to the amusement of the game, the box can be made to look empty (so the cupboard is bare) and it can be made to look full with various cards in it. A very odd game.

name: The Rift: A Scifi Boardgame
description:
Annihilation Imminent!

It looms before you like a great gaping maw, threatening to consume everything: a vast hole in space and time, of matter and void, warping the very fabric of reality, causing chaos and unexplainable, horrific events. It grows at an exponential rate, leaving you precious little time to research the cause and find a solution that will mend the Rift and save the universe!

From 2-4 players will race across the Cosmos trying to gather enough technology to seal the Rift before it’s too late. Conquer planets, fight aliens and avoid deadly hazards. They are only means to an end in your time-critical mission.

Planets are setup randomly so gameplay is different every time. Events have large effects on the board so players must be careful as to where they move and conquer. Once you have captured enough Aliens, their combined research points will help you to buy Tech which will not only help against your enemies but is necessary to seal the Rift. Uses 12-sided dice.

name: Gespensterburg
description:
An exciting race through a haunted castle.

Answer trivia, complete rhymes and recite tongue twisters based on classic horror stories and films to advance through the haunted castle. The first player to reach the Black Raven wins!

name: Wie weet wat Quiz
description:
The "Wie weet wat Quiz" is an educational family game with questions about six categories.
Each player has to move over the board answering questions to move his meeple, and in the same time trying to block other meeples paths and not be blocked himself.
Goal of the game is to reach the finish first

name: Even Odder
description:
This game is game #28 in Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

Even Odder features several layers of contradictory victory conditions that force players to use discernment as for which would be most likely to be feasible to do, with the final one where the winner is determined by whether their tallest stack is even or odd. The play mechanics are similar to those found in Sight Reduction, game #27 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series, including a randomized board layout to start, and line of sight being used to determine whether or not a piece can join with another piece in a stack. Unlike Sight Reduction, pieces join together with other friendly pieces to grow a stack, as opposed to being removed from the board.

name: Happy Holidays The Christmas Game
description:
In 2010 this game was given to LEGO employees around the world as a special treat.

The aim of the game is to collect as large a pile of presents as possible, but you may only count two colours of present when the game ends.

Now here's how you do it:

The youngest player goes first. Play then continues clockwise.
On your turn do the following in order:

If you do not have a reindeer in front of you must take one from in front of any other player.

Roll the LEGO® Dice and carry out the action you rolled.
Watch out! If you do not have a reindeer in front of you and forget to take one BEFORE you roll you miss your turn!

The dice has the following sides:

4* Sleigh stack (each showing two colours)
Do the following in order:
1) Take a gift matching EACH of the colours you rolled from the around the tree and place both onto the sleigh in front of you. If there are no gifts of one colour only take a gift of the other colour. If there are no gifts of either colour roll again.
2) Choose ONE of the colours you rolled and take ALL the gifts of that colour from the sleigh and place them in front of you.

1*Reindeer reward
Choose a sleigh and take ALL the gifts from that sleigh and place them in front of you. If you choose a sleigh in front of another player swap the sleigh in front of you with the sleigh you choose.

1*Christmas wish
Choose a gift colour. Every other player must give you ONE gift of that colour if they have any. Place all the gifts you receive in front of you. If nobody has any gifts roll again.
Stacking your gifts

When you take gifts from a sleigh or receive them from other players make separate stacks of the gifts of each colour you collect and keep them in front of you.

Remember! If you do not have a reindeer in front of you and forget to take one BEFORE you roll you miss your turn!

How to win the game
The game ends when gifts of only ONE colour are left around the tree, or when all the gifts have been taken. Any other gifts left on the sleighs or under the tree are out of the game.

Each player now builds the tallest stack possible using gifts of only TWO colours. Any other gifts collected by each player do not count. The player with the highest combined stack
wins the game.

name: The Original Chicago Trivia Board Game
description:
This game is just what it sounds like, a Trivial Pursuit type game using trivia that is entirely about Chicago. It's broken into six categories: History/Geography, Big Bucks, Politics, Sports, Entertainment and PhD.

The game is very hard, even for long time Chicagoans. The questions are extremely difficult to begin with and you can lose category chips for wrong answers in some situations, including the last question to win which your opponents get to choose.

name: Zed Force
description:
They came at us for days. The brass said that they would be coming with that large a concentration of living people but I don't think even they had a clue how many there would be in that first wave. We weren't worried, though. I mean we had everything that the Army could provide. We had guns, composite body armor, soldier-to-soldier networking with real-time satellite image feeds. They pulled out all the stops.



    And it meant diddly.



    This wasn't an enemy that we needed to hunt down in an urban environment or a stand up fight with another military. This was a feeding frenzy, pure and simple. All our toys and gadgets, training and preparation, hadn't prepared anyone to fight an enemy like this. We had to relearn everything and fast. No more shots to center mass. No more munitions designed to injure and disable.



    But we did it. Between us regular grunts and the civs that fought beside us, we kept the zeds back long enough to build the wall around the settlement. That gave us a safe place to stay as well as a launching point and supply depot. From there, we took back the world from those stinking corpses.
-- Sgt. Larry Winslow, retired, on the battle of Settlement 15





Zed Force is a solitaire hex-chit wargame. You must hold against the hordes of the undead while engineers complete the wall around one of the remaining human settlements. Uses a combination of standard dice rolling and chit-pull. Instead of simply fighting the undead, you must also manage your limited resources and choose when to call for reinforcements, when to focus on building the wall, and when to develop new tactics for this completely unforeseen enemy.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Pontremolis ...una città in scatola
description:
A game of life narrating the history of Pontremoli (town in Northern Tuscany) and its territory, from neolitic sculptures through medieval rivalries and ambulant book sellers, up to the twenty-first century, with the town still known as a "city of books".

Game-play follows standard game of life rules: players roll a die, move up their pawn a corresponding number of spaces on a 54 spaces track, and follow the instructions written on the space where their movement ends. Aim of the game is ending up on the very last (54th) space of the track.

Lavishly illustrated by artist Paola Colleoni and complemented by a booklet providing the players with accurate historical information about the game spaces.

name: Diversion
description:
The game is played on an 18 by 24 square board on which are a pair of home bases for each player, one on each of the short sides of the board. Six barriers are placed in predetermined positions on the board. Each player has two playing pieces and places them off the board next to his bases. He has 3 sets of tiles each set consisting of five tiles, one each of lenght 2 to 6 but only has access to one set at the start of the game.
On the first turn each player in turn places one of his tiles orthogonally such that it covers his home base and no other home base, and moves his playing piece onto the far end of that tile. On subsequent turns a player may start building from his other base or continue from where he has got to by playing a tile that must link up by overlapping at least one square side with his existing tiles. The connected playing piece is moved to the free end of this tile. However, each tile played MUST be longer than the last played tile and players must play if they can legally do so. Each time a player is forced to pass, the next player gets a free move which consists of one of:
Move a barrier, move his playing piece onto or along another player's track or lay any length tile he chooses. As soon as one player runs out of tiles, all players take their next set.
The first player to bring his two playing pieces to orthoganally adjacent squares is the winner but if one player runs out of tiles then the player with his playing pieces the closest together wins.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Babylon 5 Wars: Variants-1
description: The first compilation of ship variants suggested by players and fans around the world! 37 variations on existing hulls, dozens of new rules and options, strange new weapons systems and much more, all crammed into a handy 48-page package. Variants-1 is the first in a series of essential tools to help make B5 Wars the most exciting space combat game ever!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Round the Bases: Major League Cribbage
description: Round the Bases is played with Cribbage basics on a board marked with baseball "plays" and with dice for deciding the outcome of those plays. The offensive players advancement on the board is based primarily on the difference between his points and the defense.

name: Powerz
description:
From the game's website:
"Powerz is a Mobile Action Game - a "MAG" for short. MAG's are ultra-portable games that go wherever you go. You can play in person and also online or via portable devices. Game pieces in a MAG exist physically and also virtually in an online player collection. Each piece provides the player with actions they can take in the game. In the Powerz game, each Power provides a player with super powered actions they can use to challenge and defeat other player heroes."

Powerz is a customizable game that is sold in packs of "battle stickers". Each pack comes with enough stickers for two people to play. The game is played by using powers stickers cards to customize a hero or villain. Each power card has three abilities and each ability is assigned to the paper, rock, or scissors sign. Rock abilities are attack, paper abilities are defense, and scissor abilities are movement.

Combat in this game is done via Paper, Rock Scissors. When a player throws a sign they also call out which associated power they are using. There are numerous special abilities int he game.

name: Over a Barrel
description:
UNRELEASED GAME



Note that all details for this game are preliminary. If you have information about this game, you are invited to edit this section or submit corrections.




Over a Barrel is a merchant game about the East India Company in the 16th Century. It's a fine-tuned, well-crafted adventure on the South Sea, showcasing brilliant new mechanisms and a subtle element of good-ol' board game danger.

name: Photo Safari
description:
Photo Safari is one of several "LP games" released some time in the 80s, where the "box" is the shape and size of a record sleeve and folds out to reveal the board.

This game features a spirally linear track through the jungle, along which players move their pieces according to the roll of the die. Some squares offer photo opportunities which yield money; others force a player to take a detour or lose moves. The goal is to reach the end of the track and return. Once a player has returned to the start those still on the track begin to lose money for each move, so the winner is not necessarily the player who moves the fastest or takes the most photos.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Would You Rather? DVD Game
description:
From the publisher:

Would you rather your hostage negotiator be Ozzy Osbourne or Jessica Simpson? It's your choice when you play Would You Rather? the DVD board game packed with deranged dilemmas, difficult choices and a lot of laughing. Players take turns answering absurd and randomly-drawn questions from the DVD. Selecting an answer on their voting card, it's up to all the other players to try and correctly predict which answer they think the player selected. Based on the best-selling Would You Rather Books, this DVD game is sure to break the ice at any party....and keep that party going for hours! For 2 or more players.

name: "For Freedom!" Card Game
description:
The nations of Europe are falling one by one to a ruthless and powerful enemy…

Secretly, in their forest and mountain strongholds, armies of courageous volunteers are organizing themselves to fight for their nation, or die in its defense!

“For Freedom!” is a tabletop, card-based, strategy game played between two people. Each player takes command of one of two opposing nations from World War II. Use each card cleverly to attack your opponent and his resources, while defending your own!

Whom will YOU command?

Wehrmacht – command the Blitzkrieg of Nazi Germany to encircle and destroy your enemy with tanks and aircraft. Don’t let your compassion keep you from victory…

Ukrainian Insurgent Army – command the partisan troops of the UIA in raids and sabotage operations to break the attack of your enemy. Don’t let the conqueror destroy your homeland and take away your freedom!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Haunted Village
description:
Common folk think you are a madman – but that's because they fear what they cannot comprehend.

You’ll have to gather all your strength to beat the demon that inhabits the church. Be the first to defeat him otherwise it will be too late.
 
This is the game for 2-4 players. Start your adventure and place 3x3 Outside location cards face down. Each player takes a book that was given to them. Place Inside locations, Adventure deck and Bosses near the board.  Players start their turn by taking 1 card from Adventure deck then they must beat the ghost on location, play Adventure card and move. There are different types of cards (see rules). The main point of the game is to beat Boss with enough points in your collection.
 
Compete with others by playing Action cards and Ghosts on them. But be careful not to give advantage to them.

This is an adaptation of the print and play game Fatal Frame
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Horror, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Black Box Game Book
description: Eric Solomon wrote this book, to set 80 problems for keen Black Box players. The problems were sorted by a computer (very high-tech for its era).

name: The Nose Game
description:
A game you had to collect, the cards being in with your packets of cigarettes.
It is a set collecting game but with the novel feature that you are collecting noses. The amusing cards feature five kinds of nose - Artistic, Impulsive, Enquiring, Aggressive and Commercial.
There are 10 examples of each type of nose and you presumably had to collect as many types of the same nose as you could.
As often happens with cigarette card games, the cards remain within the family but the rules (which you wrote off for, all those years ago) are lost.
The advertising leaflet proclaimed "Laugh while you play - learn character-reading at the same time".

name: Wissens-Quiz Space
description:
The players have to collect 8 knowledge chips of every color. The chips are rewarded for answering one of 1000 questions out of different fields of 'space' knowledge (Planets, space travel..).
During player's turn die is rolled; he/she may move into any direction, but not vice versa; occupied spaces may be crossed.
Appropriate card is drawn, die is used to pick a question - if the answer is correct, player may add an additional turn - moving again. You pick a chip if you find a correct answer for a space on the outer circle.
To compensate lack of knowledge children may draw - if they fail - an additional card.

name: Welt des Automobils
description:
What is the fastest series-produced car in the world? When was the first crash test dummy built? And what is the Michelin Man's real name? Welt des Automobils (World of Cars) is a quiz game with 600 questions about car models, car manufacturers, advertising slogans and technology.

In each round, one player reads the question on a card, followed by the five possible answers. Unlike most other trivia games, the number of correct answers to the question ranges from one to five, but players don't know how many answers are correct. After reading through the answers once, the player reads them again one by one. Players secretly decide whether they think an answer is correct, hiding one of their answer tokens in hand if they think it is. Players reveal their guesses simultaneously, then place their tokens on the numbered answer card.

After players have guessed on all five answers, the correct answers are revealed, and the players may move forward on the scoring track:

If a player has placed one or more tokens on incorrect answers, he does not move on the scoring track.
If a player has placed tokens only on correct answers, he moves forward a number of spaces equal to the number of (correct) answers he selected.


After an agreed-upon number of questions, the game ends, and the player who is furthest on the scoring track wins.

name: ZEFIX!-Memo
description: ZEFIX!-Memo is similar to Memory in that the game is played with tiles, which come in pairs, and on a turn a player flips two tiles – keeping them if they match and returning them face-down if they don't. What's different is that the tile pairs don't have identical images, but rather one tile features a choice Bavarian insult and the other depicts this insult visually. When all the tiles have been collected, the game ends, and the player who made the most matches wins.

name: Horus Line
description:
The players must "pray" the mighty Horus, drawing from a bag wooden tokens in two different colours. The player in turn declares how many "pray token" will be able to draw from the bag, avoiding the negative colour. The player on the lefts has two options: he can overdeclare or he can "challenge". If he overdeclares, the player on his left can "challenge" or overdeclare and so on until one of the player challenges the last declaration. Now it's time to "pray", that is drawing one at a time, the tokens from the bag. A player succeeds if he's able to draw exactly the number of tokens declared without taking the wrong colour. If he fails the wrong token goes to the challenging player, while all the "pray tokens" go back into the bag.

The game was published in KidultGame's Game in a bag" line.

name: Reds
description:
Reds is a trick-taking game for 2-6 players played with a standard deck which has the suit of hearts removed. Reds uses some interesting mechanics, including an anti-trump suit which will almost always lose a trick, bidding which encourages risk-taking and rewards skill, and variable exchange of cards which leads the game through several different stages of luck and strategy.

Called "Reds" due to diamonds being trump, this is an interesting use of a three-suited deck.

Each round is 5 tricks, and each game is 9 rounds. The deal is a straight rotation, moving clockwise every round. Each round, players bid before a pre-determined amount of cards in their hand are passed to another player. This allows for interesting strategy and even an element of bluffing. As the game wraps up, fewer and fewer cards are passed, lending the game a transition from heavily luck-based to heavily skill-based.

Playable with a standard deck (hearts removed), a pad, and a pencil.

name: Criterium. El gran juego del ciclismo
description:
This game covers almost every aspect of a cycling race. It features rules for ascension, sprint, time trial (even a different rule for mountain time trial), and provides mechanism to run a single race.

The board is customisable with the provided little arrows. It is just a plain 100-field board.Before the race you must decide how long will it be (recommended: 150 to 250 squares long for a one-day race, that is one and a half to two and a half laps) and where you place the different mountains and sprints.

What is puzzling is that you have to remember (and possibly write down) in which lap are placed the mountains. In effect, it is recommended to have three climbs during the race, and each climb takes place in a different lap. The same applies to special sprints. So you end up with a board with too many arrow pointing at mountains and sprints that might or might not be there.
We have six national teams of 5 riders each, and every rider has different abilities which affect the probability of having a good throw on a given type of road. As you can see in the team cards, riders have values for flat road (LL = "llano"), mountain (M), sprint (S), time trial (CR = "contra reloj") and mountain time trial (CRM).

On an even closer look, you will guess that good values is the lower one (9) for flat roads (LL) and the higher for mountains sprints and time trials. This is because in flat road riders throw two dice and they have an extra throw if they match their number on the team card (and of course, it is more probable to throw 9 than 12 with two dice, though when you get an extra throw after a double sic, you really advance a lot)

The mountain rule is quite strange. You still throw two dice, but you only advance the value of the blue one. The red dice is just added to the blue to see if you match the number on the card and you have an extra throw.

Similar rules apply to sprint and time trial. Just roll and move. No decisions to be taken. The only strategic issue in the game is the demarrage card. One is given to each player, to be used only once during the race, and giving you an extra throw for one rider.
The game is intended to run a full season, so we have special maillots (yellow, green and rainbow jerseis) medals and a trophy, and rules to decide how many points is worth a given race.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Numenko
description:
The Numenko board game resembles Scrabble in that players have wooden tiles and lay valid combinations of tiles in horizontal and vertical rows, sometimes reusing tiles on the board in their current plays.

What differs is that the tiles in Numenko feature digits (0-9), a Multichoice symbol (that stands for the player's choice of addition, subtraction, multiplication, division or "is equal to"), and a Freechoice symbol (that can be a digit or Multichoice).

Each player starts with eight tiles on his rack. On a turn, a player plays one or more tiles to the game board (possibly using tiles already in play) to create a valid equation, with the operators being resolved left to right or top to bottom, except for division which always takes place first. A Multichoice or Freesymbol tile can be used as a new operator or number if a player adds tiles to an existing equation. If a player places tiles adjacent to tiles already on the board, he does not have to create a valid equation (unlike Scrabble in which each multiletter combination must be a valid word). The sum or product of a player's equation is that player's score for the round; if any part of the equation's answer covers a "D" on the game board, that player's score for the round is doubled. The player then refills his hand to eight tiles.

Instead of playing tiles, a player can swap any number of tiles from his hand for new tiles or simply pass.

When one player has no tiles and the bag is empty – or when all players pass in succession – the game ends, and the player with the highest score wins.

name: The Walls of Jericho
description:
A religious education board game based on Joshua 6.

Object: Move all three of your pieces into Jericho before the other players.

Gameplay: Roll the die to start your turn. If the space has an instruction, follow it. If the space has a trumpet, you can take a shortcut path on your next turn.

If you land on an "Ask & Learn" space, the player to the left takes and reads the top card off the "Ask & Learn" deck. If the card is an "Ask" card, the question on the card is asked. If the player gets it right, they take another turn. If the card is a "Learn" card, the turn ends. If the card is a "Surprise" card, you must follow the instruction given.

You must land in Jericho by exact count. Once your first piece reaches Jericho, your second piece begins from start. The second piece must also reach Jericho before the third piece begins.

name: 1x1 Memory
description:
Arithmetic game for 2-10 children from 8 years upward. With 1x1 Memory, elementary multiplication can be practiced in play. The game may take a simpler or more demanding form depending on whether the cards are played face-up or face-down, or whether all the cards or only part of them are used.

The tasks and answer cards are used to calculate across the multiplication table. Players must match pairs where one tile of the pair has the multiplication equation and the second tile the result. Since several task cards can often fit one solution, there are many possible combinations. Whoever has the most pairs at the end of the game is the winner.

Contents:
120 cards (60 tasks - 60 solutions)
One strip with letters A-K
One strip with numbers 1-10
How to play instructions
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Memory, Number

name: Canaan
description:
Card Game where you are one of the 12 tribe of Israel. You must try to the most powerful of those. Player draw cards every turns and try to build temples, increase their population and get the most wealth. Try to escape bad prophet and find the Ark of the Covenant.

The player must use the cards he draw each turn the most wisely possible to accumulate points to win the game when Nebuchadnezzar destroy Israel. At the end of the game the player get points for is family cards, for having the biggest army, for having the biggest territory, for having build the temple and much more way to get points.

name: Degenfechten
description:
Each player holds three cards which have different fencing moves on them. The basic version of the game is a simple rock-paper-scissors game. In the actual game, there is one card with which in case of a tie, both players score a point. Therefore, the player who is in the lead can use this card to his/her advantage, but has to double-guess whether the other player uses the counter-card for this.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
publishers: Österreichisches Spiele Museum e.V., WIN: Das Spielejournal

name: Kings of Combat
description:
For over half a century the arena has been the site where disputes have been settled, games have been won and wars have been waged. Built for one purpose only - Gladiator Combat.

Every year the Kings of Combat Tournament is held here. Warriors from far and wide come to compete. For it is the Ultimate Test of strength and courage. Winning proves once and for all that your clan is the fiercest and most respected throughout the land. One warrior from each clan is chosen to compete. Prove yourself worthy and let it be known that you are the King of Combat.

KINGS OF COMBAT is a 2-4 Player Gladiator Combat Game that combines SKILL through gameplay strategies and LUCK through the roll of the dice. The object of the game is to down your opponents in battle, acquire all 4 of the Clan Tokens and Win the Crown!
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Abejas
description:
BEES

In BEES players try to collect nectar and pollen from flowers and bring it to their colonies to create the most prosperous.

The purpose of BEES is to get as many points in a certain number of rounds corresponding to the number of players. You must place the bees on the flowers to modify its initial value and gain control and collect points. Points are obtained only from flowers whose value corresponds with the hidden objective of the player. After finishing all rounds, the player who accumulates the most points wins.

The game components are:
8 flowers (2 red, 2 green, 2 blue and 2 orange) with values ​​printed on them (5, 4, 3 and 2)
16 Bees (4 red, 4 green, 4 blue and 4 orange)



=====ABEJAS

En ABEJAS los jugadores tratan de recolectar el néctar y el polen de las flores y llevarlo a sus respectivas colonias para crear la más próspera.

El objetivo de ABEJAS es obtener el mayor número de puntos en un número de rondas determinado, correspondiente al número de jugadores. Debes colocar las abejas sobre las flores para modificar su valor inicial y lograr controlarlas y acumular puntos. Solo se obtienen puntos de las flores cuyo valor corresponde con el del objetivo oculto del jugador. Tras finalizar todas las rondas, el jugador que haya acumulado más puntos es el ganador.

Los componentes del juego son:
8 flores (2 rojas, 2 verdes, 2 azules y 2 naranjas) con valores impresos sobre ellas (5, 4, 3 y 2)
16 abejas (4 rojas, 4 verdes, 4 azules y 4 naranjas)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Corner Chess
description: Corner Chess is a variant of chess for 2 or 4 players, on an 8x8 board with pieces of increased power (increased mobility for pawns and knight move for minor pieces), with piece starting in the corner. In the base game a player wins game by capturing any enemy king. In an advanced variant, players can win by getting their king across the board.

name: Cataclysm
description:
Cataclysm is a large board chess variant (12 X 16)

It uses most of the basic chess pieces from FIDE chess, plus a range of additional, mostly short range pieces.

New pieces include;

Grand Rook: The Grand Rook can move as either a standard Rook, or as a Cannon from Chinese Chess (that is, it can capture an enemy piece by leaping over exactly one piece of either color and capturing the first piece beyond, if that piece is an enemy piece.)

Sorceress: The Sorceress is a 2-space area-mover. She may make either a single step in any direction as a King, or may make two consecutive steps in any direction and may change directions in between. The only limitations are that the Sorceress may not return to her original square (thereby making a null-move) and may not capture a piece on the first move and continue on - her move ends with any capture.

The Elephant may slide up to four spaces diagonally, or may step a single space horizontally or vertically. This piece has no relation to the Elephant of Shatranj.

The Tiger may slide up to four spaces horizontally or vertically, or may step a single space diagonally.

The Duke may slide up to three spaces in any direction. He moves like a Queen in Chess, except that he is limited to a range of only three squares

and others

Each player has 40 pieces (including 16 pawns)

name: Le Coucou picard
description:
The goal is to get an egg in the nest opposite the central square of the first line in the 9x12 grid game board.
Players move his eggs.

The movement of the eggs is determined by the line where they are at the time to move.
At start egg may move one square straight, Once an egg is above the fifth line, its possibilities are largely increased. It can move straight or diagonally one square. It can also move faster to a number of spaces determined by the number of eggs on his line.

name: Move
description:
There is a 8 balls for each player, 9 white balls and one black ball in 5x5 grid game board (26 balls)

In his turn player pushes a row with the 26th ball, placing a ball in front of this row leaving a ball from the end of the same row to be the 26th ball.

The goal is to achieve an alignment of five balls of their color or 4 balls of their color and the black ball, which acts as a wildball.

name: Les Aventuriers du Rail: à Lyon (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
The board for this Edition is based on a map of Lyon.
As with other Ticket to Ride games, players are collecting sets of cards to claim routes necessary to complete destination tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Vengeance Crusaders vs. The Monads
description:
This is a tactical space combat game in the Warriors of the Dark Star: The Age of the Neutron Wars series, and includes the second edition rulebook for that game (as a series rulebook).

From a GFG catalog (reproduced verbatim):


This pits the Fast Omega Ship "Formidable" Class, their Deadly Alpha Battleship "Victorious" Class, and their Fast Beta Battle Cruiser "Vengeance" Class, against the "Odin" and "Thor" Class Dreadnaught with its Monadian Web and the Thor Battleships' Death Ray and Satellite Defensive systems. This game consists of a reliving of the Famous Battles with the Great Admirals, Star Marshals, and Battleship Conmanders in various Historical Engagements that occurred during the Monad Wars - the Exploits of the Black Prince, the Xenon Battle Cruiser "ACE" that had 20 "kills" to his Credit, etc. Includes the Famous Scenario "The Charge Against the Monad Star Base", and the "Battle of Masters". This Game is the Companion Game to the BFA game "Star Wars of the Xenon Empire". Vengeance Crusaders is the opposite of Sun Slayers: it is the active seeking of enemy vessels and smashing them in individual encounters and small fleet engagements. In the first game the knowledge of weapons systems is vital; in this one Maneuver is paramount - weapons only second!

name: Critical Hit! - Volume 6, No. 3
description:
Volume 6, No. 3 of Critical Hit's ASL magazine, featuring articles and scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader.

The following articles are included:
- War Museums of Israel
- Genesis 48 Designer's Notes
- A Military Overview of Israel's War of Independence
- The AFVs Time Forgot (Arab and Israeli AFVs)
- The Scenarios of Genesis 48

The following ASL scenarios are included:
GENESIS#16: PALESTINIAN PROKHOROVKA; 16 July 1948; outside Nazareth
GENESIS#17: BEN-JABO!; 29 May 1948; Ashod
GENESIS#18: THE ARCHERS OF UM SHEHAM; 31 October 1956; Um Sheham, Sinai
GENESIS#19: OPERATION KISLEV; 30 November 1950; The Arava
CH138: THE SAUSAGE WAR; 11 December 1939; Tolvajarvi Village, Finland
CH139: BETRAYED BY GENERAL WINTER; 28 February 1940; Tuupura Island, Finland
CH140: SISU AT SUMMA; 19 December 1939; Summa, Finland
CH141: ANOTHER ALAMO; 23 December 1941; Wilkes Island, Wake Atoll
CH142: LONGSTOP HILL; 24 December 1942; Longstop Hill, Tunisia
CH143: THE GUNSLINGERS; 14 December 1944; Climbach, France
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Faxen machen: Impazziamo un pò!
description:
Games for children in bilingual version (German and Italian).

Player should use the rondel, then draw a card and do what is required on the card, for example jump three times, miagolate, etc.). Then other players evaluate the "performance" and assign a variabile amount of victory points to player.

name: L'isola delle stoffe
description:
L'isola delle stoffe (nickname: Il gioco di Prato) is an old financial games developed in order to promote textile industry in Prato (Tuscany, Italy).

Players should acquire raw materials, factories, woolworkers etc., then produce textiles and sell them. They also take loans from the bank. It's played with card with combinations similar to Poker.

name: Cipero Tramroad
description:
A fourth railway company for 1876: Trinidad, published in Rail Gamer Magazine #7.

The kit consists of rules, a company charter and shares for the Cipero Tramroad, as well as four trains and two new tiles. It is only usable with the 1876-30 Variant of the base game.

Intro from the rules sheet:

"Peter Jacobi's 1876 (produced by Chris Lawson, 1996) is an excellent short game for three players. It moves fast while retaining the excitement of the longer 18xx variants. However, with four players, one person is left without a railroad to operate. The following rules describe how to add a fourth corporation to 1876-30 while, at the same time, completely destroying the beauty and symmetry of the original game."
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Kampf um Rom Ergänzungsregeln und historisches Glossar
description:
This expansion comes as a 60 page booklet containing:

- Errata for the 1st edition rules of the base game
- Expansion rules for the "Germanica" scenario to add a 5th player
- Expansion rules for the "Germanica" scenario to add a 6th player
- Additional rules for the "Germanica" scenario
- Additional rules for the "Hunnen, Römer und Germanen" scenario for 2 players
- A historical glossary
- 30 green wooden tokens and 30 labels to add a 5th player
- 30 brown wooden tokens and 30 labels to add a 6th player
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Wargame

name: Berludo
description: A patriotic game. Board looks like a Ludo board game but it is modified to represent the four Allied countries in the First World War. Players are either England, France, Belgium or Russia. The traditional Home space is renamed Berlin so it is a race for each country to get to Berlin first.

name: Die Panzerknacker
description:
In Die Panzerknacker (The Safe Crackers), the players attempt to get loot from safes by breaking the secret codes.

The game is played with 18 loot cards, 18 secret code cards, and four dice. At the beginning of the game, all the cards are placed face-up on the table, then the dice are rolled. Three of the dice (colored blue, red and yellow) show different numbers ranging from 1 to 18. The fourth die shows three "up" arows and three "down" arrows. If the "up" arrow is rolled, the players should consult the code card that matches the highest die rolled; otherwise they should consult the card that matches the lowest die rolled.

The code card shows a puzzle that uses the remaining two dice, specifically a table that involves some calculation with the numbers to find the right loot. After a player has determined the correct loot, he takes the corresponding card from the table. If he has picked the right card, he gets to place the card in front of himself. The first player to collect five cards wins.

name: Jack Hobbs Table Cricket
description:
An action cricket game.

One player is the batsman, the other the bowler. The two, rather scary, figures have handles so that their arm can be pulled back and then released forward. The bowler's arm will launch a ball at the batsman. He, in reply, will try to swing his bat and connect with the ball.
The player who scores the most runs (i.e. hits) will win.

Sir John Berry "Jack" Hobbs (1882 - 1963) is widely regarded as one of the best opening batsmen of all time

name: Jogo Rápido
description: Players roll a colored die and pick a card of the appropriate color. Then they have to build whatever is shown on the card, as fast as possible. The first to finish gets to pick first one VP chip - but there is some luck involved in getting the better chips.

name: Obama / Nobama
description: A trick-taking game centered around US politics. Each card represents a controversial and/or humorous issue being discussed on 24-hour news stations, and tricks represent gathering the most viewers (via making the most controversial statements) at different time slots. Instead of conventional bidding, players select their true party (hidden) and their apparent party (visible). Each party offers different scoring incentives and different special powers, and players sometimes have the option to switch parties.
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Cambridge Games Factory

name: International Road Racing 1987 Up-Dates
description:
An expansion for International Road Racing that uses statistical data to recreate individual races or the whole championship of the Grand Prix motor cycle 1987 season.

The game also includes optional rules for positioning individual racers within a group.

name: International Road Racing 1988 Up-Dates
description: An expansion for International Road Racing that uses statistical data to recreate individual races or the whole championship of the Grand Prix motor cycle 1988 season.

name: Ice Racing
description:
Ice Racing is an expansion set that lets you recreate the Ice Speedway world championship finals from the years 1983 to 1991.

The expansion consists of a data sheet for each year and a new set of trouble and injury charts representing the different hazards for ice speedway.

name: 25 New Games to be Played with Lexicon Cards
description:
A book of variants for the game Lexicon, published by Waddingtons in 1935 or so. They had had great success with selling the original game, so they decided the market would like more variety. In effect, in modern terms, this book is an expansion as it adds lots of new rules that will need different strategy.

The 64-page booklet sold separately (red cover for one shilling) and advertised 25 variants. The pale blue/green version was included for free in first edition blue books sold in 1935, but has rules for only 23 variant games with the Lexicon deck: Bridge; Whist; Scramble; Dominoes; Cribbage; Poker; Stud Poker; Eights; Clock Patience; Brighton Patience; Dictionary; Riddance; Donkey; Criss Cross; Twister; One Better; Jumble; Tap and Grab; Mine; Don't Forget; Demon; Pay Up; and Teasers. (The red cover edition also includes Lexicon Newmarket and Lexicon Duplexicon.)
mechanics: Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Spelling, Stat Check Resolution, Trick-taking

name: Trench
description:
Each player starts with a shuffled stack of all cards from one suit (or two for a longer game). Players deal cards face-down into their own rows of front and back "trenches". A player may peek at his own cards anytime.

A turn consists of one of three actions:

Reveal a card in the opponent's trenches.
Swap positions of two neighboring allied cards.
Attack: Flip two directly opposing cards. Discard the weaker card, and return the stronger card to the owning player. Each player slides a card from their back trench into the spot emptied by the attack and lays a replacement card in the back trench.


A player left with only three cards loses.

name: Mountaineering
description: Simple roll and move game. The board depicts a mountain with the track running to the top. On the track are short-cuts and it will get more competitive because the track thins as it gets higher.It is a race to the summit. There are several pathways at the start of the game and quite a few obstacles to prevent the player from getting ahead.

name: Devil's Dice
description:
Functionally a variant on Liar's Dice. All players roll dice and begin a bidding round where players are trying to bid or bluff how many of a particular die face show under all players' cups. A player may call a true bid (previous bid is exactly right), false bid (previous bid overstates the number present), or up the ante (new, higher bid than the previous bid). Each player has one Devil's Die that can be altered by that player by one pip up or down when called out on a bid.

Box contents:
25 dice (20 red & 5 white)
5 dice cups
Rule sheet

Publisher Blurb:

A quick and easy to learn dice game, Devil's Dice is fun for all ages. Players must attempt to deceive and bluff their rolls while guessing the intentions of their opponents. However, each player must also contend with the Devil's Dice, which may win a round for them - or condemn them to certain loss!

name: Quinta
description:
From website

Start: 12 stones of their own color for each player, arranged in pairs around the board.

Play: Players take turns moving one of their stones any distance along an unobstructed line, in any direction, to an unoccupied node. Through the 3 pentagons movement may follow either fork.

Goal: To be the first player to link up 5 adjacent stones on the same line. Here are some sample winning positions:

name: Spartan Skaki
description:
The game can is played on a 9x9 Go board with 18 pieces to each side, one unique piece among the 18.

From Zillions of Games:

Forces are arrayed on the second and third rank with the marked stone at the center of the third. The unmarked stones are know as Hoplites and the marked stone is the Enomotarch.

All stones move the same:

Step one to two vacant points forward orthogonal,
- or -
Push an opposing stone located adjacent right or left orthogonal to the next right or left vacant orthogonal point,
- or -
Leap over any number of adjacent friendly stones forward, right or left orthogonal to a vacant point.
- or -
Capture an opposing stone on an adjacent forward diagonal point.

The game is won by capturing the opposing Enomotarch, or moving the friendly Enomotarch to any rank beyond the opposing forces.

name: ¡Luchas de Apuestas!
description:
User Summary:
¡Luchas de Apuestas! is a free 6 page supplement/expansion for ¡Uncle Cucuy's Lucha Libre!. This expansion adds variations in wagering, tag team matches, tournament rules, illegal holds, disqualifications, and weight classes. A list of names of famous Luchadores is included to help inspire you.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Round and Round
description:
Contents:
1 jigged playing board, 20 cards, 4 3-D buses, 1 dice,
1 instruction leaflet
Object is to collect cards based on the ‘Wheels on the Bus’ song. There are 5 cards to collect and place into the slots in your bus. Each card has a coloured top corresponding to the slots, and illustrates a part of the song.
In a turn, the player throws the die and moves round the board. If he lands on a bus stop, he takes the card 'waiting' there. The player puts the card in the corresponding coloured slot in the top of their bus, then everyone should sing and make the actions for the illustration shown on the card. So if the player has collected a windscreen wipers card, everybody sings and makes the actions for ‘the wipers on the bus go swish swish swish’ etc. No two cards of the same type can be collected. When you have five cards, you make your way to the bus station to win the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Singing

name: Ten Green Bottles
description:
Contents:
4 jigged wall boards, 40 green bottle cards (4 sets of numbers, 1 to 10), 40 spotty number cards (4 sets of numbers, 1 to 10), 1 3D bottle bank
The object is to be the first to recycle all your ten green bottles.
Setting up
The youngest player starts by choosing one of the face down spotty cards from the table and counts the spots. If the number of spots on this card match the number shown on one of the bottle cards on the player’s wall, both of these cards are posted into the bottle bank. If not, it is the next player's turn. When a player has only one bottle left on their wall and he turns over a spotty card matching the number on that bottle, he is the winner and sings "There are NO green bottles standing on the wall" as he posts the last two cards.

name: Pieces of Eight: Steal the Booty! Drink the Rum!
description:
The life of a Pirate Captain is a hard one. You have been sailing the seas since you were but a boy and the time has come to retire! Alas, you need money to retire… and that means it’s time to plunder, raid, drink, and sail!

Players bring on crewmembers to help in raids along the coast to help build the captain’s treasure! Each player builds their crew by hiring some of the foulest, dirtiest, and roughest scallywags they can find to take what’s theirs! From raids on ships, forts, towns, and each other’s vessels, this game is jam-packed with pirate excitement!

Will you be the one to take the gold and win the game? Will you sink to the bottom of the briny deep and spend eternity in Davy Jones’ Locker? Only the dice can tell in this game of strategy and chance!

Choose from one of ten famous Pirates. Each comes with their own special bonuses or traits that can help you to your goal! Each player’s experience will be different!

name: Kill Bargle
description:
Subtitle:A dice game of bloody vengeance!

from the introduction:
For those who’ve come in late...

Aleena and Bargle were introduced in the 1983 edition of the original, classic DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Game. Presented in a bright red box, this set was many millions of players’ first introduction to D&D.

In the Player’s Book was a short ‘pick-a-path’ style adventure designed to teach you the basics of the game. Taking on the role of a brave warrior you set off to explore a dark and dangerous dungeon. But it was not long before you found yourself in trouble and were wounded after a brief battle with a nasty goblin.

Just when things were looking grim you met Aleena! The beautiful and kindly cleric (wonderfully illustrated by legendary artist, Larry Elmore) gladly used her powers to heal your injuries. With Aleena now by your side you continued deeper into the dungeon, only to encounter the infamous magic-user, Bargle!

The rest, as they say, is history...

User summary:
Kill Bargle is a dice game offering 2-5 players the opportunity to exact their revenge upon Bargle. The only requirements are the free rules, some players, 6 rusty nails and a set of polyhedral dice. This game was web-published as a 2 page PDF and was subsequently published in the Finnish role playing magazine Roolipelaaja.

name: "Ring 'em!"
description: A hoop-la type game. Throw the rings and score for the target you successfully 'ring'. The artist is the great Lawson Wood, the only example of his work in the games area. The monkey target on the left is his speciality and is a character called Gran'pop.

name: Pocket Quiz: Archäologie
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Archeology" and the questions center around that topic.

name: Pocket Quiz: Berlin
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice answers. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

All questions are about the German city Berlin.

name: Pocket Quiz: Computer
description: This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

description:

The title translates to "Germany" and the questions are about that country.

description:

The title translates to "Design Classics" and the questions center around milestones in designs, like famous furniture, cars, buildings and so on.

name: Pocket Quiz: Fußball
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The questions are all about Soccer.

description:

The title translates to "Foreign Words" and the questions ask for the meaning of certain foreign words.

description:

The questions are all about the German city of Hamburg.

description:

All questions are about jazz music.

description:

description:

The questions are all about the German city of Munich.

All questions are about Olympic Games.

description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Baltic Sea" and the questions are all about that topic.

description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The questions are all about the German area Ruhr.

name: Pocket Quiz: Schweiz
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Switzerland" and the questions are all about that country.

name: Pocket Quiz: Zitate
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Quotes" and the questions are all about famous quotes.

name: Marienkäfer und so
description:
In Marienkäfer und so, ladybugs and other insects are crawling all over the cards. Try to find them based on their silhouetted profiles before the other players do – but that's not easy as the insect marked through on your search card must not be anywhere on the insect card!

The 63 insect cards feature three colored insects (all different) on one side of the card and three silhouetted insects on the reverse side, with one of those insects having a large X through it. Shuffle the deck with the black-and-white images face up, then deal one card to each player; this card is a player's search card.

On a turn, the player who last claimed a card (chosen randomly in the first round) flips over the top card of the deck. Each player races to slap this card – but only if the newly revealed card depicts at least one of the two non-Xed insects on that player's search card and that player's Xed insect is not on the newly revealed card. If the first player to slap the card has done so correctly, he claims the card, placing it black-and-white side up on his stack to become his new search card; if the first player has slapped the card incorrectly (as his Xed insect is on the card or neither of his other two search targets are present), that player must remove the bottom card of his search stack from the game. The slapped card is also removed from play. (A player can't lose his only search card. If no one slaps the card, remove it from play, then reveal the next card.)

Play continues until the final insect card has been slapped. Whoever has the most cards in his search deck wins.

For children as young as age three, Marienkäfer und so can be played with players taking turns consecutively instead of playing simultaneously. If a player can claim a card, he does so, making it his new search card; otherwise he removes it from play.

A second game is included in Marienkäfer und so. Shuffle the insect cards black-and-white side face up, then deal seven cards to each player. All players simultaneously flip their top card color-side up onto the table, then race to slap an insect card in front of another player that matches the search criteria on the newly revealed top card of their personal deck. Each card can be claimed by only one player, i.e., whoever slaps it first. If a player slaps a card correctly, he places it on the bottom of his deck black-and-white side face up; if a player slaps a card incorrectly, his current search card is removed from play. All unslapped cards are also removed from play. The game ends when one or more players have only a single card in their deck; the player(s) with the most cards in their deck(s) wins.

name: Mediterranean Cruise
description:
Race game with some novel twists.
The track on the board takes you on a journey to England. 18 picture cards are shuffled and placed face down on numbered circles at the top of the board. On your journey, should you land on the same numbered square as one of the circles above, you take the face-down picture card. This card is a souvenir of your trip and will score the points indicated. Only the first player to arrive at a square that is linked to a circle above, can take the picture card.
The first player to reach England gains 10 points. Now everyone counts up the points on their souvenir cards and the player with the most points, wins.
One unusual rule. If you arrive home with the Slave-Girl (souvenir?!) cannot arrive in England with such a find. It must be returned to the board and he can choose any other souvenir card that is still unowned. England would appear to be the only country in Europe that bans slaves! By the way, if you want a Slave-Girl of your own, the place to go is Istanbul (square 65).

name: Midget Golf For The Table
description:
Super-sized tabletop golf game.
Play real golf shots with your miniature metal golf clubs. The greens are represented by green card with holes in the centre. The ball must go constantly onto the floor I would think (out of bounds?).
The box says:
An exact counterpart, in miniature, of the popular outdoor pastimeComplete with Golf Clubs, Balls, Putting Greens, Bunkers and full instructions. This game of skill entrances the Golf enthusiast as well as the learner.A really scientific Game of Golf can be played indoors with the appliances without any risk of injury to furniture.

I love that last line of the box text.

name: Alles, alles über Deutschland
description: Time travel through 2000 years of history, always with the focus on "what would I have done here and there?". The cards are shuffled and stacked according to back sides, players travel through the epochs, separated by turn of epoch squares and action cards, the winner is the team reaching the finish first. For correctly answered questions one rolls the die and moves, in the next round the question for the square reached needs to be solved. The special squares have special rules.

name: Day of the Scourge
description:
The Scourge are coming! Lead your rag-tag band of surviors against the an alien race that would see all humans extinct! Featuring a Mini-Campaign system and 3 different scenarios! Will you be humanities last hope?

The Day of the Scourge box set contains all the figures you need to play a Scourge invasion! Each box contains 21 Scourge, 6 Scourge Heavy Weapons, 6 Post Apoc Survivors and a PDF of the Day of the Scourge Campaign!

DoS is a supplement/scenario for the Two Hour Wargames 5150: New Beginings core game system. You must have the Chain Reaction 3.0 core rulebook to play this scenario (or 5150 Star Army). You can download Chain Reaction 3.0 for Free at Chain Reaction 3.0

The miniatures are made of lead-free pewter.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Army Lists for the Revolution in Warfare: Volume 1 1550-1660AD
description: Army Lists suitable for use with rules in the Warfare through the Ages series and adaptable for Wargames Research Group Renaissance, Tercio and Newbury Fast Play Rules. The lists cover every major battle and nation for the period, from English Civil War through Rennaisance Europe, to Japan, North America and Africa. Each army list is accompanied by a descriptive paragraph explaining which troop combinations are allowed and what the army's historical basis is.
categories: Book, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: WWII Army Organisations and Equipment
description: A comprehensive set of WWII army lists for British, German, American, Italian, Russian, Japanese, French, Hungarian and Czechoslovakian forces. Each nations entry is preceded by a brief overview of that nation's forces, followed by a set of diagrams showing how the various organisations employed by that nation were organized. This is then followed by a number of suggested armies for tabletop battles. All the information contained within the book is set out for use with three rule sets in mind: Combined Arms, Cambrai to Sinai and Wargames research Group.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: Sword of Neurasthenia
description: Sword of Neurasthenia, named from the Japanese phrase "Shinnkei-suijyaku", is a game which tests your memory. The players are studying martial arts, and they practice lessons by turning over cards and taking those actions. Players collect and use these cards to get points and compete against one another. By successfully collecting the cards, they achieve different degrees and even kill monsters with their martial arts. Fail to remember your moves, and you might suffer accidents.

name: Contention
description:
Contention is an abstract strategy game for two centering around the theme of containment and usurpation. The players work in tandem to encircle a rapidly growing mass, while at the same time planning their moves to force their opponent into a bad position.

Players take turns placing one of their color stones in any empty space on the board, followed by placing one of the black colored stones in any empty space directly adjacent to another black stone. The first player who is unable to place a black stone is the winner, regardless of whether or not they are able to place one of their color stones.

Great fun, quick playtime (10-15 minutes at the absolute maximum, usually around 3-5 minutes), and challenging, subtle strategies.

Contention is available for free, as a complete print-and-play package including rules, pieces, and board in a single PDF.

name: Harem: An Exotic Card Game
description: Harem is an easy-to-learn card game where you attempt to create the most envied harem in the lands. Players take the role of a Sultan and play gold and gems to eventually buy harem concubines. But watch out for opponents who hire thieves to threaten your treasury. Once in the harem, concubines train in the arts of dancing and seduction and adorn themselves with jewels. The player with the best harem in the end is the winner!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: Am Korallen-Riff
description: On the board in four parts schools of fish and corals can be found in varying numbers and colours. Colour die, dot die und symbol die together result in a combination of three characteristics which players should find on the board. The board is variable and thus always new situations form. A player discovering the combination wanted shows it and marks it with a chip. If a combination has already been covered, the chip goes to the treasure chest. If an octopus is rolled, all chips from the board are put on the chest. If the chest is rolled the chips from the chest are distributed among the other players. The player placing his last chip wins the game.

name: Das Winterspiel
description: The village pond has frozen over and many people enjoy a lovely winter’s day, and so do the players. They slide across the ice and collect tiles for hot chocolate or gingerbread. If you have found three identical tiles you swap them at the corresponding booth for a golden victory point tile. In your turn you roll two dice and move in two different direction, but not to and fro, for each direction you use the result of one die. If you reach a tile and do not want to take it you turn it up, open tiles are covered again. If you take a tile you replace it with one from the bag, and your turn ends. Action tiles you pick up you can use in your next turn. When two booths are empty, you win with the highest score from your victory point tiles.

name: Noah's Ark game Two by Two
description:
Noah's Ark game Two by Two. It's up to you to save the animals! There's no age limit on fun with this family game that tells the story of Noah's faith and reinforces his long-ago mission to do God's will. First you must gather the animals into the ark! Then you must journey through the treacherous waters and land safely on Mt. Ararat! The journney is filled with perils- and rewards, too! Beware of the lightening bolt! Be thankful for a Rainbow! The game casts each player in the roles of Noah and his family. Play the PRECIOUS MOMENTS Noah's Ark game with family and friends.

Each player take an ark card and a characture playing piece. As players travel the game they will recreate the story of Noah and the Ark and collect animals as they go. Spin the spinner and move clockwise around the outer path of the game board. As a plyer lands of a colored space, the player may collect the animal associated with that color and place it on their ark card. A player landing on a sun space can collect any animal. Play continues until a player collects all 8 animals (2 of each kind), and immediately move back to start.

If during the game a player lands on a lightening bolt he must move 3 spaces back. Any player reaching start withou all 8 animals, must go around the outside of the board and continue until all 8 animals are collected.

Once a player has all of the animals and has moved back to start, he will spin and move along the inner trail. This path follows Noah's trip across the raging water. It is filled with perils just like Noah's journey. When the player reaches Mt. Ararat, he continues in turn to spin the spinner and unload his ark based on the number spun. When all of a player's animals are unloaded, the player contiunes to spin in turn and help others unload their animals.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Storytelling

name: Jahrtausendquiz
description: This quiz game is played in two rounds. In the first round the theme cards are used, the theme cards show names of historical persons or titels of wellknown works of arts or literature. The players must name the right time for either life of the person or the time when the work was generated. If the time is named correctly, the player may take a token from the board. In the second round event- and person-cards are used. Now a series of events must be ordered chronologically, or the players must name a year within the lifespan of a certain person. The game ends when all tokens are taken off the board.

name: #OccupyBoardwalk
description:
In #OccupyBoardwalk, players take the role of the 1% trying to retain control of the board against increasing demonstrations against their rule. The goal is to be the player with the most money at the end of the game, assuming the 99% don’t successfully occupy too much of your precious property! If that happens, everyone loses.


OccupyBoardwalk is an Uncooperative Game for 3 or More Players. It just requires a copy of Monopoly and a book. (It can be any book, but we suggest Das Capital, Road to Serfdom or a pocket copy of the Constitution).


Each round, the public expects the 1% to pay another 1000 dollars of your fortunes towards the public good. To do this, the player with the Top Hat opens the book to a page an puts any amount of money into the book secretly. They then flip to another page and pass the book to the next player. When a player gets the book, they can’t flip backwards in the book to see what other players have payed. Once each player has had an opportunity to put money into the book, the first player turns the book over and shakes it over the board. Collect the money that falls out, count it and put it under public parking.

Remember two things: The player with the most money left at the end of the game wins. Also, the public expects the 1% to pay another $1000 every turn. So the expectations of the public about the amount of money in public parking increases every turn. There are a few other twists and turns involving the removal of protestors from properties, and the use of Chance and Community Chest cards to get bailed out when things get rough. The full rules are available in the attachments or at the link provided in the link section
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game

name: Lurch! The Zombie Chess Game
description:
Lurch is a basic beer and pretzels game based on board games like chess. It uses a standard eight by eight square board and just about any miniature figures, pawns or markers, to denote the individual units. The Basic game is simple, and there are Advanced rules to increase the complexity for seasoned players. There are also over two dozen additional scenarios to add replayability and fun to the game. An additional section explains ways to use the game within your roleplaying game as well. This game is complete and includes Basic Game Rules, Advanced Game Rules, over two dozen Alphabetized Scenarios, dozens of paper miniatures and markers. The game is offered as a downloadable PDF file.
As first glance Lurch! is a fairly simple game – ironically more so than mainstream chess – as all of the zombies (playing pieces) are identical, and each piece can only undertake one of four possible moves (though you can move up to three pieces per turn). There is a way to make your basic zombie into a clever zombie, which is the equivalent of getting a pawn turned into a queen, but that’s about it…except there's more.

If the above sounds simple, then rest assured that it is, but that’s also just the foundation of the game. The beauty of Lurch! is that it’s highly customizable, so much so that the book not only presents three different advanced rules, but also twenty-six “scenarios” each of which are also variant ways to play.

name: Premonition The Dice Game
description:
Description from Wargamedownloads.com


Premonition The Dice Game

You snap out of a trance in a cold sweat, having had a disturbing premonition of a stranger meeting a grisly death at a familiar location. You continue on your way as you travel around town unaware that someone in town has had a similar premonition of you meeting your own sticky end. As you come to realize that the Grim Reaper is hot on your trail, you are gripped by fear and start to worry that maybe you are losing your mind. You will need to have hope and keep your wits about you if you are to survive the night and escape Death’s plan.

Premonition is a thrilling, luck-based, dice game for 2 to 5 players. Below is a brief summary of how the game works;

The player to your left has had a vision of your death and their Premonition card shows where in town it will happen. On your turn you will travel to a new location in town by rolling the Location dice but if you roll the location on their card, you will meet the Grim Reaper. Then you must roll the standard die to score equal to or less than your current Wits points to survive. If you can survive for 12 hours you will have successfully have evaded Death’s clutches.

The game files include the dice faces, rules, cards, and counters needed to play.
You will need to provide 1 x standard 6 sided die, 2 x blank 6 sided dice (we recommend 19mm indented blank dice) and a printable adhesive sheet to print the dice faces on.

name: Focus
description:
Focus is a game that children have fun playing. It is structured to encompass the essential elements of behavior modification and designed to have the greatest positive impact on attention. In behavior modification children receive specific positive reinforcement for accomplishing a task within an appropriate time frame and without being distracted. The rewards are usually in the form of tokens. This game provides two ways for players to win tokens – with or without a distraction.

The game has 3 sets of task cards that describe tasks that the players have to complete in order to earn their tokens. Each task requires concentration and continuing attention and includes:

1. Categories: Players have to list things that belong in a specific category, such as listing five fruits that have one large pit in the middle.

2. Forward and Back: Players have to recite things forward and/or backwards, such as reciting the alphabet forwards and backwards from A to F.

3. Problem Solving: The game comes with various cut out shapes and cut out words. Using shapes, the players have to create a specific design, like a triangle similar to the pattern on the card, using the shapes provided. Using words the players have to create a sentence, like a sentence in which someone throws something to someone else.

A player can elect to perform the task without distraction and win one token or with distraction and win two tokens. The distraction is optional. The distractions are provided by one of the other players, who pick a Distraction card. This card may ask the distracting player to hum “Happy Birthday” or tap fingers on the table while the other player is trying to accomplish the task. Players can earn more tokens when they attempt a task while distracting events are taking place. Distractions are the most common reason people lose focus on the task at hand. This game gives players much needed practice that improves their ability to stay focused on tasks, even with distractions.

There are both competitive and cooperative versions for grades 1-12. There are three decks of Task cards with varied levels of difficulty: easier, regular, and challenge. The key is for the players to be able to complete the task most of the time if they concentrate and are not distracted. Difficulty of the tasks can also be varied by imposing a time limit and permitting the use of paper and pencil for certain tasks.

name: Neutron York 3000
description:
* From Wargamedownloads.com


The place is New York,
the year is unknown,
the future is unwritten...

Hiding in his secret headquarters, the President is calling the survivors of the nuclear holocaust to join him in New York and rebuild the Land of the Free.

In an age when anarchy is rampant and danger lurks everywhere, the competition among the various militias in the President’s service is fierce to install a new millennium of order and civilization.

Many of those gangs will contribute to writing a new American legend and protect their land from the rising Neo Soviet peril others will serve their own ambition and risk the President's disfavor and possible banishment. A sentence that means a very likely death at the hands of the mobs of brutal outcasts, filthy mutants or alien slavers awaiting them beyond the boundaries of the city in the lethal Rad Wastes.

Grab a weapon and gather your gang – as whether you choose your destiny or allow it to be imposed upon you, it is a belief well worth fighting for!

Neutron York 3000 is a post-apoc skirmish game brought to you by the Golgo Island Studios and supported by a range of 28mm miniatures by East Riding Miniatures. It features:

• Alternate activation. Move one figure, then your opponent does the same.
• Simple no-chart, no-math combat mechanics. Just roll some D6s and
immediately read the result.
• A campaign and experience system. Take your gangers from Rookie to
Legend status, and fit them with the best weapons available.
• Scenario-building tools. Use them to make your own scenarios, or use
the ready-made samples provided.
• A point system that comes with a complete Character/Force builder.
Join one of the 8 factions described or design your own, be it for a
campaign or one-off games.
• Plenty of extra rules. To further enrich your NY3K games, rules for
vehicles, non-player characters and mass battles are included.

name: Foodle
description:
Foodle-Do!

Test your nutrition IQ with our fun new game Foodle! Learn important facts about the foods we eat to help you make better eating choices and see if your food knowledge of portion sizes, vitamins, fats and carbohydrates measures up! And don't forget the exercise when you land on a Foodle-Do space!

Players roll the die at the beginning of each turn to determine how many spaces are "at stake" for the current question. Whatever number is rolled is how many spaces that player's Pawn will move (forward or backward).

After the die is thrown, the player to the right draws a Foodle Trivia Card from the box and reads it aloud. Foodle questions are True/False or Multiple Choice, so you may get lucky with a guess, even if you don't know the correct answer!

A few of the spaces on the board are marked "Foodle-Do!" If a player ends their turn on one of these spaces they immediately must perform the activity on their current Foodle-Do card. When moving backward after missing a question, always stop on a Foodle-Do space. Also treat the START space as a Foodle-Do space.

Each time a player moves ahead into a new color, they should discard their current Foodle-Do card and draw a new one.

The first player to advance to the "Finish" space is the winner.

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Portion Sizes, Nutritional Facts, Making Healthy Choices

name: Azuleo
description:
Objective: Try to form as many valuable colour combinations as possible
Azuleo has its origin from the Portuguese word „azulejo“ for „tile“.
Starting the game a player draws/places two tiles (crosses) which determine the colour-combinations you can score. During your turn you should place a tile out of your personal supply (max. 2) which fits into. The allowed combination shows a square consisting of max. two colours.
You may change the colour tiles for other combinations, too and you can also score points for placing blockade crosses where no colour cross can fit.

name: Top 40 Ken je klassiekers
description:
Trivia game about classic popsongs in the Dutch top 40. It's a music trivia game.

Each player fills the answers of the classic popsongs onto the sheets. The player with the highest score, wins the game.

Contents
1 rulebook
1 book with track information
1 CD with 396 musicfragments
6 chips
6 pencils
1 notebook with sheets
1 sandtimer

name: Otgovorko
description:
Sometimes your friends can be so annoying that you just want to hit them. Especially that guy on your left.

This is a quick, brutal game by Chris DeLeo. Each turn, you make an attack against the player on your left. If they fail to defend, then they take the attack cards into their hand. The goal is to get rid of all the cards in your hand after the draw pile has been exhausted. Being the first player to do so is nice, but being the second player to do so is just as good. The loser is the last player left holding cards.

This game is exclusively available in The Decktet Book.

name: Das Geheimnis der Pyramide
description:
Objective: be the first to arrive at your tent with all 4 parts of a golden mask
players are acting by turns, using 2 dice
1 die has to be used for your meeple, the other to move a lion
players dig for gold - better: parts of a mask
each part buried four times - but you must find 4 matching parts
