you may dug, block (with lions), steal whatever brings you closer to the goal to leave the others behind...
categories: Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Exploration

name: Bibi Blocksberg Hexenprüfung Hextrankkunde
description:
The young witches Bibi, Schubia, Flauipaui and Arkadia need to pass their exams at the end of the year.

Hextrankkunde tests dexterity. You receive one straw and 5 ingredient chips and try so suck up a chip with the straw and place it into the cauldron. The first player to place all his chips into the cauldron wins the game.

name: Rin Tin Tin
description:
Objective: be the first to cross finish line - meeting Rin Tin Tin
Simple 'Roll and Move' game
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Scoop
description:
British card game. No publisher mentioned anywhere but I do know it was made by a company called James Cond Ltd.

Scoop is a frantic game in the manner of the better known Pit. Players don't have turns, instead they just call out for the card they want. They can only call the name of the card they want to get rid off, not the colour. The first player to get all seven 'Scoops' in one colour, wins.

There are penalty cards and a player cannot win if he has penalty cards in his hand so it is important to get rid of them quickly.

name: Guerilla !
description:
Guerilla ! is a miniature skirmish ruleset published in Vae Victis magazine issue #15. The game simulates battles of the mid-nineteenth century, especially the many colonial wars of the era.

The game uses a simple chit-pull system to alternate figure activation. An activated figure can move and/or fire, reload a weapon or attack in close combat. The rules include the different firearms available at the time (muzzle- and breach-loading rifles, pistols and carbines), cavalry, cover, morale, experience levels (a veteran figure will reload a weapon faster and have bonuses to morale, shooting and close combat), and a scenario simulating the last moments of the battle of Camerone.

Scale: 1 mini = 1 man, 1 cm = 1 m, a turn = a few seconds

name: Toads & Dragonflies
description:
Toads&Dragonflies is a tile laying game that is a directly descendant to Hippos & Crocodiles of nestorgames . Its development was sparked by the contest Nestorgames is constantly holding on BGG for new games. And each abstract deserves a hexed version...:)
You place your animals on the board, whoever can't place his tile looses.

Included in this game are 3 board sizes. The river, the lake and the stream.The later needs 4 tiles, called "boulders" to be placed before choosing your animal.

name: Starzone
description:
Starzone is a print-and-play game for 2 players set in outer space. Each player battles with a fleet of spacecraft by flicking coins into the Starzone target. The Starzone target is made up of different zones, and asteroids which litter space. Which zone you hit determines which action you take: you can repair your spacecraft, activate your shields, add or destroy asteroids on the target, or damage your opponent's spacecraft. A special Zone Shift zone on the target allows you to change which actions can be activated by hitting each zone, adding a tactical element to the game. Your spacecraft has different sectors, and the health of each sector is given by hit points. When one sector is destroyed then your spacecraft is destroyed. The first player to destroy three of their enemy's fleet wins the game.

Starzone is a fun and furious game of dexterity and strategy. Outwit your opponent using asteroids and zone-shifts. Find your enemy's weak spot and flick it into outer space!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Arcanum: The Witch
description:
Arcanum: The Witch is a small expansion for the Arcanum base game.

When you move a court figure on an empty city area, you gain control of the Witch. When you control the Witch during the "draw cards" phase, you can draw one additional Minor Arcana card – that is, either four Minor Arcana or one Minor Arcana and one Major Arcana – or force all other players to discard a card.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Political

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Epic Zombie Horde Promo Card
description: This new promo can only be acquired by getting the Z-Day bundle with all 15 expansions!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Paperclip Railways: Freight Expansion
description:
This mini-expansion was printed in VERY limited numbers as part of the preparations for Essen Spiel'11 and the launch of the Paperclip Railways Express Edition.

Five extra cards go into the station deck and trigger a Freight phase when drawn - this involves moving cubes around a bit.

The expansion is now available as a print'n play download from the Surprised Stare Games website.

Suprised Stare Games

name: Bolotudu
description:
An abstract game on a 5x6 grid of African origin. It is similar to Dara with a few exeptions.

Each player has 12 pieces (stones, bids, etc.) of his colour. During initial set-up players take turns to place their pieces on empty squares of the board, two pieces (one piece in Dara) at a time. They must avoid 'three in a row' orthogonally during this phase.

In the second phase players move their pieces to adjacent squares trying to form 'three in a row' (diagonals don't count). After making 'three in a row' a player removes an enemy piece which is adjacent to either side of this row (that's another difference to Dara). A player loses the game when only 2 pieces of his colour remain on the board.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Money Mania
description:
Money Mania is a stock-speculating boardgame which is completely depending on the luck of 4 different specially designed dice.
The game can be played as a basic game, where each turn a player rolls the two Company Dice and the two Share Dice to see which of the four Companies he may trade in and how many blocks of shares may be traded (each dice is marked 1, 2 or 3). When shares are bought or sold the price goes up or down one unit on the central gameboard for every block of shares traded. As the share price changes players attempt to buy low and sell high in order to make the most profit.

In the advanced game players can expand their possibilities - take out loans and put options. Various random events, such as market trends are also introduced through the use of event cards.

What adds a little fun is the fact, that you can decide what actions you will take with the different results...
Winner is the first player to amass 1.000.000 credits.

name: Hexenhaus
description: Hexenhaus is a simple dice-driven game for children. One player is the witch, all others are knights. The witch tries to capture the knights, while the knights try to rescue a princess imprisoned in the witch's cottage and bring her back to the castle without being caught by the witch.

name: Hero Express
description:
Hero Express is a superhero re-theme of Arkham Express by David Willems.

Players will select one of the six included Heroes, or make your own, each with a unique special ability.

During a player's turn they will roll 5 Hero dice with unique symbols on each side, after rolling they have the option of re-rolling 3 more times.

If the "Villain" symbol is rolled on a die it is locked and cannot be re-rolled (unless the hero has an ability that allows it).

If 3 Villain symbols appear a new crime is reported and a new villain appears in Dark City.

The other sides of the dice include movement, Hero tokens (spent to use superpowers and items), recovery, and combat symbols (used when fighting the villains).

Capturing Villains allow the gathering of Justice Points, which are spent at a super secret location to purchase new abilities and items.

If at anytime there is 9 active crimes on the board, they Mayor will replace your team.

Each player must carefully choose how to use their abilities, items and hero tokens to thwart crimes and ultimately draw the Crimelord from hiding and defeat him.

Again I would like to thank David Willems for allowing me to create this re-theme, and for creating Arkham Express.

name: ZeN
description: ZeN is a connection game played on a torus, which can be visualized as a board whose edges "wrap" around to the opposite side. As in Quax, players alternate between either placing a stone of their color or connecting two of their stones diagonally. One player attempts to create either a vertical "loop" or a NW-SE "spiral" around the board, while the other aims for a horizontal "loop" or a SW-NE "spiral". Like in many connection games, draws are impossible and exactly one player must win.

name: Fodboldspil: EM-84
description:
This is a game which was produced when Denmark reached their first European championship (EM).

The object of the game is to win the soccer match.
The 2 players agree before the game how long they will play, and then try to move the ball in a position where they will be able to score.

Each player takes a turn, rolling a dice.
The player with the ball rolls 0,2, 4 or 6 enabling him to either move his players in position or dribbling with the ball (at double cost). After movement he will have to pass the ball at least one time (kicking it away if unable to reach a teammate). And of course score, should the opportunity arise.
The player without the ball rolls 0,2,4,6 or freekick. He will try to block the way to his goal. If he rolls a freekick, he will get the ball and start his attack.

name: Card Chase
description:
The goal of the game is to utilize the deck of standard playing cards in order to be the first to get your four color-coded pegs all the way around the board, and finally back to your safety zone base before any other player.

Depending on the card you play during your turn, determines the amount of movement one of your pegs may move. Landing on an opposing players peg causes their peg to be returned to their home/starting location.

Some of the cards played have special abilities that can be used in a strategic manner, such as plying a 4, which allows one of your pegs to move four spaces backwards instead of forwards. You can also play a jack, which allows your to switch the places of any two pegs on the board, which do not even have to be your own.

Game Includes:
- Wooden Gameboard
- 16 Pegs of Four Different Colors
- Deck of Standard Playing Cards
- Rules Sheet

name: La course des grenouilles
description:
A typical game for kids (speed, fun and animals). Two frogs must compete to arrive first at the middle of the pond in a beautiful water lily.
Each player rolls a die and moves his frog on a track to reach the water lily. There are several dangers (snakes, humans) and distractions (flies, dragonflies) and some others cases give bonus to you frog.
This game looks like le "Jeu de l'Oie", but it is easier. But more important, it's game played by all kids in the northern provinces of France (something cultural, I suppose).
Material : 1 6-sided die, 2 tokens (frogs) and a board (the rules are printed on the board).
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Print & Play, Racing

name: Tank Commander
description:
Tank Commander is a collectible card wargame covering tactical combat on the Eastern Front during WW2 designed by John Desch and Ulrich Blennemann and firsts published by Moments in History in 1996.

Each deck contains 60 cards, a small 56 page rule book (don't gasp -- you can grasp play concepts in seconds). Two decks are the minimum required for play. Six decks maximize the experience.

Each card, designed by Beth Queman, represents a vehicle, (tank, half-track, armored car, truck) infantry or calvary squad, AT gun and crew, special equipment (like a Panzerfaust), terrain type and special events. There are a total of 164 different card types in 3 different levels of rarity. There's some minor card errata (nothing serious) and a list of all types on Web-Grognards. Each card has a color picture, short description, and different numbers representing game factors.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II

name: Iron Winds of War
description:
A very rules-lite medieval/fantasy wargame system.
It uses 6-sided dices for every resolution, from morale to combat outcome, unit included are just warriors, levies, knights and archers. Some of them can be mounted or not to add some variety to the game.
Bein a very rules-lite system (just 3 pages) it does not include units' experience advancements, campaign rules or siege machines. It gives just the possibility to rise armies and fight with friends one evening on the dinner table, the game is anyway surprisingly fun if compared to the brevity of rules.

name: Race For The Cheese
description: The object of this game is for the Mice to collect as much cheese as they can!... But beware of the Cat. Each player takes three mice of the colour of their choice. These are placed in the Mouse-holes at each corner of the playing board. The first player throws the dice and moves his mouse in an anti-clockwise direction and up the track of his colour to the table where he collects a piece of cheese and tries to return with this to his own Mouse-hole without being caught by the Cat who stalks the outside track. If your Mouse is trapped by the Cat he must go to the Cat's basket and he is out of the game. It's fast and furious fun especially when all your Mice have been caught ... and you take control of the Cat. The winner is the player who collected the most pieces of cheese during the game.

name: Komische Leute
description:
A childrens game consisting of 60 cards divided into 3 groups with 20 cards each: front, middle and rear parts of funny people.

Game is played by each player combining a card of each group to one people each turn. This will produce comical results which will make the children laugh. Then players can trade body-parts to create proper people. You score points for each proper people completed.

name: 4 Get It
description:
4 Get It is a domino style board game where you try to build squares of the same color - or squares that are composed of all four distinct colors. Each square is claimed by placing a token onto it.

Each tile shows two colors (some tiles are, of course, doubles) and two symbols. When laying down a tile it's color must only match only match the color of one of the adjacent tiles on the board.

Some suggested variants allow for different levels in the game. Some involve the use of the symbols, others the use of a 6D die limiting the possible moves in a turn.

name: Anima Tactics: Lostaroth Marchosias
description:
The ultimate executioner, Marchosias is the most powerful warrior of the Inquisition. He is a dangerous weapon that the Church unleashes only when the situation is truly dire. With unlimited potential for destruction and a wildly unpredictable temperament, the man known as the Lord of Massacres now walks Gaia once more…

Dark Church Optional Leader Warrior - Lv. 60

At 6 | Dm 5 | Df 9 | Ar 0/5 | LP 18 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/5

Liberation: At any point you can have Marchosias suffer Berserk Lv.2

Lord of Slaughter: Whenever Marchosias destroys a unit, put a Slaughter Token on him. Having Slaughter Tokens on Marchosias will grant him additional abilities as detailed on the following chart:

-1+ While Marchosias suffers Berserk, he uses his secondary Armor attribute.
-2+ Marchosias gets Critical Mastery
-3+ Whenever Marchosias makes an Attack, he rolls 2 dice and takes the highest.
-4+ Whenever Marchosias Attacks or Charges (Basic or Special ones), reduce the cost of that Action by 1 Action Point.

ooo - Neo Genocide (Ki, Attack)

+ 3 Attack. This Attack effects all enemy units engaged with Marchosias.

ooooo - Final Annihilation (Ki, Attack)
Marchosias makes 3 consecutive attacks against each enemy unit engaged with him.

Optional Leader: You may choose to use this skill card when Marchosias is in your party. If you do, Marchosias gains +5 levels, has the abilities on this card, and is a Leader.

Surge of Death: In addition to the effects described in Lord of Slaughter, Slaughter tokens also grant the abilities detailed in the following chart:

-1+ Friendly units within Marchosias's Control Zone gain +1 Damage.
-2+ Friendly units within Marchosias's Control Zone gain Critical Mastery
-3+ Whenever friendly units within Marchoasias's Control Zone make an Attack, they roll 2 dice and take the highest.
-4+ If a friendly unit within Marchosias's Control Zone scores a Critical Hit, they can make a Basic Attack against the original Attack's target. The additional Attacks generated by this ability is not affected by it.

name: Charges Antiques et Médiévales
description:
This is only a generic rulebook, which is not associated with a specific brand or set of miniatures.

translation from back cover:

Miniatures-based wargame for sure is among the mor entertaining way for discovering History. Still, the game pleasure is way dependent on the quality of the rules. The present one is the outcome of years of gameplay and game development.

original from back cover:

Le jeu avec figurines est certainement un des moyens les plus agréables pour découvrir l'Histoire. Mais le plaisir que l'on peut prendre à pratiquer ce genre de jeu dépend beaucoup de la qualité de la règle utilisée. La présente règle est l'aboutissement d'années de pratique et de développement du jeu d'Histoire avec figurines.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Line Drawing

name: Rocket Die
description:
In the distant future, man will establish colonies on other planets. For now, man stands on the verge of what will likely be his final war on earth: a nuclear war. Man’s two previous wars to end war never truly solved the problem. This time, the weapons are much larger and more destructive. The ruling nuclear powers have decided that Earth is only large enough for one of them; they consider shared power a waste of time. Resources grow scarce; diplomats and the U.N. have failed. Your power can only survive to lead humanity by eliminating all other powers that stand in its way. Speed of launch is life or death.

Rocket Die is primarily a dice (or die, rather) game for 3-6 players. Each player controls a nuclear-capable nation of the future, called a power. Each turn is divided into three phases: deployment (aiming weapons at other powers), roll out (cycling repeatedly to decide which power will launch) and launch (validating and executing the launch, damaging other powers). The goal is for your power to be the first to initiate launch each turn, since only one power gets to launch per turn. The game ends when all players but one are eliminated.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: JB GAME VAULT, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Tex Willer
description:
Board game inspired by the famous comic Tex Willer.
The game is 3D so, before to start, the players must to install on board: Saloon, General Store, Indian camp and a Mountain.
Divided into two groups, gunslingers and natives, the players will roll the dice to move on the path while the duels will be solved with a special dice. In the game there are also two decks of cards, one for each group, to influence the game with some unforeseen.
Winner is the first to arrive in the hamlet opponent.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Memo Silhouettes
description: What a wonderful alternative to simple picture matching memo games. In this clever version, children must collect the most pairs of the animal and its shadow. A bit of extra concentration is required though, because there are 2 cards of the same animal, but in slightly different poses!!! A great twist on an old favourite.

name: Who?
description:
Each Player is given a card of a Famous Character which has a number of clues about them,
Players travel the Board landing on spaces which allows them to get clues about their opponents Character,
Some clues have to be read out aloud so everyone benefits but some are only given to you.
The First Player to guess there opponent's identity wins a series of points ,
The Winner is the one who has the most points after a certain time or one who has reached a Target number of points.

name: Halloween Dice
description:
Halloween Dice comes with a set of big orange-and-black six-siders, with custom Jack o' Lantern designs on each face. Your goal: roll those dice and try to reach the lucky total of 13. (Normally 13 is considered an unlucky number, but for Halloween, when darkness and otherworldly things are celebrated, luck stands on its head.)

On a turn, you choose one, two, or three dice and receive respectively $2, $5, or $9, with money being represented by tokens. You then roll those dice. If the sum on the dice equals 13, you end your turn and keep the money you collected. If the total is less than 13, you can stop and pay $1 times the difference between your sum and 13, or you can again choose 1-3 dice (receiving more money) and roll again, adding the newly rolled sum to your previous sum. You again face the same options of stopping or choosing more dice and rolling again. If your sum goes over 13, however, your turn ends and you pay $2 times the difference between your sum and 13!

The player with the most money after three rounds wins.

name: Fungibility
description:
Fungibility is a strategic, Euro-style, economic engine, resource management card game for 2-4 players, which uses 108 cards, and no other components.

Fungibility is also a financial term, referring to commodities which are functionally indistinguishable from one another, such as currency, graded crude oil, and pure gold. In keeping with this concept, the cards in Fungibility (the card game) are all identical copies of the same card.

To create some degree of randomness, the deck is shuffled, first with half the cards rotated, then a second time with half the cards flipped face-up. The facing, position, and even rotational orientation of cards relative to each player's seating position has a logically distinct meaning within the game, meaning that the same card in the supply may have completely different meanings to each player.

The basic game is free to print and play. It is the author's intent that, should the game be published and sold at retail, the retail cards would include art elements unreferenced by the core rules. As of writing, the author has three expansions designed, each of which would merely describe rules for the unreferenced art elements, and which would be made available free of charge, post release.
categories: Card Game, Industry / Manufacturing, Print & Play

name: The Wombles Game
description:
Contents
1 Game Board.
4 Womble Playing Pieces + Stands.
4 Jigsaw Puzzles.
4 Tidy Bags.
1 Litter Bin.
1 Spinner.
Rules Are Printed on the Inner Box Base.

Play as Wellington, Bungo, Orinoco or Tomsk. Each player has a jigsaw to complete.

Move around the board collecting the pieces.
Player's try to complete their puzzle by using the pieces that they find on the path to Wimbledon Common. These pieces represent litter. And in true Wombles style, they just love to pick up litter.

The winner is the player who completes their puzzle first and in so doing, helps to tidy the Common.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Jackpot
description:
Jackpot is a family game in which players select a horse, or horses, and race them at selected odds, 2 circuits of the track, plus any handicap entailed by the odds chosen.
Each player bets on horses using the chips provided. The player with the most chips after the Jackpot race has been run is deemed to be the winner.
Game contents
1 x playing board
6 x plastic horses and riders in six different colours
120 x small plastic chips
6 x large plastic chips
1 x dice
1 x rules leaflet
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Squiddler
description: Players draw two cards and discard one with the goal of forming one word of at least 7 letters and all other cards in hand (if any) forming a word or words of at least 3 letters each. Using the colorful alphabetical card deck published to play Quiddler ("The Short Word Game"), Squiddler is for players who enjoy a challenge with longer words. The name of the game is a portmanteau word combining "Seven" and "Quiddler."

name: Jigger
description:
Jigger is a Children’s Game for the Decktet in the vein of “Go Fish”. One Decktet for every 3 players is recommended, so in theory the game can accommodate an unlimited number of players.

Players begin the game with a hand of 5 cards. The lead player calls out “I demand …” naming one of the Decktet’s six suits. Players who are holding cards of this suit must surrender all of them to fulfill the demand. Players who can’t answer the demand holler “Jigger!” and then go fishing from the draw pile until they can give up a card which matches suit. The next player in turn order then makes her demand and play continues in this way until the deck runs out. Cards in players’ takes are then tallied and the player with the most cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Memory, Print & Play

name: Dougram Simulation Manual
description:
Tactical level wargame based on Japanese anime animation "Fang of the Sun Dougram".
This game issue with Dual Magazine #2 to #5. Each edition can play separately and later game added another terrain, new units and scenarios.

Players control small troop of either Earth Federation Army or People's Liberation Army.
The game play is course of alternately player turns, but there are opponent defensive combat phase between the movement and combat phase. Combat is resolved in the two steps of accuracy and armor penetration.

The game contains several scenarios based on the story. Victory conditions are different for each scenario.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Das Kindergarten-Wörterspiel: Fahrzeuge
description:
Das Kindergarten-Wörterspiel: Fahrzeuge

is a cooparative game for the languange training with childs from 3 to 6 years (with the help of one adult).

Ole, Marie and Zeki want to drive within Dad car to the zoo. And you can come along! While you drive around the board you have to achieve some challenges. The field on which the car is show which kind of challenge you get. If you were succesfull you gain one card. It is the goal to get 9 cards before the ample turn to red.

The Challenges are around story-telling, Memory and roleplay.

(user summary)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Anima Tactics: Morrigan
description:
In more than seven centuries of history, Samael has had among its
members the strangest of entities. With the possible exception of the Fallen Angels themselves, none of these beings can be compared to the creature that is Morrigan, Lady of Space and Time. Her origins are a mystery. She is a legend among legends, a being out of dark tales that roams the earth having taken physical form. The most widely believed tale is that she is one of the nine great Demon Queens, born in ancient times from a distortion in existence that gave her consciousness. However, this may simply be another of the many stories inspired by her thousands of years of existence.

Dark Samael Warrior/Mystic - Lv. 70

At 5 | Dm 6 | Df 9 | Ar 2 | LP: 40 | Re 11 | Mo 6/10 | AP 3/4

Innate Abilities: Damage Resistance, Critical Mastery

oo - Infinium (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance (12 inches).

o - Thanatos (Ki, Charge)
Thanatos may only be used against an Enemy Unit that has already been hit by Infinium this Turn. During the movement for this ability Morrigan is Intangible.

oo - Hypnos (Ki, Effect)
An enemy Unit that is within 12 inches of Morrigan is moved, in a straight line, into base to base contact with her. This ability cannot be used on a Unit already engaged in hand-to-hand combat. Effect 16.

oooo - Hades (Ki, Attack)
Morrigan makes three consecutive attacks against the same target. Even if Morrigan takes damage from a Counterattack, the remaining attacks from this ability will still be made.

—-

Morrigan - Lady of Space and Time

Appendices: Any hand to hand attack made by Morrigan ignores 2 points of the defender's Armor.

Phase Step: Morrigan ignores all movement penalties due to difficult terrain, as well as climbing or descending from elevations.

Space Control: An enemy Unit that crosses or is inside of Morrigan's Control Zone reduces the distance that they can Walk, Run, or Charge by 2 inches. Characters of a level equal to or greater than Morrigan's are not affected by this ability.

name: Anima Tactics: Samael Agent
description:
The Circle of Fallen Angels regularly employs resourceful and dangerous individuals to further its goals. Making up a shadowy network of operatives, Samael Agents are empowered to sow chaos and confusion across all of Gaia in their name.

Neutral Samael Mystic/Warrior - Lv. 20+

At 4 | Dm 3 | Df 8 | Ar 0 | LP: 10 | Re 9 | Mo 8/12 | AP 2/4

Agent: Samael Agents are not unique characters and you may include 1 for every 150 Levels in a Samael Party. For example, a party of 300 levels could include up to two Samael Agents.

ooo - Magic Beam (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance (16 Inch). +1 Damage

ooo - Arcane (Magic, Effect)
A Character within the Samael Agent's control zone is affected by one of the States chosen, and paid for, from the Agent's skill card. If no state was chosen, and paid for, then this ability can't be used. Effect: 15

Samael Agent Skill Card

A Samael Agent can possess any combination of the following options, as long the added levels do not take their total level above 40. Any option cannot be chosen more than once.

The Agent recovers one more Action point per turn. Lv. +10
The Agent becomes a Level 1 Summoner with affinity to their own faction. Lv. +5
Magic Beam's cost is reduced to oo. Lv. 5
Arcane causes Paralyze Lv. 2. Lv. +10
Arcane causes Blind Lv. 2. Lv. +5
Arcane causes Slow Lv. 2. Lv. +5
Arcane causes Healing Lv. 2. Lv. +5
Arcane causes Haste Lv. 2. Lv. +5
Arcane causes Protection Lv. 2. Lv. +5
Arcane's Effect is increased to 16. Lv. +5
The Agent gets the Innate Ability Flight. Lv. +5
The Agent gets +1 Attack and +1 Damage. Lv. +5
The Agent gets the following ability. Lv. +5
oooo - Valkyrie (Ki, Charge)

+ 2 Attack/+2 Damage

Alignment: If the Agent's Arcane ability causes either Paralyze, Blind, or Slow, then the Agent is changed to being Dark faction rather than Neutral. If the Agent's Arcane ability causes either Healing, Protection, or Haste, then the Agent is changed to being Light faction rather than Neutral. If none are chosen, then you decide whether the Agent is either Dark or Light faction.

name: Anima Tactics: XII
description:
Little is known about XII, the reserved and solitary supervisor of the Crows of Wissenschaft. The majority of agents of the organization have never seen him, much less know him. He is a shadow that crawls in the dark, someone who appears inexplicably in different places of the world and leaves without a trace. Many say that he is no more than a ghost, a legend whose mantle is taken up by a different person over and over again.

However… he is very real.

Neutral Wissenschaft Warrior Leader - Lv. 60

At 6 | Dm 4 | Df 10 | Ar 0 | LP: 15 | Re 10 | Mo 12/16 | AP 3/5

Innate Abilities: Initiative

Equipment: XII may have two Advantage Cards attached to him.

The Process: At the end of each Upkeep Phase, XII gains Lv1 of one of the next Status: Shield, Healing, Protection or Haste.

ooo - Veritas (Ki, Attack)

+ 5 Attack

oo - Vox Nihili (Ki, Ranged Attack)
Distance (16 inches).

o - Versus (Ki, Charge)
This ability may only be used immediately after XII hits a Character with the Vox Nihili Ranged Attack. Versus's target must be the same as Vox Nihili's target was.

o - Visio Dei (Ki, Attack)
This Attack may only be used immediately after resolving a successful Charge or Versus.

A part of Team Assault Group along with Rayne and Lorenzo.

name: Piro
description:
"Humanity, since its beginning, admires the restless beauty of fire. It's hard to say if this fascination comes from its light, its heat or from the fear of its destructive power."

"In Piro, players are stimulated to reflect about the dificulty of controlling the fire and will discover why it is called the most rebellious of the four elements."

"The conflagration has just begun... and you with your own hands have it under control!"

"The goal: Every player must spread the fire through the most number of circles on the board. A circle is said "aflame" when it contains exactly one piece of each color (1 red, 1 yellow and 1 orange) or 3 of the same kind (e.g. 3 yellow pieces). Players receive points for completing this task and the winner is the player who first reaches 25 points!"

name: Eesti Jalgpall
description:
The game where is mixed football, dice rolling and trivia.
There are 10 footballers and 1 goalkeeper on the big game board for both players. Player rolls 4 dice on his turn. He may move his footballers as many squares indicated on 2 usual dice.
There are yellow or red card on one side of the 2 other dice.
If yellow card is rolled player's opponent draws yellow card and asks a question about Estonian football (soccer). If current player answers correctly he may continue his turn.
If he answers uncorrectly he misses the turn.
If red card is rolled player must remove one of his footballer from the game.

Player who scores most at the end of the game hitting the goals is the winner.

From the publisher:
This is a dice game, that combines trivia, football (not American "football") and dice luck.
Game goes by the rules of football and also gives advantage to the player who has more knowledge about Estonian national football team.
Each player tries to score goals, by going by the game board instructions, while each correct answer will give you another chance to hit a goal.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cardo
description:
Game played with two identical sets of 34 tiles. Each tile is marked with one of the card suits: spades, hearts, diamonds or clubs, plus one of the values from 7 up to ace.

You try to get rid of your tiles in a domino-like manner. In the same suit with a value one higher or lower than the tile next to it. Or in a different suit with the same value. The black and red joker have special rules.

First one to get rid of his tiles wins.

name: Frisky
description:
Card game issued one card at a time in cigarettes made by W A & A C Churchman. Two games are described using these cards.

Frisky Families is a Happy Families game. 52 cards were issued, in 13 sets of four. Each set of four is attributed to a different animal. Frisky himself, is card no 1 and he is a rabbit. The game play is similar to other set collecting games. In his turn, a player may ask another player for a certain card. If that player has such a card, he must hand it over. The turn can now be extended by asking for another card, and so on. When you have a set of four, you may lay it in front of you. After all 13 sets have been collected, the player with the most sets, wins.

Game 2 is just called Frisky.

This is a trick-taking game. In effect, you play with 52 cards, all in one suit, and the higher card is most likely to take the trick. The cards are ranked 2 to 52. Card 1, Frisky' is the highest card though and will always win the trick in which he is played. After all the cards have been played, the player with the most cards in tricks, wins.

The original game was published in 1935. Since then, there has been at least one reproduction set.

name: Blitzkrieg in Burma
description: The game covers a operational land battle in Burma from January to May 1942. Each turn covers half a month. The map covers Burma and neighboring areas such as China India and Thailand. One player commands Imperial Japanese Army and the other player commands the Allied Forces.

name: Cup Final (Harris)
description: Cup Final is a soccer board game, played on a 30x50 grid. Each player has 11 footballers on the board, which exert a zone of control which is used to intercept the ball. The ball is moved by means of dice throw which tells you how many squares the ball moves, and the direction type (e.g. diagonally). The board is also divided into 6 zones, and when the ball is moved into a new zone, an Action Card is drawn which may make you lose possession, or allow you to move the ball through ZoCs. Every five minutes the players are allowed to redistribute their footballers around the board.

name: Battlefield Evolution: Warbirds of World War II – A Supplement for Battlefield Evolution: World at War
description:
From the back of the Book
It was during World War II that the aircraft truly evolved into a state of the art military weapon, far out-shadowing its not inconsiderable achievements of the previous war. The citizens of every nation were already living in dread of the bomber, and its promise to rain death down upon the cities in which they lived with impunity – that nightmare was now a reality.

From the outset of the war, Germany demonstrated just how lethal aircraft could be when used in conjunction with infantry and armour. Indeed, this was the very cornerstone of Blitzkrieg. However, aircraft evolved into weapon delivery platforms in their own right. For the first time, ship-launched attack aircraft could destroy vessels far beyond the visual range of their parent carrier, as demonstrated first by the Royal Navy at Taranto, then at Pearl Harbour by Japan, and finally by US forces as they hopped across the islands of the Pacific.

Heavy bombers pounded cities and factories throughout the war, but the dreams commanders had of aircraft being able to win wars proved to be mislead. A population bombarded did not automatically result in a breakdown of national morale – quite the opposite. Also, technology evolved to counter bomber attacks, from the dogged defence of the British Isles during the Battle of Britain, to the sophisticated layered defences of Germany against the thousand bomber raids.

On the battlefield, the importance of air superiority became apparent, with the dominant force claiming the skies. Once enemy aircraft had been chased from the battlefield, fighter bombers used cannon, bomb and rocket to annihilate ground forces. Even mighty tanks were fodder for the Stuka, Thunderbolt and Typhoon.

Infantry and armour were still needed to wage war and take ground. The addition of aircraft made their task either a great deal easier or far more difficult, depending on how their pilots fared in the air.

This book contains aircraft from every period of the war, for every military force featured in Battlefield Evolution: World at War. Each aircraft has been painstakingly researched, and includes upgrades throughout the war, and multiple payload options, guaranteeing you will find a use for all the weapons included in your average aircraft kit!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II

name: Das IQ-Spiel für Kinder
description:
Objective: be the first reaching top of the board/ranking list (= genius)
- acting by turn -
1 each player rolls the die determine the section (question cards) '6' = free of choice;
2 find the answer within a certain time - usually a minute
3 if you were right - 1 step up ==> direction 'genius'; wrong - 1 step down ==> direction 'mutt'
player may use certain materials (paper, pencil...), and spend chips (6 at the start) to extend required time

remark: same approach was used for 'IQ Trainer' http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/115669/iq-trainer
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Dice, Educational, Trivia, Word Game

name: Duelo Final
description:
It's a fencing tournament, where they can participate 2 to 8 players simultaneously. It is a game dominated intuition, but also requires a little strategy to determine which will be the action most suitable sensing and analyzing the possibilities of the rival.

Actions on Pedana are carried out contemporary, following a timeline, with a dynamic system that determines a number of actions variable simultaneously on each shift.

---

Es un torneo de esgrima, donde pueden participar de 2 a 8 jugadores en forma simultánea.

Es un juego donde predomina la intuición, pero que requiere también un poco de estrategia para determinar cuales serán las acciones mas convenientes, intuyendo y analizando las posibilidades del rival.

Las acciones sobre la pedana se realizan en forma contemporánea, siguiendo una línea de tiempo, con un sistema dinámico que determina un número de acciones simultáneas variable en cada turno

name: Bataille astrale
description:
Each player has 11 game-pieces:
10 pieces has an arrow that indicates the attack and dark sides of which are defenses. One piece is completely defenseless and without attacking possibility: the Vulnerable.
In his turn player has two possible actions:
- rotation (optional)
- a movement
He may move his game-piece to one of the six directions n moves and if he attacks and there is defensless side of opponent's game piece he captures it.
The first player who captures opponent's Vulnerable wins the game.

name: Pyramid Shambo
description:
Pyramid Shambo is tournament-style Rock Paper Scissors (aka Roshambo), with pyramids used as scoring chips. Pyramid Shambo is to RPS what a Texas Hold ‘em Tournament is to a single hand of classic poker.

Each player in turn challenges another to a round of Roshambo, with the loser paying the winner a small pyramid, making change as necessary based on pip counts. Every time there's a tie, the payout escalates and the players continue to throw until there's a winner. A player gets a bonus for eliminating another, and the eliminated player's pyramids are removed from the game. The last player standing wins.

This was made available on the Looney Labs web site late in 2011 as the company's holiday gift to fans, presumably as a revision of the 2009 gift Nothing Beats a Large.

Also included in Pyramid Arcade.

name: Kidiquoi
description:
Each player chooses an animal and play it simultanously.
When one and the same animal is present on several cards, the first player to imitate his voice wins the card. The player with the most points is declared "Grand Winner".

The are also several other variants of this card game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time

name: Tzing & Tzang
description:
Tzing is a circus horse. Tzang is his tamer, but he always forgets something in his equipment. We must help him find what he has forgotten.

All cards are spread face-up on the table. Equipment cards are shuffled, top card is drawn and all players are looking horse from the card what equipment is missing. The player who finds the right one wins the card. When all equipment cards have been checked, the game is over. The winner is the one with the most cards.

name: Glory & Grief I
description: A self-published tactical combat module for Advanced Squad Leader, consisting of a rule leaflet, map section, pre-cut counters, and scenario cards, expanding the game to the Vietnam War. New units and rules include helicopters, war dogs, claymore mines, and other equipment and situations unique to the conflict in SE Asia.

name: Quiz & Co. 4 Schuljahr
description:
1250 questions and answers for the 4th grade - 10-11 years old children.

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

name: Wahr oder Gelogen: Kinder
description:
Wahr oder Gelogen Junior version.

660 incredible stories that are true or a lie. Flying fish build their nests on the branches of coconut trees. Even the Romans 2000 years ago produced ice cream and eaten...etc
Two of 660 incredible stories that are true or a lie. Each player must decide whether he now wants to believe a story or not. Who typed correctly, gets a chip. Who first gets ten chips is the winner.
For 2-6 players aged 6 years.

name: Crossword Picante
description:
Crossword Picante is a bilingual crossword game utilizing foam tiles with letters from the English alphabet on one side and letters from the Spanish alphabet on the other.

Players take turns forming words crossword style in either language, replenishing their hand of letters after each play.

Play ends when the letters in the chile pepper shaped bag are exhausted.

name: Rivaling Royals of Europe
description:
Third Edition Released!Rule as Royal Regent within the powerful countries of Medieval Europe, govern her ancient cities, control her trade guilds, command her armies, and sway her religious faithful in Rivaling Royals™, a game for two to five players.

Evade ruthless adversaries while manipulating the powers of Royal Privilege, the Sways of Religion, the Stimulus of Trade, and the Deadly Forces of the Military. Work to create an alliance of cities, trade guilds, and militant nobility, or -- try to undermine the power of your rivals plundering their territories, vanquishing their troops, and usurping the prerogative powers of state for yourself.

Inspire, deceive, trade, and fight your way to fortune and fame as you attempt to reign over the medieval countries of Europe!

Rivaling Royals™ includes:


20 Trade Guide Cards
16 Medieval European City Cards
16 Troops Cards
15 Royalty Cards
6 Event Cards (Invasion, Reformation, The Plague)
4 Regent Cards (France, England, Spain, Scotland)
4 Espionage Cards
4 Execution Cards
2 Letters Patent Cards
2 Assassin Cards
And everything else you need to play




Pursue religious and temporal powers by using your Royal Family to capture the titles of Bishop, King, or Queen in England, Scotland, Spain, and France, transforming your Royal House into the Supreme Sovereign of Western Europe.

Can you evade the dagger of Assassins, the treacherous edicts of Rivaling Royalty, govern ancient medieval cities with their contentious Trade Guilds, and seize the ultimate title of Regent over the most powerful countries of Medieval Western Europe? Find out in Rivaling Royals™ of Europe!

name: ABC DRS3: Das Radiokultspiel für unterwegs
description:
Travel board game version of Swiss Radio Station DRS 3's call-in game show ABC DRS 3.

Gameplay involves a Candidate player being asked to provide a word beginning with a known letter in response to a definition. The more words the Candidate can correctly identify within 60 seconds, the higher their score.

Players take turns as Moderator, Listener and Candidate during the game.

The game's question and answer content is in Swiss German. The box details and instructions are in Standard German.

The game comes with

100 question cards
6 microphone cards
1 hourglass
1 20-sided die
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Tenka fubu
description:
Tenka Fubu is a diplomatic game on the Japanese Sengoku period. This game was designed for beginners.

The map includes only the central part of Honshu. The game concept is based on Feudal Lord but has simplier rules.

The players will control one of the six feudal lords. Each player conducts diplomacy and military operations. The Battles are resolved by a fire power combat system, in which fortress affect battle results. Also random events have various impact on the game play.

The game winner is determined by the total wealth of controled provinces.


The first edition was combined with Tanks and The Battle of the Bulge in one box. The product name was "Simulation games for beginner #1".

The second edition is Wargame Japanese History #28 game.

2nd edition contents:

1 rule book
1 map
2 countersheets
1 play sheet


[Number of players] 2 to 6 people
[Play time] About 60-120 minutes



"Tenka Fubu" (天下布武) was Oda Nobugana's seal. It has several meanings: "spread martial arts virtues in the world", but also often understood as "take over the world by force".
https://ja-m-wikipedia-org.translate.goog/wiki/%E7%B9%94%E7%...;_x_tr_tl=en&_x_tr_hl=fr&_x_tr_pto=wapp#%E6%94%BF%E7%AD%96
天下 under the sky / the world
布 spread / take over
武
publishers: Epoch, Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社)

name: Cars 2 World Grand Prix Board Game
description:
Race your favorite character from Cars 2, through Tokyo, Porta Corsa or London. Don't spend too much time in the pits and watch out for oil slicks. Every roll of the dice can affect any player - so you never know who will be first over the finish line.

This game should not be confused with the similarly titled Cars 2: World Grand Prix Board Game by Ravensburger or White Castle
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Terrabilis
description:
Each player manage a country in sustainable development theme trivia and expansion game.

Depending on where the die-determined player's pawn lands each turn, he might be able to buy some infrastructure (50% chance) (energy, socio-cultural or economic : they cost money, energy, social and environmental resources and might provide a regular income, energy, social and environment resources or suffer some random event, join the Alliance, have the opportunity for a windfall through a trivia question, etc.

The aim of the game is, more or less, to build the largest number of infrastructures while keeping a good stock of environmental and social resources.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Jim Knopf und Lukas der Lokomotivführer
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Jim Knopf und Lukas der Lokomotivfüher, players start with a three-dimensional train engine in the station of Lummerland, then travel to the sea, the top of the world, and the valley of dusk, among other locations. Who will be the first to make a complete round-trip with the locomotive and correctly guess all the destinations?

name: A Question of Sport: Booster Pack Team 1
description: Booster Back for the "A Question of Sport" board game based on the popular UK BBC television TV-show. This contains more trivia questions to be used in the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: A Question of Sport: Booster Pack Team 2
description: Booster Back for the "A Question of Sport" board game based on the popular UK BBC television TV-show
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: Le Petit Poucet et la maison de l'ogre
description:
"Tom Thumb and the Ogre's house"
In this game of cooperation Tom Thumb and his brothers move around the game board and must find all the stones before nightfall. Some stones are trapped (wolves are hidden nearby) and require support from the players to break free. It is possible to make the game harder by increasing the number of wolves hidden.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Frog and Toad
description:
Frog and Toad is a curious race game for 3-6 players. The players control froads (or is that togs?), creatures which are never quite sure whether they are hopping frogs or walking toads. The froads need to escape from their current environment which they do by racing down two spiraling roads to the exits, collecting bonus tokens on the way.

In each round of the game players first select the actions their froads will take from a shopping list of available actions. Then they move their froads. Depending on the situation, players will find that some actions are better than others, but each action may only be selected once in a round, so players scramble to select what they think will be their best actions, whilst second guessing what the other players will do.

Some actions that players may select change the settings of the game – who selects first and moves first, and what the criterion is for earning bonus move tokens. Other actions move your froads with hops or walks, forwards or backwards (going backwards allows you to pick up bonus move tokens). There are even actions that cause both of your froads to move.

There are effectively two separate races, and the winner of the game is the first player to get both of his froads to the end of their roads.

name: La Bête du Gévaudan
description:
The game is inspired in "Scotland Yard".

The Beast of Gevaudan living in Lozère County in France hides and sometimes rises to attack. It appears from time to time and moves constantly via rivers, roads and highways with the help on special cards and her location is not always known. The others players try to find her.

The game is sponsored by the department of Lozère.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: Old Century Pinball Golf
description:
Old Century Pinball Golf Wood Wooden Table Top Pinball Machine (Game)

Swing down the fairways of the legendary courses as you relive the golden era of golf. Make a birdie or score the elusive hole-in-one -- but watch out for the sand traps and water hazards!

An heirloom quality coffee table game, Pinball Golf provides fun for everyone, from grandparents to grand kids.


Archival quality coffee table game



Classic look and feel reminiscent of the golden era of golf



Great addition to any golf collection



Authentic fun for the whole family


Features: hole progress track (golf tee pinhole track), convenient ball return, club shaped flipper, challenging hazards, a hole-in-one ramp

These wonderfully low-tech "Coffee Table Games" will provide hours of authentic fun. Powered only by imagination and enthusiasm, these high quality games and toys connect people, young and old, through play. Old Century Classics' unique designs and innovative interpretations of game and toy classics set a new standard for shared fun and laughter.

name: Space Shibumi Invaders!
description:
Aliens are attacking! Invading Sector V!

The player must maneuver their Defender craft and shoot down advancing aliens as they descend from the sky. You have limited repair resources and ammunition for your laser cannon is in short supply. Eliminate all the Invaders before they either successfully land, or destroy the Defenser which occupies the bottom of the playfield

A solo play Space Invaders style game using the full Shibumi game set.

name: Mouton Rebêêêle
description:
The first player takes as many tiles he thinks he can remember and forms face-down tile-row on the table.
The next player can either add a tile to the row to be the first player or place it behind the row. All players do the same.

The player who leads the row must state the colors of the tiles one by one. If successful, it gets rid of his generous balls of wool by distributing to each opponent. If he's not successful, the other shepherds give him a free ball of wool. And it was the turn of the second player on the row to state the colors.

The first player to get rid of his balls of wool wins the game.

name: Stonehenge Cricket
description:
The ancient origins of a civilized sport. Play Test, Limited Over or Twenty20 versions of the game at its most hallowed amphitheater.
The Gentleman’s game of Cricket originated in England, is played on a circular arena, and since a Trilithon resembles an ancient giant set of cricket stumps, anthropologists have recently hypothesized that Stonehenge may actually have been built as an ancient cricket ground. One look at a photo of Dr. W. G. Grace should provide further proof of Druidic involvement in the sport.
This game is for the Stonehenge Game System

name: Night of the Bloody Sickles
description:
The Druid Council has become weakened through in-fighting and years of drought. The leader of each Druidic chapter races to seize control of the council and assume power as Chief Druid. Upon establishing command he unleashes a team of assassins to eliminate his political enemies, and become the unopposed Supreme Grand Chief Druid.

This game is based on the ancient African (Baggara Arabs of the Sudan) game of Li’b el Merafib or Hyena, which may have been based upon an unknown ancient Druidic game, which may have been based upon actual events at Stonehenge.

For the Stonehenge Game System
Players race around the board, the first to reach the council seizes power. They then unleash assassins to hunt down the other players. After all political rivals have been purged or exiled, the winner flaunts their status with a huge victory rally.

name: Wind of Ryukyu
description:
This is self-published expansion kit for 九州三国志 (Kyushu Sangokushi).
Ryukyu is old name of Okinawa islands, and "Wind of Ryukyu" is title of a Japanese historical fiction television series.

Covering battles in Okinawa island. Two scenarios are included in this kit.

Each players control one or more clans. The clan's combat units is organized to some troops.
The game repeats the game turn decided by the scenario. There are four action stages in each game turn. The number of stages where each troop can act is decided by commander's activation ability. In the action stage, each troop selects one action. The action that can be selected is a movement, field combat, siege, moral recovery, reorganization and replacement.

Victor is determined by the capture or defend of the castle given scenario.

Also need to play Standard rule (Late version), Reference card and some markers from 九州三国志 (Kyushu Sangokushi).

name: Чужие против пионеров
description:
From publisher:

Aliens vs Boy Scouts (Prepared? Always be prepared!) is a dynamic game for a large group of friends. Two teams are at a standoff: the aliens steal the boy scouts during the “night” phase of the game, and the boy scouts vote to eliminate one player during each of the “day” phases in an attempt to neutralize the aliens. The game develops diplomatic skills as well as analytical and deductive thinking. Based on the widely known game Mafia, Aliens vs. Boy Scouts offers a different plot together with expanded gaming abilities. The game has a number of advantages over its free print-n-play prototype:

- originally illustrated cards
- new gaming elements: “objects” and “events”
- a different environment: one without murder and criminal activity
- other useful materials: a referee chart and voting tokens
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Time No Time Junior
description:
Time No Time Junior is the children's version of Time No Time.

Game play: Start the timer, draw a card, perform an task (see below), pass the cards to the next player. However, the timer is random and if the task is interrupted by the alarm, then that player gets a penalty chip. The player with the most penalty chips at the end loses the game.

The Junior version of the game includes colored wooden blocks. Players just arrange these blocks in various shapes and color combinations according to the cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational
mechanics: Pattern Building, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Cheptel L'Extension
description:
Expansion for Cheptel.
Add 36 card to the base game: Additional color of cows and plenty of new dirty tricks to tempt Your opponents.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming

name: Battle Shots
description: The Drinking game version of Battleship! Secretly arrange your BattleShots™ ships on your shot board, placing them either horizontally or vertically. Each ship is composed of a designated number of shot glasses placed in a row. You should have three shot glasses for the battleship, two shot glasses for the destroyers, and one shot glass for your submarine.

name: River
description:
Requires: Standard 52 card poker deck with 2 jokers.

Theme
Grab your friends and go rafting down the river! Whirlpools will send you for a spin! Be the best rapid wrangler to win!

Gameplay
Setup
Shuffle the deck.

Each player draws 10 cards minus how many players there are. (ex. 4 players, draw 6 cards). The remaining cards are placed in the middle and are known as the Pile.

Turn Order
Turn Order
Start Oour Turn
a) Draw a card from the Pile…
b) Or, place 1 Jack, Queen, or King back into the bottom of the Pile to draw 2, 3, or 4 cards respectively.

Build a Raft
2) Place cards down on the table to start building rafts. You can swap cards in and out of your hand and onto rafts to improve the point totals of rafts.

End Your Turn
a) Play an Ace card…
b) Or, play a Joker card…
c) Or, End your turn.

What is a Raft
Building a Raft: Every raft that has 4 numerically consecutive cards and a face card on top is considered a complete raft. You may continue to improve complete rafts. Card suits do not matter.

Friendly Competition
Playing an Ace Card: This is called a Whirlpool. Say "Whirlpool", show the players your Ace, and put the ace into the deck. Every player places their hand into the deck. Shuffle the deck and draw the same number of cards you had before the Whirlpool (ex. if you put 6 cards into the deck because of the Whirlpool, draw 6 new cards).

Playing a Joker Card: This is called "Let's go down the river". Say "Let's go down the river", show the players your Joker, and put the joker at the bottom of the deck. Each player takes all of their incomplete rafts and puts them back into the deck. Shuffle the deck. Each player gathers all of their complete rafts and puts them aside to now be counted as points. These rafts are no longer in play.

Progress
Ending the Round: The round ends when a player is unable to draw cards from the Pile. The player with the highest point total wins that round.

Calculating Points: Points are calculated by adding up the number cards into a total. Then, add the face value cards into the total. Jacks are worth 1, Queens are 3, and Kings are 5 additional points.

Goal
Have the highest point total at the end of 3 rounds.

name: KEEP ROCK!
description:
In KEEP ROCK! all of the players are cavemen sitting around trying to be the player who collects the most points by hanging onto the unbroken ROCK, or by sticking the other players with the broken ROCK. At the end when the draw pile is gone and no more cards can be played, the player with the most points wins.

CONTENTS: 10 “TAKE ROCK” cards, 10 “ME BREAK ROCK” cards, 10 “GIVE ROCK” cards, 8 “NO BREAK ROCK” cards, 14 “KEEP ROCK!” cards, 6 SCORE ROCK cards, 1 ROCK accessory.

GAME PLAY: Take the SCORE ROCK cards and the ROCK out of the deck. Choose a dealer and deal 5 cards to each player. Now place the SCORE ROCK cards back into the deck, spaced at random intervals. The deck (as draw-pile) goes in the middle of the table w/ a discard pile next to it. The dealer starts with the ROCK (unbroken side-up) and goes first. Players each maintain a 5-card hand during play. On his turn a player must play 1 ACTION card and draw 1 card if possible; OR, he must pick one of the other players with whom to trade 2 cards in blind random fashion, and then he must pass his turn. When an ACTION card is played, the player whom it is aimed at may play the appropriate REACTION card if he can, then draw 1 card if possible. When a SCORE ROCK card is revealed, points are scored if possible (described below). Then the SCORE ROCK card is discarded and play continues. All cards that are played go into the discard pile face-up. When a player’s turn is finished, the next player clockwise takes his turn, and so on.

SCORING: 1 – When a SCORE ROCK card is revealed and a player has the unbroken ROCK, if possible he gets two cards from the discard pile as points; if only one is left, then just one. If no cards are in the discard pile, none are scored. 2 – When a SCORE ROCK card is revealed and a player has the broken ROCK, each of the other players takes one card from the discard pile in clock-wise order relative to the player with the broken ROCK. If the discard pile runs out it’s just “tough cave luck.” If no cards are in the discard pile, no points are scored. 3 – If a player has the unbroken ROCK at the end (when the draw pile is empty and no more cards can be played), that player collects 5 cards from the discard pile as points. 4 – If a player has the broken ROCK at the end, each of the other players collects 1 card from the discard pile as points. Players each count the points (cards) in their own collection pile and the player with the most wins the game!

name: Leiki ja Laula
description:
From the publisher:
Do you like singing? What about the singing games? Random Sopanen (artist) - Play and Sing is a fun children's game in which you qualify Satu Sopanen colorful and joyous songs of the world. Do you recognize the right words of the song? Do you know how to perform fun tasks properly? In this game, the main issue is having fun with music! Fairy-tale songs from Sopanen has characters to act a like and there are different music programs. Sing and act with Random children's favorite performers and act out the musical instruments in air. Includes CD's, with 18 pieces of previously unreleased songs, and Satu Sopaselta Tuttiorkesterilta.
Game idea is to collect the full piano (made from puzzle pieces, 6 of them). Each player in his/her turn takes a card (from 4 different categories) and acts accordingly. You either have to act the singer (moving mouth to the words), make instruments in the air, sing along with the music making the sound of the animal you drew with the card or be part of the duet. You are scored by other players, basically if they are happy with the performance and collect a piece. If not happy, you may take another card and try again. If still not happy, you pass and wait for the next turn.
Game is over when piano is completed.

name: Mission Earth
description:
"Join the Earth Heroes on a quest to save the planet!"

It is time for kids to take charge and rescue Earth, which has been ruined by adults. The players are time travelling heroes who must make their way back to Earth from 2259AD and save it from destruction.

The game includes a Team Play option where co-operation is essential, instead of playing as individuals. Game play consists of moving by die roll and following the instructions on the square reached: this could be answering a question from a card, taking a chance card or doing an action card.

There is no waste in the game - the box becomes the board, all the components are made from recycled materials and there is no plastic.

Produced by a team of high school students as part of Young Enterprise.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Parsec Expansion Kit 2: Nebulas and Nanotechs
description:
Blast off with Sean Young's latest in the PARSEC universe, with the Parsec Expansion Kit #2: Nebulas and Nanotechs. There are new hexes, including colorful Nebulas, deadly Pulsars, and Supernovae that trigger a special “Non-Planet” scoring round, bringing research tokens and credits into play even faster. Also, there rumors abound of mysterious derelict spaceships from a long forgotten alien race that allow you to get both research and credits from exploring them..

Along with new hexes is a new Nanotech! There’s the Asynchronous Data Converter which allows you change unused AP for a turn into Credits on a 1:1 basis. Autonomous Robots allow your placed Robots to move about the board by themselves without your Ship! The Stellar Cartographer lets you draw two Space Tiles (instead of one) at beginning of your Turn. The Really, Really Big Bomb or TRRBB as it is lovingly called by many, has a dual function. It can be used to destroy Monsters, but the other, more useful evil use of the TRRBB is to eradicate relocate all of the robots on a planet.

Another exciting new feature is the addition of Faction Cards. These Factions allows players a special ability both during and after the game. Each card shows the faction’s name, the “Game Bonus” which is given during the playing of the game, and a “Final Scoring Round Bonus”, which gives a bonus during the last Scoring Round. Will you be part of the The Church of Cosmic Enlightenment, Society for Scientific Advancement, or the Hot Rods of the Gods Starship Mods? There are 8 cards, so the mix of Factions in a game will always be different!

There are plenty of new possibilities in Parsec expansion kit 2: Nebulas and Nanotechs!

Note: This Expansion Kit is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of PARSEC to use it. You may also play PARSEC with this expansion kit as well as PARSEC expansion kit 1: Moons and Monsters.

Game Data:

Complexity: 2 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 3 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each player commands a ship full of robots exploring the space around their declining homeworld

Game Components:

• One Expansion #2 Rulesheet
• 6 additional Space Hex Tiles
• 8 Faction cards
• 20 Nanotech cards
• 6 double-sided 3/4" Score counters
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Champion of the Great Cat-Race
description:
A game to learn about the needs, thoughts and feelings of your cat!
Whether it's a cat Chartreux, Siamese or a domestic cat, with this new table game made ​​by Vitakraft, our dear friends from the "velvet paws" can demonstrate all their skills! Jump to obstacles of small and large distances, assignments, speed and a bit of luck, which never hurts.

Do not play with your pet, play as if you were the animal!
The conduct of the game Champion of the Great Cat-Race is totally based on the point of view of the cat. The whole family can participate in the competition and learn, playing the role of Carthusian Siamese cat or domestic cat, to identify the needs of "domestic tigers" to keep them healthy and in shape. The roll of the dice and action cards decide the fate: If your cat is well located, will earn positions and reach the finish line first, but if not it will recede. After four laps run successfully the race director calculates the points of his playmates and delivery to the lucky winner a well-deserved trophy card.

Editions are also available featuring dogs and rabbits instead of cats. The larger editions of the game are for 2-7 players, while the pocket editions are for 2-4 players.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

description: Monopoly set in Euskirchen in Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Bamberg
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Bamberg, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

description:

name: Défifoo Vert
description:
The game is a sort of fusion between hold'em and scrabble. In each round, players must form the longest words possible by combining the cards in their hand and those on the table. Card system "challenges" imposes additional conditions on each spin: requirement to use a letter, the fastest wins, the longest word wins the cards etc.

If the deck is exhausted, the game ends when a player has got rid of all your cards, or that nobody can play anymore.

The scoring:
• Each card is worth 1 point earned.
• The one who got rid of all your cards double their points.
• The other players take off their total as many points as cards remaining in their hand. The player with the most points is declared the "winner!"

name: Safari flash
description:
The goal is to photograph wildlife in safari earning 250 points.

In his turn player may play the cards with animals to photograph them, attack the opponents playing the cards with floods, swarm of mosquitoes etc. or defence against attacks by playing cards like canoe, a mosquito net etc.

Player who scores 250 points first is the winner.

name: The Gate: A Game of Myth and Magic
description:
The Gate is a role-playing board game that incorporates a wide range of natural, mythological, and symbolic elements. The game board has a unique, abstract style: images of keys, suns, and moons are set alongside pictures of dragons and other fantastical monsters.

The Gate is essentially a race to the center of the board. Players compete with each other as they advance through three levels of spaces arranged in concentric rings. The first player to the Gate wins. At the start of the game, each player chooses an identity from five different player types: Creature, Dwarf, Elf, Sorcerer, and Warrior. Players roll dice and play cards as they move clockwise around the board. In order to advance to a higher level, one must circle the level, acquire a key card, and defeat a monster. Throughout the game, players encounter a variety of enemies and use fighting dice and weapon cards to combat them. Players also battle each other using dice and cards. The advanced game employs additional cards as well as special fighting and moving dice.

The game box includes both the beginner and advanced versions. It contains one 28" x 24" game board, 333 cards (beginner and advanced decks), 8 metal pieces, 10 custom dice (beginner and advanced), 82 glass pebbles (used as currency), several rule cards, and a "scroll" card with the story of The Gate.

name: Krump
description:
Krump is an abstract strategy game for two players that is played on a 6x6 board. Each player starts with twelve units placed on the back two rows. The goal is to capture eight of the opponent's units. One player is black and the other is red.

Units are moved with a combination of movement cards and movement pyramids. Players choose movement cards each round and then place movement pyramids on the cards. A card can have any number of pyramids placed on it, but the pip count of the pyramids can't exceed the number on the card.

Players take turns during each round placing movement pyramids and moving units. When a pyramid is placed on a card, any one unit or stack that contains a unit of that size is able to move. Up to two units can be in a stack at one time, but a stack can not be broken once it is formed. Each unit and unit stack type moves differently, for a total of six different movement patterns.

Movement options early in the game are limited. As more enemy units are captured, however, players gain access to additional movement cards and can use the captured enemy units as movement pyramids.

name: Le Volapük
description:
Each player has a single game board which includes an area for letters in use, an area for the formation of a sentence and an area of ​​points account.
The game features consonants, vowels and Jokers replacing any letter of the alphabet.
At the start of each handle 6 letters are drawn at random: three consonants and three vowels, each letter has a point value (3 to 8) also corresponding to the number of copies used during the game.
Wildcards are 6 in number per player and have no point value.

Each player attempts to write a sentence with the highest number of points with the letters available. Once a sentence exceeds 150 points, the player can if they wish to stop the game. If the sentence is considered correct, the player scores points over its 100 bonus points if they used one or more wildcards, and 300 points if no wildcards have been used (and 500 bonus points if the value of sentence exceeds 199 points even with wildcard!).
Opponents mark only the value of their sentence. Of course an incorrect sentence does not relate points.

Then new round begins with new letters by drawing new letters.

The winner is the player who scores the first 1000 points.
Note: a sentence written without wildcard totaling 199 points and is called Super Volapük and allows the player to win the tournament immediately.

name: Color Claim
description:
Color Claim is a two player game played on a 5x6 board using Looney Pyramids. At the start of the game, two multicolored stashes are placed on the board, one pyramid per space. Players then alternate turns moving pyramids or stacks of pyramids.

No colors are owned by the players at the start of the game. Whenever a player moves onto single pyramid, that player can choose to capture the pyramid instead of stacking on it. When a pyramid is captured, any other captured pyramid belonging to that player is removed from the game. The player now owns the captured color and will score points for that color at the end of the game.

Players continue to move pyramids and stacks until no more moves are possible. Scores are then calculated, with stacks scoring points according to the number of pyramids they contain and the size of the pyramid on top. The player who owns the highest scoring color wins.

name: Monopoly: Ravensburg
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Ravensburg, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Rheinland-Pfalz
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Rheinland-Pfalz , in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Sylt
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.
