Tutatis is a fantasy gaelic football game produced by Greebo Miniatures, an italian editor already known for its high quality fantasy miniatures. The game is set in the fantasy world of Triskearth, a brand new world utterly created by the designers of the game. Its history and geography, as well as the background for every race, are described in the first 150 pages of the rulebook. The remaining twenty pages describe the gaming rules, bringing to life a fast & furios game of tactic and bashing!

The game is played on a 11 x 16 squares field, each team can field on the pitch seven payers. Every team (are planned to be released nearly thirty teams) has its own rooster of players, each one with its stats (movement, strength, agility, constitution, ball play), skills and costs, including three different captains. The game time is divided in two halves each one made up of six turns for each player. Turns are played alternatively by each player, completing the action of a single player before passing to the next one. The aim of the game is to score more points (goals or kicks over the crossbar) than the opponent, and you can achieve this with a passing/dodging style or with a more brutal one. Someone could recognize a gameplay similar to other games concerning sports, but this is not a great flaw since Tutatis has it's peculiar flavor thanks to the rules of gaelic football (ie. not forward passage, soloing rule exc.) and to the characterization of each team.

Greebo miniatures has produced a prerelease box of the game (with rules still in beta) at the 2011 Lucca Comics & Games convention, and it was a sold out. That box contained a cardboard field, Italian rulebook, two Greebo's d6, a ball and two teams in 15mm (orcs and dwarves). Since then on Greebo's website have been published in English and in Italian the definitive set of rules and the roosters for the new teams, all available as free downloads. At the moment have been released three kinds of fields (irond peak, thornwell and standard), the miniatures of some mercenaries and nine teams: orcs, dwarves, evil puppets, necros, poffy and five different teams of thornwell (frogs, lizards, turtles, snakes and a mixed team). Greebo's team is working on the championship rules expected to be released as open beta in mid autumn 2012, as well as on a new edition of the game box. It's also on the desk the translation of the rules in french and spanish.

name: Pusteblumen
description:
Objective: gather most victory points by racing on & cleaning a meadow
- acting/moving by turn -
each player draws slides forming a meadow; according the number of blowballs your meeple may move forward - the further the higher the score; but if there isn't space enough to move players create environmental damage, too.
During the second phase players move back, cleaning up the waste they've generated. Due to mechanism removing all the trash they made (collecting garbage cards) you often have to choose an indirect way or even cooperate.

name: The Compleat Fondler: Eighteen Scenarios for Sharp Practice
description:
This superb Sharp Practice scenario supplement follows the career of Richard Fondler from his time as an enlisted man in India in 1799 through to Waterloo where he is a Lieutenant Colonel. In between he has an exciting and illustrious career in the Peninsula with the 95th Rifles and the Light Company of the West Sussex Regiment. Here we present eighteen scenarios, each with an introductory story, briefings for both sides and umpire's notes with a full colour map. The games are designed for between 30 and 100 or so figures per side, and are rip-roaring exciting games, packed with derring-do, larger than life characters and, best of all, real gaming challenges and fun. The scenarios included are as follows.

Fondler's Battle, Fondler's Enemy, Fondler's Rifles, Fondler's Allies, Fondler's Captain, Fondler's Pirate, Fondler's Colonel, Fondler's Gold, Fondler's Trap, Fondler's Escape, Fondler's Surprise, Fondler's Honour, Fondler's Siege, Fondler's Lady, Fondler's Triumph, Fondler's Breech, Fondler's Duke, and Fondler's Waterloo. All draw on the rich heritage of literary heroes and villains.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Flingin' Frogs
description:
From the publisher:

Fling your frogs onto the Lily Pad levels to score points. But, beware…someone else’s flung frog may push yours off and leave you scoreless! Challenge friends to a game, or play by yourself to top your best scores. The Lily Pad also acts as a convenient storage and travel case.

Contents: Lily Pad with 5 Levels, 12 Frogs (3 of Each Color), Rules. The lily pad also doubles as a convenient storage case.

name: Spurtle Turtle
description:
Spurtle Turtle is one of the games in Patch Products 'Big Little Games' range.

From the publisher:
Game tokens have stickers on with pictures of different sea creatures. Mix the tokens and place 10 in each side of the turtle. Press the turtle’s back to spurt out tokens, and then try to find matching sets! The colorful tokens feature fun sea creatures that kids will love. The winner is the player who finds the most matches.

A twist would be to play the game by adding a timed play option. See which player can find the most matches in the shortest amount of time.

Contents: Turtle Double-Token Shooter, 20 Tokens, Rules. The turtle is also a convenient storage case.

name: Cumulo
description:
There are 24 wooden tokens showing different lines/symbols.
This cards are placed on the table face up so everyone can see and reach all the tokens.
A pile of 24 task tokens with the same lines/symbols is prepared face down.
By turn, players draw a task token without showing it to other players.
Then thy use a chain to draw the line/symbol.
The other players have to find the matching wooden token.
The first player to get the right token scores one point (gets the token).
After the pile is exhausted, the game ends. The winner is the player who got the most tokens.

name: Ultimate Chibi Defenders: Wedding Edition
description:
The fearsome dragon in charge of the Wedding Hoard has rallied the (uninvited) guests to its cause of getting the first bite of cake! The Wedding party must join forces to fight off this threat before the entire day is ruined by the dessert motivated forces of evil! Ultimate Chibi Defenders: Wedding Edition is a lite cooperative game of tactical cake defense.

On their turn players move and use an action (attack or special ability) to slow or defeat the advancing and growing hoard of wedding crashers. Once all players have acted, crashers advance - attacking any heroes in their path - and attempt to eat the wedding cake. The players win if the Dragon is defeated before the cake is completely eaten. The Wedding Crashers win if the cake is devoured.

The game was distributed as a wedding favour at the designer's wedding reception. It is now available for free as a print and play game!

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Borgo Mutants
description:
Form a gang and fight for dominance over the city. Seize the most valuable districts, search the ruins to gather the precious gambles, make use of your units' special abilities, which are straight from Neuroshima RPG.

Neuroshima Tactics is a miniature wargame in which the players - using 28mm figures - clash among the ruins of the Goddam United States. Each player commands a force comprising of 5 to 12 models in an attempt to achieve certain goals in the allotted amount of time. The game is set in the world of Neuroshima.

Borgo Mutants are children of doom. Created by Moloch, led by their leader they were form into independent power. This set contains 5 miniatures, tokens, cards and terrain elements.

name: Ratz Fatz auf den Pferdehof
description:
This installment in the "Ratz-Fatz" series revolves around the horse farm. Like the other Ratz Fatz games, this is a small collection of several educational games for children (from ages 3-12). Game play revolves about recognizing the different gaits, equipment like saddle, bridle and reins, and different types of horse food on the cards and making connections between them as fast as possible, another version of the game is a fairly straightforward memory game; other game ideas include storytelling elements, riddles, poems and rhymes.

Components: 3 wooden horses, 1 wooden donkey, 12 cards, 1 colour die, rules
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Lince Card Game
description:
A Card Game that brings competition that requires great speed and reflexes to win. The pictures cards are over the table and the players must be quick to find the same object in your hand. The quickest take the card, whoever take most cards is the winner.

There are two types of cards, objects cards and pictures cards and there are two play modes:
1- Play with all pictures cards face up. Reveal an object card. All players must collect all pictures cards that have the object on it, keeping that picture card. The player with most picture cards wins at the end.
2- Distribute evenly all picture cards among the players. Reveal an object card. The first player to show a picture card with a matching object win the object card. The player with most object cards wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Gigantik Game
description:
Calling all Power Rangers! Lord Zedd has launched his assault. Its up to you to protect the planet by capturing Goldar, Squatt, Baboo, King Sphinx and the Putty Patrol.

Players play as their favorite Mighty Morphin Power Rangers on a gigantic plastic floor mat, as they spin the spinner and move around the board following the actions on the spaces where they land to protect the planet from evil Lord Zedd and his Evil Space Aliens!

Objective of the Game:
Be the first Power Ranger to collect four different bad guy disks and at least two Putty Patrol warriors to win the game!
categories: Children's Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Banditos: Hippies and an Armored Truck
description:
Go on a joyride through the 1980s. Your destination? Robbing the Banco de Mexico!

Now there are even more ways to make your millions with Banditos: Hippies and an Armored Truck, a 30-card expansion for Banditos that introduces four new characters, new cards for the action card deck, and inside information for the armored truck.

name: Clacto 6
description:
Collection of 6 boardgames based on the use of magnetic marbles (clickets) as game pieces.

The box contains six games. Each of the games is a combination of the nature of the magnetic marbles (e.g. magnetism) and strategic or random placement of the marbles on the board.

The object is to place or remove those magnetic marbles without moving or disturbing the marbles still occupying holes on the gamebord.

CLACTO HARLEQUIN is a game of dice, not unlike the traditional game, but combined with the magnetic force of the 'clickets' the game gets a somewhat wider perspective. Apart from the placement of the clickets of the board as the throw of the dice indicates, the players have tot take the magnetism in account.

The same principle goes for CLACTO DICE.

CLACTO FISH is about removing clickets from the gameboard without disturbing the other clickets.

CLACTO 4 AND 4, CLACTO TACTIC and CLACTO SNAKES all have the placement of clickets on the board as subject, without moving or disturbing the clickets allready placed.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement

name: Le Retour de Crochet
description:
The object of the game depends of the hero played by the child:
Peter Pan: save as many children or remove hook
Hook: capture a maximum number of children or remove Peter Pan

Each player will move one checker according to the illustration of the card he plays.
Depending on the clan he represents, he will try to bring this character of his hero or away from each other. It must reflect the specific character displacement (2, 4 or 8 possible directions, the right to capture another character or not).

To retrieve a child captured, only the Duel is possible only once per player per game. We then use all the cards of two players to do battle. When all cards have been played, the one possessing the highest number wins the Duel and the child may choose to switch sides.

The game ends when one of the following events:

Peter Pan is captured
Hook is captured
All the lost children are out of the game (as they were captured or saved)

name: Fipsen
description:
Trick-taking game for mostly 4 players. It is played in Prisdorf, Germany area. Using 25 cards (A,10,K,Q,J,9,8,7 from non-Diamonds and 7 of Diamond), the game is played like an easy version of Skat.

For 4-player game, players are dealt 5 cards. Among the remaining 5 cards, 3 of them are not used and 2 of them are placed face down in the middle of the table. Each player bids the number of tricks they can take with their choice of the trump suit. The game value is equal to these number of tricks called. Each of the following causes to double the game value: by not using the face-down cards (Hand game), by choosing a diamond as a trump (called "Ruten" - notice that there is only one diamond card in the deck), or by bidding 5 (called Durch).

There are also some special bids. Kieker is like null and he can use all 5 face-down cards to exchange his hand. Siebener Fips is the case to have all four 7s and an Ace.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: The Outpost – Recon
description:
Recon. Always at first line, get everywhere before others. Well coordinated, well trained and deadly.


This set contains 2 minis, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Big Week
description:
From the introduction
"This is a simulation game of US strategic bombing raids from England and Italy on 25 February 1944, the last day of the `Big Week' offensive. Two or three players or teams direct the actions of the opposing air forces as they seek to inflict more damage than they suffer in this attritional contest."

UB Bombers from England and Italy move steadly towards their German targets while the US fighters seek to keep then protected from German fighter attack. Simple machanics mean the game is easy to learn, but the differing ranges of the fighters and speed of the bombers mean planning ahead is required. Not knowing when the Germans may attack and cause the fighters to drop their fuel tanks, and so have to return home make this harder than it sounds.

name: Recette de Sorciére
description:
Children's card game that calls for bluffing to win. 44 cards provided: 6 of each Ingredient card, 6 Pepper cards, 6 Broomstick cards and 2 reminder cards of the order that must be followed when announcing Ingredients.

Each player gets a hand of cards and must play them all first to win. The ingedients are;
1. Citrouille (Pumpkin)
2. Crapauds (Frogs)
3. Asticots (Worms
4. Araignees (Spiders
5. Champignons (Mushrooms)

The game mechanic relies on the popular playing card game Cheat. The first player chooses a card and announces "Citrouille" (in a high voice the rules says!). If he does not have such a card, he must choose one anyway and announce it as if it was the correct card. If not challenged, he can discard the card on to the discard pile. If challenged and it is correct or incorrect, the offending player (either the player or the challenger) must draw extra cards as a penalty. Then it is the next player's turn and he must announce "Crapauds" and choose a card, and follow the same rules. The next player announces "Asticots", and so on.

Poivre cards and Balai cards add to the fun. A Poivre (Pepper) card played means that your turn passes to the next player. And if a Balai (Broom) card is played and challenged, the challenger tales all the cards in the discard pile.

The first player to get rid of all their cards, wins.

name: Kunterbunte Lachparade
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target zone
- acting by turns -
active player rolls the die: ending upon a 'Hully-Gully' space =>
draw a card & perform requested activity; successful => roll the die (exception: 'grey' space: next player's turn);
ending upon a 'grips' space => answer question correctly:
successful? roll again.. wrong? next player's turn.
Last 6 spaces are 'do or die' ones, no die is used;
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Racing, Trivia

name: Elemental Clash: Unicum
description:
The Tribal Wars are over and the land is now divided into many kingdoms, reigned by iconic, mighty Lords, Kings and Queens who have emerged from the realm of myth and lore. Deep inside of the cold, snowy Northern Mountains, Isengrimm resides in his Golden Halls to rule over the Dwarfs, who delve deep into the rock to fill their lord's treasuries with gold, silver and precious gems. In Darkwood Forest, Xilvox reigns supreme over his countless Alben minions. Known as the King of the Clouds, Goldfeather is the lord of all Griffins and ruler of the Skies. On the southern islands Lord Zephiros, the Master-Mage, has his domain and guards many arcane secrets which are the key to his enormous magical powers.

The fourth expansion to Elemental Clash – Unicum – brings you 72 exciting, all-new cards. Command mighty "Unique" Creatures or cast powerful "Unique" Spells (cards which are so powerful your Spellbook can only have one copy of them). Also, a new ability – Immunity – is introduced and four new, exciting races make their debut: Albs, Griffins, Fish and Dwarfs.

The aim of the game is to reduce the cards in your opponent’s card-deck (or Spellbook) to zero by using the Spells and Creatures in your Spellbook. Players take turns that always follow the same structure. For each point of damage a Player receives through Creatures or Spells, he or she puts the top card of his or her deck on his or her Discard Pile (or Archive). If a player unable to draw a card, he or she loses immediately.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Pinza De Ropa
description:
UNRELEASED GAME



This game is scheduled to be released at Spiel 2013




Note that all details for this game are preliminary.

In an apartment building, the tenants are having a laundry day. Their task is simple: to hang clothes on the balconies. But, the air and shaky hands might cause some of the clothespins, pinza de ropa in Spanish, to fall, or mysteriously end up on a higher floor of the building!

The players alternate turns during which they try to have as many clothespins as possible on their floor. Each player's floor is designated by a secret objective card (marked with a star).

During their turn players choose a floor on the board, roll the dice, and then may play cards to affect the outcome of the dice. Each number on the dice different from the player's floor means that a clothespin must go to another floor. A special objective card indicates which floor is best for that player's clothespins. The winner of the game is the one that gathers the most points, based on the special objective card and a player's played cards during the duration of the game.

The print & play version which will be available through this site and the publisher's page is the family version of the game. A future version of Pinza de Ropa will include a new advanced version, with more cards, strategies, and surprises that will make the game even better!

The only thing not provided in the print'n play version of the game are the 5 dice. You will need 5 6-sided dice to play. Also, if you wish, you may use real clothespins. We have provided a .pdf with a printable clothespin, but if you want to pimp out the game...
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: DRAW
description:
Playing DRAW may remind you of Charades, but with drawing on paper instead of acting out the answers. In DRAW, though, both teams' (or even all three teams') clue givers may be drawing at the same time as players strive to be the first to guess the correct answer. When the answer is not designated "All Play," one team simply tries to come up with the answer before the timer runs out, which is usually but not always possible thanks to the varying difficulty levels of the answers. No great drawing talent is required; instead, players gain an edge if they have a good imagination when guessing, empathy for their team mates, and/or a general ability to communicate in restricted circumstances.

DRAW is a Swedish Pictionary like game, but only featuring strange and rude words.

name: Peppa Pig: Jumping Pigs
description: Players try and jump the Peppa Pig playing counters into the muddy puddle on the table in the middle of the game box and the first player to do this is the winner of the round. You can play as many rounds as you like, because after all, Peppa loves nothing more than jumping in the biggest and muddiest puddle she can find!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dead End: An Adventure Strategy Game. With Zombies.
description:
Dead End is survival-horror strategy game which pits survivors against zombies in a city-scape scenario. The world has succumbed to a laboratory-engineered super virus, bringing humanity to the brink of extinction and reanimated those who were once dead. The few who remain alive spend their days seeking out fellow survivors to help improve their chances for survival. It is a constant struggle to find sufficient food, tools, and--relatively safe--shelter.

Your story begins with your vehicle having just broken down in the middle of Sanctuary City. You must now wander the streets looking for replacement parts to repair your vehicle. During your trek, you will encounter roadblocks, lootable buildings, and countless zombie hordes. As you progress, your team will be faced with game-changing choices: does your team stop to rest and recuperate, risking the chance of a zombie attack, or move on? Do you split off from your group to check out that side-street, or stick together to better your survival odds? Meanwhile, the zombie player's hordes lurk around every corner, to ensure no one gets out alive.

Using a simplified dice-rolling system, Dead End allows for in-depth strategy and variety without bogging down the game in rules and exceptions. This allows the game to be fun and exciting for players of all ages.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ: Side One
description:
Tactical combat game based on Japanese mecha animation series Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ. The game covers combat in and around space colonies.

Each unit represent one humanoid weapon called mobile suit (MS). Unit ability is written on separate data cards.

Each player control one or few MS and aims at the destruction of the opponent MS.

Players writes down the plan of the movement and the battle in the log. Then, that is disclose and resolve at simultaneous.

name: Mobile Suit Z Gundam: Sign of Z
description:
Tactical level wargame based on Japanese robotech animation series Mobile Suit Z Gundam. This game covering all battle field and weapons in story.

Each unit represent a mobile suit (giant robot). Unit ability is written on each unit.

The turn sequence is simple, repeat of movement and simultaneous attacking. Some special weapons covered by special rules, such as Mega Bazooka Launcher or Funnel.

Victory condition is stated for each scenario.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: V-Max: Blue Comet SPT Layzner
description:
Tactical land combat game based on Japanese robotech animation series "Blue Comet SPT Layzner". The second game for Layzner.

Each unit represent a SPT(Super Powered Tracer, robotech name in this universe). Unit ability is written on the data cards.

Each player control one or few SPT and aims at the destruction of the opponent SPT.

Players writes down the plan of the movement and the battle in the log. Then, that is disclose and resolve at simultaneous. Feature of this game is a rule of V-Max system, add a six to eight times faster and immune to ranged weapons.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Chez Guild
description:
UNRELEASED GAME



Note that all details for this game are preliminary. If you have information about this game, you are invited to edit this section or submit corrections.




Chez Guild blends the characters from the web series The Guild with the Chez Geek series of card games, with characters trying to collect slack while annoying their roommates and keeping them from achieving their goals.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: Guin Saga
description:
Two fantasy wargames in one box, based on Japanese heroic fantasy novel Guin saga. These games is covering the war between Parros and Mongauli.

Both games use standard hex and counter mechanism, so repeat of movement and combat.

Nospherus is small size operational level wargame based on story from book 1 to 5. This game covering for pursuit battles in Nospherus. Contains special rules for leaders, wasteland environment and Mongauli's colored legions. Winner determined by capture or escape of crown prince and princess of Parros.

"Parros" is medium size strategic level wargame based on story of book 1 to 16. This game covering entire war between Parros and Mongauli. Contains special rules for recruit, diplomacy, rebellion, capture and escape. Winner determined by collapse of either nation.

name: Bulrup: The Farmer's Almanac
description: This expansion to the Bulrup core game adds the effects of powerful Weather cards, as well as adds 4 new crops and 1 new Magical Creature. 2 Lodges are also added to the game, allowing the maximum number of players to go up to 8.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Farming

name: Monopoly: Burghausen
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Burghausen, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

description:

mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

description:

description: Monopoly set in Weilheim, Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Duel
description:
Duel is a combat game played with a standard deck of 52-cards including jokers, inspired by the game Magic: The Gathering. The goal of the game is to reduce the opponents life to zero.

Two players duel against each other using spells drawn from a common library. Face cards (including aces) are creatures, while number cards may be played as lands or spells.

Lands are used to pay the cost of summoning creatures and casting spells. Creatures may attack opposing creatures or the opposing player, which is the primary method of reducing life.

name: Monopoly: Emsland
description: Monopoly set to Emsland, a region in North-West Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Her Majesty's Rocket Corps
description:
The arm of the Empire is expanding and its next colony will be on the lunar surface. The only thing in the way of progress is the pesky natives. New rockets are being assembled and the call has gone out for brave leaders to captain these metal flying machines and annex the moon.

Players bid for parts, build their rockets, and then blast their way into space. They can battle lunar natives, found colonies, and construct a flying fortress. All the while they are competing against other players for prestige and the title of Grand Admiral of Her Majesty's Rocket Corps.

Her Majesty's Rocket Corps is a steampunk themed board game based on lunar conquest. Players acquire space ship parts from the auction, build their their rockets, combat the lunar natives, and start lunar colonies.

Join the Rocket Corps and see the solar system!

name: Monopoly: Passau
description: Monopoly set in Passau,a city in south-east-Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Sauerland
description: Monopoly set of the Sauerland, a German region. Due to good catering, winter sport region and short distance to the Netherlands menu cards are often written in Dutch, too (rare exception). All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: 1899 Hoffenheim
description:
Monopoly set of the soccer team TSG 1899 Hoffenheim, located at a village in southern Germany. Compared with other home bases of German teams like Hamburg, Munich... the size of the village is incredible small.
All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Winning Moves Germany, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Monopoly: Niederbayern
description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Niederbayern, a region in southern Germany.
remarks:
The city 'Straubing' (a pearl) belongs to Niederbayern and was busy - at that time - publishing its own city edition, a bit competitive to the region approach. The discussions around rose up in some (local) newspapers.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

description:
Monopoly set of Herne, a German city (very close to Essen) with quite a lot enthusiastic board gamers.
All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: 1. FC Köln
description:
Monopoly set of 1. FC Köln, a German soccer team.
Important events, people, locations out of the history with special meeples.
All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Euromind
description:
The goal is to reach the end of the path (the European Parliament) by being stripped of its national currency and providing three flags won during the game.

In turn, the player chooses to move forwards or backwards
on the game board.
Moving forward player must pay euros, moving backwards player may earn euros from bank.
Reaching the space "Chance", player draws a card and follows the instructions. On "Change", the player exchange its currency against the Euro. On "Flags", the player must answer 2 or 3 questions (depending on age) to win the banner.

The first player who reach the Euro Parlament with three flags is the winner.

name: Monopoly: Tübingen
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Tübingen, a South-German city - university with important history.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Skirmish: Modern Card Warfare
description:
In SKIRMISH: Modern Card Warfare the goal is simply to bust through your opponents defenses and capture their flag. To accomplish this, you will SKIRMISH against your opponent constantly on the field of battle using the cards that you’ve drawn into your hand.

When you first look at SKIRMISH the condition for victory is easy: just make sure that your SKIRMISHER on the field of battle has a higher rating than your opponent’s SKIRMISHER. But things would be just too easy if that was all there is to it…

You've got to watch out for bombs, spies and snipers, all the while using your cards strategically for field reviews, reinforcements and the ever-popular bomb and spy busting.

The strategy is as deep as you make it. Should you open with a Bomb to get a head start at breaking your opponent’s defenses? Do you bait their largest rated cards out into the field with one of your lower rated cards? Do you take the gamble of sending a Sniper out looking for their top rated cards? Do you expect a bomb to be coming and send out a Bomb Buster?

Whatever you do there is no guarantee of victory as you have to learn to read your opponent and out bluff him. The tides can quickly turn from that of sure victory to nail biting defeat and visa versa.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game, Wargame

name: Italy (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
Another fanmade Italy map for Ticket to Ride.

On a relief-like view of Italy, each city is indicated by a little flag of the country it is located in.
The game works with 3-4 players but players use only 40 instead of the usual 45 waggons. It has been designed in a way that highly frequented cities (like Rome, Florence and Naples) are not used very often in the destination tickets. Therefore it is very probable that you have to go past through these cities but it's not very likely that players will score a huge amount of points directly from that.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Memory Challenge: Book Lovers Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Challange your memory with a literary twist! 96 literary cards feature famous authors, classic literature book covers and literary quotes. Glossary cards add strategy and interaction. Profession cards allow players to choose a literary role and earn bonus points.

name: Hold
description: A dexterity game where players take turns drawing one card from the pile. The card may either specify where to put it, eg. under your arm, or between head and shoulder, or it may specify what to do, eg. jump or turn around. The winner is the player who can continue to draw cards for the longest time without dropping any.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Monopoly: Krefeld
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Krefeld, a city in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Wuppertal
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Wuppertal, in city in Germany, well known by its suspension railroad.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Franken
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Franken (Franconia), a southern region in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Die turbulente Zeitreise
description:
In Die turbulente Zeitreise, the brilliant scientist Dr. Tempora has created a time machine, and the players are now going to go exploring the world's history.

In the first phase of the game, players are presented with board segments from different eras and they must determine in which order those segments should be organized to match history. In the second phase, players answer questions related to different eras of time, and in the third phase they must recall figures and items that they've experienced in the first two phases. Players score points each time they take a correct action, and whoever scores the most points wins.

name: Cirque du Monstre
description:
In a world filled with constantly fighting dragons, faeries, and other such creatures, smiles are rarely seen on the faces of everyday people – and this is where you, a circus owner, come in. You're determined to create the best of all circuses so that people may smile once again.

Cirque du Monstre is a deck-building game in which players use money to add monsters to their circus deck, then use the monsters to win fabled circus prizes. These prizes – effectively, the victory points – cannot be purchased directly, so you'll need to put on a good show in order to claim them.

Once the game ends, the player with the most prizes wins.

name: Paper Route
description:
Paper Route is an analog re-creation of classic video game action. You will be scrambling to press buttons to complete combinations, only you will be using cards instead of a video game controller. Your goal is to deliver papers, avoid danger, and vandalize houses better, and faster than your opponent.

Paper Route is a turn-less "real-time" game. At the start of a round five houses are paired with five obstacles. Together, they form a sequence of buttons that players must play in order to score their points. Once both players agree, the round begins and the players flip cards, one at a time, from the top of their deck and play them on a house. The faster you can play, the better... but be careful! If you mess up, you lose a life and if you lose all your lives, your opponent wins!

Paper Route uses the Cardboard Arcade game system. Cardboard Arcade consists of a deck of cards that represents a classic arcade controller. The Controller Decks are generic and allow for the re-creation of many different arcade classics with a common component.

Paper Route and Cardboard Arcade have been released under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution-Non-Commercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported license, http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/. You are free to re-theme, modify, build-upon, and release your own games as long as you don't sell them without asking first. If you want to distribute your work in a commercial capacity, please don't hesitate to ask!
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Real-time, Video Game Theme
publishers: (Web published), Chevee Dodd, LLC, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Pincers
description:
Pincers is an abstract game for two players played on a 5x5 grid. Players each start with five crab pawns, one of which has a starfish printed on the bottom of it and another which has a pearl.

Players take turns moving one of crab at a time. If a crab is surrounded on both sides by the opponent's crabs, that crab is pinched and flipped over. If the flipped crab bears the pearl, the pinching player wins; if it has the starfish, the pinching player loses; and if the underside is blank, the crab is removed from the board and play continues.

Pincers includes a variant in which the pearl and starfish are visible.
publishers: Japon Brand, Nekomado, THE PILOT INK COMPANY, LIMITED

name: The Story of Struggle Chaos in Gensokyo
description:
User summary

A deduction-style party game for 3–8 players based on characters and situations from Shrine Maiden fame. Based on Shadow Hunters
Players are all dealt characters with different set goals, and try to accomplish these goals during the game. Part of the idea is not to have your identity revealed, but throughout the games, depending on how players move, they may get clues as to who you are. Getting revealed is dangerous, as people will be able to attack you, but even if you're defeated, if your team wins, you win.

On september 1st 2012, Yasutaka Ikeda, designer of Shadow Hunters accused Ayu-ya for simply copying his game. Ayu-ya agreed and the game was withdrawn two days later.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Party Game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Der Kleine Prinz: Planet der Astronomie
description:
A "The Little Prince"-themed children's game about matching and remembering shapes and colours.

Background story: Antoine, the astronomer, has been talked into stealing the stars of the universe for his planetarium by the evil snake. But the stars are essential for all the inhabitants of the planets. Without their light, plants, animals and people cannot live. Help the Little Prince convince Antoine to set the stars free. Accompany the Prince and his friend, the fox, when they return the stars to their place in the universe.

Setup: The board is placed at the middle of the table. Airplane and die are set aside. The 6 snake tiles are placed on the planet at the center of the board. The outline star tiles are shuffled and placed face up all over the room. The star tiles with the filled-in stars are shuffled and distributed evenly among the players, face down. Each player selects a player character on the board and places the stack of face-down star tiles in front of themselves.

Gameplay: The start player takes the airplane. He/she then looks at the top tile of their star tiles stack. They try to remember its colour and shape. The active player then says "start" and moves around the room, looking for the matching outline star tile. When they find it, they put it into a slit on the plane and fly back to the Planet of Astronomy. They then put the matching pair of tiles in front of them, turn over the second tile from their stack and try again to find the matching tile.
As soon as the active player has embarked on his/her flight, the player to his/her left rolls the die until the snake symbol appears. He/she then takes a snake tile from the board and passes on the die to the next player. The other players continue rolling the die until the last snake tile has been taken from the board. This means that the active player's flight phase is over and it's the next player's turn.

The game ends when a player has collected his/her last pair of tiles. The current round is continued until each player has had an equal number of turns. All players that only have complete pairs of tiles after this round win the game.

name: Trade Raiders
description:
Operational level wargame for the battle of the Atlantic between 1939 to 1942. Standard game is covering commerce raiding by the capital ships and Armed Merchant Cruisers. U-boat and aircraft can add by using optional rules.

Players control either Kriegsmarine(German Navy) or Allied Navy.
The main part of the game is search and pursuit of opponent ships with dual maps and secret units deployment.

The purpose of German player is sinking of Allied convoy.
The purpose of Allied player is escort of convoy, and also sinking of the German warships.

name: ZombieZone
description:
The year 2020. It's been 5 years since the zombie uprising that we now refer to as "Zombie Summer". You could say that we've since adapted to living with the undead… All you need to do is stay indoors, keep your weapons close, and don't trust anyone or anything. But as humans, we are a greedy species, and we found a way to make money off of the zombies. And that is where the ZombieZone comes in.

ZombieZone is a battle arena where 10 humans and 10 zombies will fight to the death… on live television. From the safety of our homes, we watch the destruction unfold, placing bets on or against mankind. And some of us will even risk our own lives for a chance at fame and fortune. Will the money hungry-humans, armed with a shotgun and a brain make it out alive? Or will the flesh-hungry Zombies multiply and take them over?

So many questions, so little time. The battle is about to begin. Enter the ZombieZone!


ZombieZone is a head to head strategic battle for survival of humans vs. zombies. 2 players each use double-sided disc tokens and dice to maneuver around a gridded parking lot game board. Humans are armed with a shotgun for ultimate zombie destruction, and zombies spread quickly by taking over the humans (flipping the token over to reveal a zombie on the other side). The last one standing wins.

This edition has a larger board, more units, bombs, and a second win condition.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Button Shy, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: 4 cestovatelské hry
description:
Four games for preschoolers and young schoolchildren, in which in entertaining way acquire basic geographic knowledge. The basic principle of these games is based on a random roll of the dice, but the coin chips bring into play the possibility of strategize and making tough decisions.

Game of discovery: Discover famous places across all continents, battling pirates and rob them of their treasures.

Game crisscross: Visit a given number of major european cities. Entertainment culminates at a time when most cities are occupied and the player must decide to which part of Europe they will go.

Silk Road: Ancient trade route across Asia to China and Indi. Buy a boat to sail to the finish. The path is full of pitfalls or bonuses.

Four Climbing: Simple puzzle game for two players, based on the principle of gomoku.

---
Hry pro předškoláky a malé školáky, při kterých zábavnou cestou získají základní zeměpisné znalosti. Při jejich hraní vzniká prostor pro vytváření vlastních příběhů a vzájemnému špičkování. Základní princip her je založen na náhodném hodu kostkou, ale mincové žetony přinášejí do hry možnost taktizovat a rozhodovat se.

Při Objevitelské hře budete objevovat známá místa všech kontinentů, získávat tolary, bojovat s piráty a obírat je o jejich poklady.

Ve hře Evropou křížem krážem musíte navštívit daný počet hlavních měst. Zábava graduje v momentě, kdy je většina měst obsazena a hráč se musí rozhodnout, do které části Evropy se vydá pro své poslední město.

Hedvábná stezka nás provede starobylou obchodní cestou přes celou Asii až do Číny a Indie, kde si za získané peníze hráči koupí loď, se kterou plují do cíle. Cesta je plná bonusů a nástrah, kde mnohé těžkosti můžou být i výhodou.

Horolezecká čtyřka je jednoduchá logická hra pro dva hráče, vycházející z principu piškvorek.

Stolní hry pro děti:
Rozměr rozložené knihy je 98 x 34 cm.
Rozměr složené knihy je 27 x 34 cm.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Pirates, Puzzle, Travel, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Network and Route Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Was ist da los?
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The tomcat Fridolin is very curious, so he looks at all the people on the playground and in the market very carefully. Filled with fascination, Fridlin observes the faces of both children and adults, and he sees that they show very different feelings.

In Was ist da los?, children travel with the tomcat Fridolin into the world of feelings. During the game you'll look at the depicted children and explain the many different behaviors, emotions, and situations they're experiencing.

name: Ballista
description:
The ballista was an ancient Greek and Roman missile weapon, which launched a large projectile at a distant target.

Introduction

Ballista is an area enclosure, area control abstract game for 2 players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces of a 10x10 board. The board is divided by two red intersecting lines creating four 5 x 5 quadrants. You will also need a set of reversi pieces. The game starts out with 2 black and 2 white reversi pieces placed on the four marked squares on the board.

Play

Players decide who goes first then play alternates.

On each turn players must take two actions:

1)Move one of your color reversi pieces “ballista” exactly like a queen in Chess, orthogonally or diagonally onto any empty space as long as the piece stays within the quadrant where the move initiated from.

2)Fire a “projectile” reversi piece in your color away in a straight line orthogonally or diagonally from the piece just moved, then placing the new reversi piece in your color onto any empty space within one of the other three remaining quadrants.

Players also have the option on their turn to capture an enemy stone. Captures in Ballista are custodian, i.e., an enemy stone is captured when sandwiched between two friendly stones (orthogonal or diagonal). Captured enemy pieces are not removed from the board but flipped over to your color.

Note: A ballista or fired projectile reversi piece may not jump over a friend or enemy piece, also any friendly pieces that were projectiles may now become a ballista.

The game ends when a player has no valid move.

name: Život v Česku
description:
In Život v Česku ("Life in the Czech Republic"), players start with a bit of free time, some volunteer work, and experience in primary school. During the course of the game, they can study at different schools, try a range of jobs, buy a house, start a family, and (alas) suffer from negative phenomena, such as an arrest.

Život v Česku, which is tailored to the Bohemian Czech mentality and environment, features a new unique gaming system that gives players a lot of latitude in what's possible within the game.

name: Benjamin Blümchen: Sicher zur Schule
description:
A roll-and-move game that aims at teaching children how to safely get to school (traffic rules).

The game consists of a game board, 4 player pieces, 16 cards, 60 plastic chips, a number die and a colour die. The board shows a path to school. The aim of the game is decided by the players - either being first to reach school or winning the most chips.
Players take turns rolling the number die and move their piece according to the die roll. If you land on a space with a circle next to it, you earn a chip. Reaching a stop sign means you have to stop. On your next turn, you roll the colour die and can move on if you roll green. Landing on a space with an exclamation mark means you've put yourself in danger (board shows a dangerous situation) and you lose a chip.
There is also a variant that uses cards: Before crossing a road, you have to answer a road safety question printed on one of the cards.

name: Politics and Corruption
description:
As lobby and campaign spending soars to record highs, Congressional approval ratings plummet to all-time lows. Explore the influence of money on Congress while playing this educational card game.

There are two kinds of cards in the Politics and Corruption deck: bill cards representing legislation of the 112th Congress, and capital cards that are used to solicit votes and champion bills. Players take turns playing capital cards on bills until the draw pile is exhausted. Bills pass with a simple majority, meaning more than half of the votes on a bill are in support. Bills may either occupy the center of the table or be placed in front of a player who has chosen to champion them. Championed bills earns their champion more points when passed, but costs that player a point when blocked. Players also earn points by passing bills that are favored by their party, and by ending the game with lots of cards left in their hand. The player with the most points at the end of a game is the winner.

name: Grotesque Chess
description: Grotesque Chess uses all the pieces of Chess plus two more, known as the Equerry and Guard. Tthe Guard is a compound of Rook and Knight, and the Equerry is a compound of Bishop and Knight.

name: Party Joy Guidemaster Series #6: The Legend of Zelda – A Link to the Past
description:
Back from 1992 in Japan is an era where board games aren't popular much. A board game based on the acclaimed Super Famicom title , The Legend of Zelda: Triforce of the Gods,(or A link to the Past in english), plunges you into the world of obscure board gaming. An ancient relic unknown to many non-japanese speaking Zelda fans everywhere.

Not much is known about this little piece of history with no rule book opened for public eye. According to a fellow bgg translator, the back of the box vaguely claims to "teach you the secrets of the Super Famicom game". If you play this game, you can learn how to play A Link To the Past. In Japaneses! The player(s) start at town and thru playing the game, one can find out about various items and how things work. And best of all, up to three players can play! Wow!

Components used are a big mat to place cards. Cards with various enemies, tokens and tiles, a stickered die, and three poker chips as player pawns!What's different of this Zelda board game from the other two known Zelda board games so far is that it features authentic sprite art from the super famicom/Super Nes title!

"… very strange."
~Z****n

name: Frogs!
description:
In Frogs! 2-4 players vie for control of the pond by surrounding their opponents' frogs to eliminate them. When only five frogs are left in the pond, the player with the most frogs left is declared the winner. (You can play until only one player is left, but that could make for a long game.)

The pond is composed of hexagonal cards with a lily pad on one side and water on the other. Frogs can move in any direction, but only on the lily pads and only one pad at a time. Every time a frog moves, the next card over gets flipped, providing a constantly-changing playing field. Frogs are eliminated when they are surrounded by a combination of water and/or frogs of a different color.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Modular Board
publishers: The Game Crafter, LLC, Woodbine Street Games

name: Eins, zwei, drei, fertig ist die Reih
description:
A multi-use card game. This East German game was probably intended to be educational as well as fun. There are 12 sets of three, each card in a set having the same letter in the bottom corner. The three cards are related i.e. A sheep, a ball of wool and a jumper makes up the set F. In addition there is a Clever Child Card and a Schwarzer Peter card.

Various uses of the cards are described. You could play as a quartett game (as a game of Authors in America), the one collecting the most sets of three will be the winner. Or you could play as a Schwarzer Peter (Old Maid) game, the one finishing with the Schwarzer Peter card being the loser. If the parents thought that losing was harsh, then you could play a 'White Peter', the child having the Clever Child gard at the end being the winner. And you could play it as a quiz game where the parent will reveal one card of a set and ask the children in turn to name another card they might expect to see. If they can, they get the card and so on, the one with the most cards at the end being the winner.

name: Arrello
description:
from the designer's site:

Arrello is a new game, a cousin of Othello (also known as Reversi).

The game's name is a combination of the words "Arrow" and "Othello". I chose this name because the relationship between the stone you place and the stones you flip is similar to the relationship between an Amazon and an Arrow in the classic abstract game Amazons.

Arrello is a 2-player game played with two-sided stones (green on one side, red on the other), on a 7x7 square grid.

Players take turns, one player playing the stones red side up, the other green side up onto an empty space. If it is placed adjacent to a same-color stone, one can choose to flip a opponent's stone(s).

The game ends when the board is full. The player with the majority of stones in their color wins, because of the odd number of space ties are not possible.

name: Kitties
description:
The object is to "collect as many kittens" to gain more victory points.

12 cards are placed in the middle of the board and players in order to launch the eight dice to get the kittens.
Kittens can be eight different colors (red, green, blue, yellow, purple, orange, pink or multicolored). To get a card from a kitten from a color one should have two equal colors (example: two reds to win a red kitten), or two different colors (example: blue and yellow to make green a kitten).
Pink kittens are obtained with three colors (red, blue and yellow), and multicolor kitten obtained with four different colors.
Each kitten has its score and those who have not been obtained by any player are discarded to play another round with 12 kittens in the table. (rotative turns).

The game ends when all cards are played.

name: Flotte Wolle
description:
Each player has a wooden sheep that must jump four hurdles first to win the game.
The hurdles are dice-sticks. The first player rolls the first stick. Whichever result is on top is the result the player has to fulfill by rolling five dice, setting aside dice and re-rolling up to two times. If successful, the player places his/her sheep in front of the next hurdle and the second player rolls the first hurdle, etc. The first player to jump the fourth hurdle is the winner (the hurdles have more difficult tasks the further one gets).

name: Spoon
description:
Card game that you need to add real spoons to the table!

Deal 6 cards face down to each player. Put the deck face down in front of the dealer. In the centre of the table place some spoons (one less than there are players). The dealer takes a card from the drawing pile. He discards one card from his hand by placing it face down on the table to his left. The next player picks up the discard for his hand and places a discard on the table to his left, etc. The dealer always draws from the drawing pile when it's his turn. The last discard from each round is added to the discard pile, which is reshuffled and used when the drawing pile is gone. When any player completes a set (4 of a kind), he grabs a spoon. All other players then grab for a spoon too. The player who fails to get a spoon is out of the game. One spoon is removed from the table and play resumes. When there are only 2 players left, the one who grabs the last spoon is the winner.

This is not the same game as Spoons although there are similarities. This is much faster to play to a finish.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Ladorean Chess
description:
Ladorean Chess uses all the pieces of Orthodox Chess plus two more, called Cardinal and Marshall.

All pieces from Orthodox Chess move as usual, the Cardinal is a compound of Bishop and Knight, and the Marshall is a compound of Rook and Knight.

The number of pawns is increased by two on each side.

name: Checolo
description:
This unique logic based board game is sure to bring out your intellectually competitive side, as you attempt to thwart the moves of your opponent in conquering the board. The board game seamlessly blends two popular games that have grown to be all the rage among avid puzzlers. Sudoku, the game of logic and arrangement challenges players to correctly place 9 digits in a given grid, while a victory in the game of Checkers implies travelling across the board capturing your opponent’s tokens.

The game board is divided into nine quadrants of 3x3 squares each. Each player starts off with 9 tokens, each of a different color, in one corner quadrant. The goal is to move to the opposite diagonal corner quadrant of the board using the same movement style as in Checkers i.e., jumping over an adjacent piece but with the condition that no two tokens in any quadrant can be of the same color at any time during the game.

Although ideal for ages 8 years and above, this game can be attempted by virtually anyone with a penchant for logical challenges.

name: Quattrino
description:
Four player version of the game "Shut the Box".
When it's your turn, you throw the 2 dice and flip down the levers, for example if you throw a 7 you can flip down the 7 or a combination of levers like 2 and 5 or 1 and 4 and 2.
The game ends when nobody can flip down any levers. The levers that are still standing act as minus points.

name: King Billy's War
description: King Billy's War is a postcard game of the Williamite War in Ireland 1689-91 between the Catholic supporters of King James II and the Protestant followers of King William III. The Jacobites (7 brigades in green) are mostly Irish with some good cavalry and French infantry. The Williamites (10 brigades in orange) are a mix of Ulster Presbyterians and English, Dutch, Danish and Huguenot troops. The two players control brigades and move them from point to point across Ireland. The Jacobites begin with the advantage, but the Williamites have large reinforcements and will predominate in the second half of the game. If either side can win control over all of Ireland they win, otherwise the game is a draw.

name: Buntspatz
description:
A die rolling and guessing game for toddlers.

Aim of the game:
To be the first to collect the six birds in the colour of one's own player board.

Setup:
Each player gets a player board. If you are playing with fewer than 4 players, the remaining boards are put in the middle of the table. Each boards show a house, a fence in the player's colour, sky and meadows. It also has embossed 6 bird silhouettes in which the wooden birds fit.
The birds are put into the bag.

Gameplay:
Players take turns rolling the die. If it shows a bag symbol with one or two dots, the active player takes the corresponding number of birds out of the bag (without looking) and places them on the board of that colour. Then the die is passed on to the next player. If the hand symbol is rolled, one, two or three (again determined by the number of dots next to the symbol) birds are taken from the bag and shown to the other players. The active player then puts his/her hands under the table and secretly distributes the birds between his/her two hands and closes them. Both hands, still closed, are presented to the player on the left. He/she picks a hand. If there are birds in that hand, they are placed on the board of the matching colours. If there are birds in the other hand, they are put back into the bag.

name: Malifaux: Order of the Chimera
description:
This box set expands the universe of Malifaux by adding the Order of the Chimera. The Order includes Marcus (leader), Myranda, Sabertooth Cerberus and Razorspine Rattler.

From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki:
The beastmaster of Malifaux, Marcus causes animals of all varieties and alliances to succumb to his will and follow him into battle. Little is known at this time about his background, but he helps the Arcanists and the Miners/ Steamfitters Union by his own means. Like the rest of the Arcanists he take his orders from Ramos.

Marcus is one of the few Masters who can hire Minions from any faction... as long as they have the Beast characteristic. He is a hit-and-run style Master, not doing a lot of damage on his own, but relying on his Beasts to do the heavy lifting.

Typically seen by many players as one of the weakest Masters in the game, but other folks contest it simply a matter of learning how to utilize him. He is certainly a fun and versatile Master to play, and if you decide to start a Marcus Crew, his wide choice of minions inevitably ends up encouraging you to expand to additional Masters, since you'll have the models to form the foundation of those crews.

name: Operation Drumbeat
description:
Following Japan’s attack on Pearl Harbor on December 7, 1941, Germany swiftly joined its Axis partner and declared war on the United States on Dec. 11, 1941. Admiral Karl Dönitz, commander of Germany’s much-feared u-boat fleet, altered his strategy to bring the maritime war to America’s east coast. Where once he relied on German submarines preying on supply convoys on the open Atlantic Ocean, now he deployed long-range Type-IX u-boats to prowl the American coastal waters along which freighters and tankers sailed to convoy assembly points in the Canadian maritime.

Initially u-boat commanders took advantage of America’s unprepared defenses, hunting easy targets with few patrols and even coastal cities lit up, ignoring wartime blackout precautions; but the Americans quickly mustered their forces for war, increasing their patrols by aircraft and destroyers and ultimately chasing the German u-boats from the East Coast and back into wolf pack formations to prowl the North Atlantic once again.

Operation Drumbeat is a solitaire game in which a player assumes the role of a u-boat commander sent to hunt shipping along America’s East Coast in early 1942. The player plots a course on a grid map like the ones used by German submarine captains to travel to the patrol area and hunt targets. A series of charts helps simulate the chances of running into American patrols, encountering freighters and tankers, and attacking them with torpedoes and deck guns. Each turn equals one day; the player tracks the u-boat’s progress in a log much like actual German submarine captains used. How many ships can a captain sink before his u-boat runs out of torpedoes…or luck?
categories: Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Shello
description:
from the designer's site:

Shello is a game for 2 players, played with chips that are white on one side and black on the other, on a 9×9 square grid (or larger, as long as there are an odd number of cells in the grid. But 9×9 is all you’ll need for a long time.)

The game starts with a set board layout.

The pieces in the corners are called Neutral Pieces. These count as both black and white. They never move and they’re never flipped, but they can be used to flip pieces of either color during the game.

Rules

1. One player plays pieces black side up, and the other plays them white side up. Starting with Black, the players take turns. On your turn you must either:
A) place a piece on an empty space orthogonally-adjacent to any friendly piece, or
B) move any friendly piece, by a chess queen’s move, to any empty space not orthogonally adjacent to any friendly pieces.

2. If you have no legal moves, you must pass.

3. After placing or moving a piece, flip all enemy pieces lying in an uninterrupted straight orthogonal or diagonal row between the piece you placed or moved and any friendly pieces.

4. The game ends when the board is full. The player with more pieces on the board wins.

name: Snype
description:
from the designer's site:

Snype is a game for 2 players, played with black and white stones, on an initially empty board hex-hex board. (Snype is an attempt to create a Y-like game, without the overwhelming strategic importance of the center spaces.)

Rules
* To begin, one player places a white stone on any empty space, and the other player decides whether to play as White or Black.
* From then on, starting with Black, the players take turns. A turn consists of two actions, which may be performed in any order: 1) place a stone of your color on any numbered empty space; and 2) optionally, move a stone in a straight line, any number of spaces up to the number on the space from which it starts, so that it lands on an empty numbered space. No jumping allowed.
* The game ends when one player creates a connected group of stones which is adjacent to at least one blue, one yellow and one red space. He wins.

name: Aarresaari
description:
A children's game based on Mauri Kunnas' version of R.L. Stevenson's Treasure Island.

Players have five cards, each of which shows three types of treasure items. The game board has three rotating wheels with the pictures of treasure, and they must be aligned so that the combinations in the cards are shown on the board. On each turn, player gets to rotate the wheels 1–3 steps, depending on a die roll.

After the active player has rotated the wheels, all players check if the combinations in their treasure cards show up on the board. If they do, players can discard the matching cards. Whoever gets rid of her cards first, wins the game.

name: Twin Draughts
description:
It's a variant of Draughts. Changes from the standard game:
1) Jumping over: when an opponent's piece is jumped over, either man or king, the player who made the move picks it up and replaces it in a free square at his choice, but of the opposite color. At the beginning, all pieces are positioned as usual on black squares, but in the following the game evolves in two parallel plays. Those plays are interconnected, since a “capture” made on squares of a color moves the jumped piece on a square of the opposite color. On his turn, a player can choose to move a piece either on the white or on the black squares. All the other movement rules remain the same.
2)Promotion: as in the standard game, a man is promoted to king when it reaches the opponent's kings row. The player that gained the promotion must choose one of his other men, remove it from the game and place it on top of the promoted piece. Each promotion makes a king from a pair of men, reducing in that way the overall number of pieces on the board.
3) Goal and scoring: the game is won by the first player that promotes all his men to kings. Each player will score one point for each king he has at the end of the game. A match should be composed of an even number of games, to be started alternately by the players. The winner is the player with the highest overall score.

name: Down the Line
description:
Players fill a grid of 16 squares with randomly-selected numbered tiles. Each grid square has a color assigned to it; only tiles matching that color may be played in that square.

Each row and column must have all 4 numbered tiles in descending order before a row can be scored. These tiles are saved for scoring at game's end. Any cleared row or column is reset with a new color pattern for its 4 squares, and may be filled again.

name: Kennst Du die Welt?
description:
Any number can play.

Three dice are used. One has letters on each side in batches of four (Example; ABCD) Another has numbers from 1 to 6. And the third has subjects (Example: Music, Theater, Literature and so on). There are four Subjects Dice included in the game so the players must choose which one to use.

Decide a start player. All three dice are thrown and players simultaneously have to think of a relevant answer. The dice determine the subject and the letter that the answer must begin with. Example: ABCD on the letter face, 3 on the number face and Music on the Subject die. The three determines that the answer must begin with a C (the third letter out of the four on the die). A possible answer would be Chopin. The first to answer correctly gets 5 points. If a 5 is thrown, the answer may begin with any of the four letters on the letter die. If a six is thrown, the dice roller gets 5 points (then the dice are passed to the next player, in a clockwise direction, for the next throw).

The first to get 100 points is the winner.

Four books are included, each with several answers for each subject.

name: Peterchens Mondfahrt
description:
The game features a race to the Moon, to retrieve the sixth leg of the May Beetle. This is a well-known German fairy story by Gerdt von Bassewitz (1873 - 1923).

The board (which is very beautiful) depicts a winding track, running from Little Peter's house to the moon. Movement is decided by a spinner which has seven sections, one to six as usual plus a Sandman section. If the Sandman is spun, the player will get an extra turn (spin again and move and then a second spin and move).

At the start each player receives 6 apples which will be needed on the journey. On the path you will collect cards featuring four Nature-Spirits; Thunder, Water, Storm and Little Star. In the latter part of the game you will use these cards to advantage.

Various spaces might demand apples to pass. Generally you will get a choice, pay X apples to carry on or wait until you land exactly on the space and then you pay less appels. At the end of the game, after you have been fired on to the moon by a cannon (really!), if you get asked for apples and you have none left, you are out of the game. Conservation of your apples is critical.

First to reach the May Beetle's leg, wins.

name: The Secret Seven
description:
Card game based on the series of books by Enid Blyton. The Secret Seven consists of Peter, Janet,Jack, Barbara, George, Pam and Colin and they always had to do detective work in each story.

The game consists of 44 cards in four suits of eleven. Each suit is represented by a different colour. The cards are numbered 2 to 12.

The player on the left of the dealer begins by taking into his hand the top card from the face¬down pack on the table. If he has a card in his hand bearing the number 7 he plays it by placing it in the centre of the table. If he has no No. 7 he may not play any other card and the play passes to the next player on his left. The second player draws the next card from the top of the pack and plays either a No. 7 card or, if the first player laid down a 7, the No. 6 or No. 8 of the same colour.
The other players follow in turn, drawing each time and playing one card if they can. The cards must always be played in order on the right or left side of the 7’s and in their proper suits in accordance with the colour of the numbers. For numbers under 7 the numerical order goes downwards, for numbers over 7 it goes upwards.

If a player cannot play a card when his turn comes he merely keeps in his hand the card he has drawn from the pack and the turn passes to the next player.

Important rule: PLAYERS MUST PLAY A CARD IF THEY HAVE ONE THAT CAN BE PLAYED BUT MUST NEVER PLAY MORE THAN ONE CARD AT EACH TURN.

The first player to use all his cards, wins.

Reimplements: Fan Tan

name: Tabuuh!
description:
This little card game consists of 32 word cards, 4 number cards and 4 ghost cards.

The word cards have four words printed on each side, numbered 1-4. The number cards are used to select one of the four words from the card.

Each player gets 8 word cards (if there are more than 4 players, the game is played in teams). Players stack their cards and put a ghost card on top of the stack. At the start of each round, each player takes the bottom card from his/her stack and also one of the number cards. The number cards determine which of the words is used. They also determine who has to ask whom. The aim is to ask the other player a question that he/she will either answer wrongly or with the word on the card. For example, if the word is "vampire", the player could ask "What creature drinks blood and dislikes garlic." If the other player gives an incorrect answer, no answer at all or exactly the word that is on the card (in this example, "vampire"), the person who asked the question earns a point. The person who is being asked earns a point if he/she is able to give a different but correct answer.

The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Sudan Battlegame
description:
From the Introduction

The Sudan Battlegame is a fast action game in which the players are frequently making tactical decisions and taking actions. The game does not seek to simulate the Siege of Khartoum or the battle of Omdurman, but rather small unit combat and tactics.

The scene is the Sudan in the time of Kitchener and Gordon (1880 to 1897). The forces in the conflict during this time had extremely different abilities, methods of fighting, and morale. It varied from the extreme of "crack" British units with rigid discipline to the wild and uncertain Beja tribesmen who relied on ambush, the sword, the dagger, and spear to dispatch opponents.

As with most battle and wargames, including very complex Pentagon computer simulations, random events are part of the game. The winning player, or team, is often the one who best deals with risk assessment.

Therefore, it is essential that the players have some understanding of chance and probabilities. This game utilizes both six-sided and 10-sided (percentile) dice to simulate move distances, resolve combat.

name: Absurd Words
description:
A game of hilarious results. Shuffle the letter cards, take turns choosing them, then make up a sentence of words starting with each of the letters in the order picked. All you have to do is make up the funniest sentence with the letters given. Complexity is determined by how many cards you use.

All contained in a 5.5 cm cube.

name: Victoria's Battles Book One: Egypt and the Sudan 1881-1898
description:
From the Introduction

Between 1837 and 1901, Great Britain found itself in a virtual state of constant warfare. Military expeditions undertaken to protect and expand the Empire became an accepted facet of Victorian life. When compared to great military encounters such as the Seven Years War, the Napoleonic Wars, and the unprecedented World Wars of the Twentieth Century, Britain's colonial wars were small affairs. Yet each produced a more prominent and stronger Empire. The entire period is a portrait of British martial zeal.

This is a set of highly playable rules that is well thought out and well tested The rules allow for the playing of battles covering Britain's colonial wars in Egypt and the Sudan between the years 1881 and 1898. Also included is one introductory scenario and three historically based scenarios.

The rules are designed to play any size action using figure scales between 15mm and 25/30mm, Modifications for the use of smaller scle figures is easy. We recommend the mounting of of multiple smaller figures on the same size bases given for 15mm figures. The unit scale is variable. The rules allow for a flexible playing scale that can be used to play small patrol level games up to the largest battle of the period, Omdurman.

name: Klappjakten
description:
User summary

A grid-based game with a christmas present theme. Players start with distributing the other player's presents around the room, and the goal of the game is to reach all of your presents, open them and leave the room first of all. As presents are opened, a card affecting the active player or other players is drawn, and the player also get a wrapping paper marker, which can be dropped to block other players from reaching their presents.

The game title means "Present Hunt".

name: Ultimate Chibi Defenders: Wedding Party Rockers
description: Wedding Party Rockers is an expansion of Ultimate Chibi Defenders: Wedding Edition. It includes 6 new Heroes, a game board extension so that Wedding Crashers may now approach the cake from 4 directions, 1 new class of Wedding Crasher - the Dog Party - that cannot be blocked, new rules for adding abilities to the Dragon and Wedding Crashers to increase difficulty (and reference cards to compliment) and a new, alternate boss - the Master of Ceremonies.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Imperialism
description:
User summary

A card game about themed on political intrigue. In hand, players have cards representing individuals with a rank from 1 to 6.
